contents.verseText: These are the words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests in Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.
contents: These are the words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests in Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.

contents.verseText: The word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in the thirteenth year of the reign of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah,
contents: The word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in the thirteenth year of the reign of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah,

contents.verseText: and through the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, until the fifth month of the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah king of Judah, when the people of Jerusalem went into exile.
contents: and through the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, until the fifth month of the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah king of Judah, when the people of Jerusalem went into exile.

contents.verseText: The word of the LORD came to me, saying:
contents: The word of the LORD came to me, saying:

contents.verseText: “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, and before you were born I set you apart and appointed you as a prophet to the nations.”
contents: “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you,
and before you were born I set you apart
and appointed you as a prophet to the nations.”

contents.verseText: “Ah, Lord GOD,” I said, “I surely do not know how to speak, for I am only a child!”
contents: “Ah, Lord GOD,” I said, “I surely do not know how to speak, for I am only a child!”

contents.verseText: But the LORD told me: “Do not say, ‘I am only a child.’ For to everyone I send you, you must go, and all that I command you, you must speak.
contents: But the LORD told me:
“Do not say,
‘I am only a child.’
For to everyone I send you,
you must go,
and all that I command you,
you must speak.

contents.verseText: Do not be afraid of them, for I am with you to deliver you,” declares the LORD.
contents: Do not be afraid of them,
for I am with you to deliver you,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD reached out His hand, touched my mouth, and said to me: “Behold, I have put My words in your mouth.
contents: Then the LORD reached out His hand, touched my mouth, and said to me:
“Behold, I have put My words
in your mouth.

contents.verseText: See, I have appointed you today over nations and kingdoms to uproot and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and plant.”
contents: See, I have appointed you today
over nations and kingdoms
to uproot and tear down,
to destroy and overthrow,
to build and plant.”

contents.verseText: And the word of the LORD came to me, asking, “Jeremiah, what do you see?” “I see a branch of an almond tree,” I replied.
contents: And the word of the LORD came to me, asking, “Jeremiah, what do you see?”
“I see a branch of an almond tree,” I replied.

contents.verseText: “You have observed correctly,” said the LORD, “for I am watching over My word to accomplish it.”
contents: “You have observed correctly,” said the LORD, “for I am watching

footnote.ft: The Hebrew for watching sounds like the Hebrew for almond tree.

contents: over My word to accomplish it.”

contents.verseText: Again the word of the LORD came to me, asking, “What do you see?” “I see a boiling pot,” I replied, “and it is tilting toward us from the north.”
contents: Again the word of the LORD came to me, asking, “What do you see?”
“I see a boiling pot,” I replied, “and it is tilting toward us from the north.”

contents.verseText: Then the LORD said to me, “Disaster from the north will be poured out on all who live in the land.
contents: Then the LORD said to me, “Disaster from the north will be poured out on all who live in the land.

contents.verseText: For I am about to summon all the clans and kingdoms of the north,” declares the LORD. “Their kings will come and set up their thrones at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem. They will attack all her surrounding walls and all the other cities of Judah.
contents: For I am about to summon all the clans and kingdoms of the north,” declares the LORD.
“Their kings will come and set up their thrones
at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem.
They will attack all her surrounding walls
and all the other cities of Judah.

contents.verseText: I will pronounce My judgments against them for all their wickedness, because they have forsaken Me to burn incense to other gods and to worship the works of their own hands.
contents: I will pronounce My judgments against them
for all their wickedness,
because they have forsaken Me
to burn incense to other gods
and to worship the works of their own hands.

contents.verseText: Get yourself ready. Stand up and tell them everything that I command you. Do not be intimidated by them, or I will terrify you before them.
contents: Get yourself ready.

footnote.ft: Hebrew Gird up your loins.

contents: Stand up and tell them everything that I command you. Do not be intimidated by them, or I will terrify you before them.

contents.verseText: Now behold, this day I have made you like a fortified city, an iron pillar, and bronze walls against the whole land—against the kings of Judah, its officials, its priests, and the people of the land.
contents: Now behold, this day I have made you like a fortified city, an iron pillar, and bronze walls against the whole land—against the kings of Judah, its officials, its priests, and the people of the land.

contents.verseText: They will fight against you but will never overcome you, since I am with you to deliver you,” declares the LORD.
contents: They will fight against you but will never overcome you, since I am with you to deliver you,” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
contents: Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

contents.verseText: “Go and proclaim in the hearing of Jerusalem that this is what the LORD says: ‘I remember the devotion of your youth, your love as a bride, how you followed Me in the wilderness, in a land not sown.
contents: “Go and proclaim in the hearing of Jerusalem that this is what the LORD says:
‘I remember the devotion of your youth,
your love as a bride,
how you followed Me in the wilderness,
in a land not sown.

contents.verseText: Israel was holy to the LORD, the firstfruits of His harvest. All who devoured her found themselves guilty; disaster came upon them,’” declares the LORD.
contents: Israel was holy to the LORD,
the firstfruits of His harvest.
All who devoured her
found themselves guilty;
disaster came upon them,’”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Hear the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob, and all you families of the house of Israel.
contents: Hear the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob, and all you families of the house of Israel.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “What fault did your fathers find in Me that they strayed so far from Me, and followed worthless idols, and became worthless themselves?
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“What fault did your fathers find in Me
that they strayed so far from Me,
and followed worthless idols,
and became worthless themselves?

contents.verseText: They did not ask, ‘Where is the LORD who brought us up from the land of Egypt, who led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and pits, a land of drought and darkness, a land where no one travels and no one lives?’
contents: They did not ask, ‘Where is the LORD
who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
who led us through the wilderness,
through a land of deserts and pits,
a land of drought and darkness,
a land where no one travels and no one lives?’

contents.verseText: I brought you into a fertile land to eat its fruit and bounty, but you came and defiled My land, and made My inheritance detestable.
contents: I brought you into a fertile land
to eat its fruit and bounty,
but you came and defiled My land,
and made My inheritance detestable.

contents.verseText: The priests did not ask, ‘Where is the LORD?’ The experts in the law no longer knew Me, and the leaders rebelled against Me. The prophets prophesied by Baal and followed useless idols.
contents: The priests did not ask,
‘Where is the LORD?’
The experts in the law no longer knew Me,
and the leaders rebelled against Me.
The prophets prophesied by Baal
and followed useless idols.

contents.verseText: Therefore, I will contend with you again, declares the LORD, and I will bring a case against your children’s children.
contents: Therefore, I will contend with you again,
declares the LORD,
and I will bring a case
against your children’s children.

contents.verseText: Cross over to the coasts of Cyprus and take a look; send to Kedar and consider carefully; see if there has ever been anything like this:
contents: Cross over to the coasts of Cyprus

footnote.ft: Hebrew Kittim

contents: and take a look;
send to Kedar and consider carefully;
see if there has ever been anything like this:

contents.verseText: Has a nation ever changed its gods, though they are no gods at all? Yet My people have exchanged their Glory for useless idols.
contents: Has a nation ever changed its gods,
though they are no gods at all?
Yet My people have exchanged their Glory

footnote.ft: Or their glorious God

contents: for useless idols.

contents.verseText: Be stunned by this, O heavens; be shocked and utterly appalled,” declares the LORD.
contents: Be stunned by this, O heavens;
be shocked and utterly appalled,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “For My people have committed two evils: They have forsaken Me, the fountain of living water, and they have dug their own cisterns—broken cisterns that cannot hold water.
contents: “For My people have committed two evils:
They have forsaken Me,
the fountain of living water,
and they have dug their own cisterns—
broken cisterns that cannot hold water.

contents.verseText: Is Israel a slave? Was he born into slavery? Why then has he become prey?
contents: Is Israel a slave?
Was he born into slavery?
Why then has he become prey?

contents.verseText: The young lions have roared at him; they have growled with a loud voice. They have laid waste his land; his cities lie in ruins, without inhabitant.
contents: The young lions have roared at him;
they have growled with a loud voice.
They have laid waste his land;
his cities lie in ruins, without inhabitant.

contents.verseText: The men of Memphis and Tahpanhes have shaved the crown of your head.
contents: The men of Memphis

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew Noph

contents: and Tahpanhes
have shaved the crown of your head.

contents.verseText: Have you not brought this on yourself by forsaking the LORD your God when He led you in the way?
contents: Have you not brought this on yourself
by forsaking the LORD your God
when He led you in the way?

contents.verseText: Now what will you gain on your way to Egypt to drink the waters of the Nile? What will you gain on your way to Assyria to drink the waters of the Euphrates?
contents: Now what will you gain on your way to Egypt
to drink the waters of the Nile

footnote.ft: Hebrew of Shihor, a branch of the Nile River

contents: What will you gain on your way to Assyria
to drink the waters of the Euphrates

footnote.ft: Hebrew the River

contents.verseText: Your own evil will discipline you; your own apostasies will reprimand you. Consider and realize how evil and bitter it is for you to forsake the LORD your God and to have no fear of Me,” declares the Lord GOD of Hosts.
contents: Your own evil will discipline you;
your own apostasies will reprimand you.
Consider and realize
how evil and bitter it is
for you to forsake the LORD your God
and to have no fear of Me,”
declares the Lord GOD of Hosts.

contents.verseText: “For long ago you broke your yoke and tore off your chains, saying, ‘I will not serve!’ Indeed, on every high hill and under every green tree you lay down as a prostitute.
contents: “For long ago you broke your yoke
and tore off your chains,
saying, ‘I will not serve!’
Indeed, on every high hill
and under every green tree
you lay down as a prostitute.

contents.verseText: I had planted you like a choice vine from the very best seed. How could you turn yourself before Me into a rotten, wild vine?
contents: I had planted you like a choice vine
from the very best seed.
How could you turn yourself before Me
into a rotten, wild vine?

contents.verseText: Although you wash with lye and use an abundance of soap, the stain of your guilt is still before Me,” declares the Lord GOD.
contents: Although you wash with lye
and use an abundance of soap,
the stain of your guilt
is still before Me,”
declares the Lord GOD.

contents.verseText: “How can you say, ‘I am not defiled; I have not run after the Baals’? Look at your behavior in the valley; acknowledge what you have done. You are a swift young she-camel galloping here and there,
contents: “How can you say, ‘I am not defiled;
I have not run after the Baals’?
Look at your behavior in the valley;
acknowledge what you have done.
You are a swift young she-camel
galloping here and there,

contents.verseText: a wild donkey at home in the wilderness, sniffing the wind in the heat of her desire. Who can restrain her passion? All who seek her need not weary themselves; in mating season they will find her.
contents: a wild donkey at home in the wilderness,
sniffing the wind in the heat of her desire.
Who can restrain her passion?
All who seek her need not weary themselves;
in mating season they will find her.

contents.verseText: You should have kept your feet from going bare and your throat from being thirsty. But you said, ‘It is hopeless! For I love foreign gods, and I must go after them.’
contents: You should have kept your feet from going bare
and your throat from being thirsty.
But you said, ‘It is hopeless!
For I love foreign gods,
and I must go after them.’

contents.verseText: As the thief is ashamed when he is caught, so the house of Israel is disgraced. They, their kings, their officials, their priests, and their prophets
contents: As the thief is ashamed when he is caught,
so the house of Israel is disgraced.
They, their kings, their officials,
their priests, and their prophets

contents.verseText: say to a tree, ‘You are my father,’ and to a stone, ‘You gave me birth.’ For they have turned their backs to Me and not their faces, yet in the time of trouble they beg, ‘Rise up and save us!’
contents: say to a tree, ‘You are my father,’
and to a stone, ‘You gave me birth.’
For they have turned their backs to Me
and not their faces,
yet in the time of trouble they beg,
‘Rise up and save us!’

contents.verseText: But where are the gods you made for yourselves? Let them rise up in your time of trouble and save you if they can; for your gods are as numerous as your cities, O Judah.
contents: But where are the gods you made for yourselves?
Let them rise up in your time of trouble
and save you if they can;
for your gods are as numerous
as your cities, O Judah.

contents.verseText: Why do you bring a case against Me? You have all rebelled against Me,” declares the LORD.
contents: Why do you bring a case against Me?
You have all rebelled against Me,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “I have struck your sons in vain; they accepted no discipline. Your own sword has devoured your prophets like a voracious lion.”
contents: “I have struck your sons in vain;
they accepted no discipline.
Your own sword has devoured your prophets
like a voracious lion.”

contents.verseText: You people of this generation, consider the word of the LORD: “Have I been a wilderness to Israel or a land of dense darkness? Why do My people say, ‘We are free to roam; we will come to You no more’?
contents: You people of this generation, consider the word of the LORD:
“Have I been a wilderness to Israel
or a land of dense darkness?
Why do My people say,
‘We are free to roam;
we will come to You no more’?

contents.verseText: Does a maiden forget her jewelry or a bride her wedding sash? Yet My people have forgotten Me for days without number.
contents: Does a maiden forget her jewelry
or a bride her wedding sash?
Yet My people have forgotten Me
for days without number.

contents.verseText: How skillfully you pursue love! Even the most immoral of women could learn from your ways.
contents: How skillfully you pursue love!
Even the most immoral of women
could learn from your ways.

contents.verseText: Moreover, your skirts are stained with the blood of the innocent poor, though you did not find them breaking in. But in spite of all these things
contents: Moreover, your skirts are stained
with the blood of the innocent poor,
though you did not find them breaking in.
But in spite of all these things

contents.verseText: you say, ‘I am innocent. Surely His anger will turn from me.’ Behold, I will judge you, because you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
contents: you say, ‘I am innocent.
Surely His anger will turn from me.’
Behold, I will judge you,
because you say, ‘I have not sinned.’

contents.verseText: How unstable you are, constantly changing your ways! You will be disappointed by Egypt just as you were by Assyria.
contents: How unstable you are,
constantly changing your ways!
You will be disappointed by Egypt
just as you were by Assyria.

contents.verseText: Moreover, you will leave that place with your hands on your head, for the LORD has rejected those you trust; you will not prosper by their help.”
contents: Moreover, you will leave that place
with your hands on your head,
for the LORD has rejected those you trust;
you will not prosper by their help.”

contents.verseText: “If a man divorces his wife and she leaves him to marry another, can he ever return to her? Would not such a land be completely defiled? But you have played the harlot with many lovers—and you would return to Me?” declares the LORD.
contents: “If a man divorces his wife
and she leaves him to marry another,
can he ever return to her?
Would not such a land be completely defiled?
But you have played the harlot with many lovers—
and you would return to Me?”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Lift up your eyes to the barren heights and see. Is there any place where you have not been violated? You sat beside the highways waiting for your lovers, like a nomad in the desert. You have defiled the land with your prostitution and wickedness.
contents: “Lift up your eyes to the barren heights and see.
Is there any place where you have not been violated?
You sat beside the highways waiting for your lovers,
like a nomad in the desert.
You have defiled the land
with your prostitution and wickedness.

contents.verseText: Therefore the showers have been withheld, and no spring rains have fallen. Yet you have the brazen look of a prostitute; you refuse to be ashamed.
contents: Therefore the showers have been withheld,
and no spring rains have fallen.
Yet you have the brazen look of a prostitute;
you refuse to be ashamed.

contents.verseText: Have you not just called to Me, ‘My Father, You are my friend from youth.
contents: Have you not just called to Me,
‘My Father, You are my friend from youth.

contents.verseText: Will He be angry forever? Will He be indignant to the end?’ This you have spoken, but you keep doing all the evil you can.”
contents: Will He be angry forever?
Will He be indignant to the end?’
This you have spoken,
but you keep doing all the evil you can.”

contents.verseText: Now in the days of King Josiah, the LORD said to me, “Have you seen what faithless Israel has done? She has gone up on every high hill and under every green tree to prostitute herself there.
contents: Now in the days of King Josiah, the LORD said to me, “Have you seen what faithless Israel has done? She has gone up on every high hill and under every green tree to prostitute herself there.

contents.verseText: I thought that after she had done all these things, she would return to Me. But she did not return, and her unfaithful sister Judah saw it.
contents: I thought that after she had done all these things, she would return to Me. But she did not return, and her unfaithful sister Judah saw it.

contents.verseText: She saw that because faithless Israel had committed adultery, I gave her a certificate of divorce and sent her away. Yet that unfaithful sister Judah had no fear and prostituted herself as well.
contents: She saw

footnote.ft: DSS, one LXX manuscript, and Syriac; MT I saw

contents: that because faithless Israel had committed adultery, I gave her a certificate of divorce and sent her away. Yet that unfaithful sister Judah had no fear and prostituted herself as well.

contents.verseText: Indifferent to her own infidelity, Israel had defiled the land and committed adultery with stones and trees.
contents: Indifferent to her own infidelity, Israel had defiled the land and committed adultery with stones and trees.

contents.verseText: Yet in spite of all this, her unfaithful sister Judah did not return to Me with all her heart, but only in pretense,” declares the LORD.
contents: Yet in spite of all this, her unfaithful sister Judah did not return to Me with all her heart, but only in pretense,” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: And the LORD said to me, “Faithless Israel has shown herself more righteous than unfaithful Judah.
contents: And the LORD said to me, “Faithless Israel has shown herself more righteous than unfaithful Judah.

contents.verseText: Go, proclaim this message toward the north: ‘Return, O faithless Israel,’ declares the LORD. ‘I will no longer look on you with anger, for I am merciful,’ declares the LORD. ‘I will not be angry forever.
contents: Go, proclaim this message toward the north:
‘Return, O faithless Israel,’ declares the LORD.
‘I will no longer look on you with anger,
for I am merciful,’ declares the LORD.
‘I will not be angry forever.

contents.verseText: Only acknowledge your guilt, that you have rebelled against the LORD your God. You have scattered your favors to foreign gods under every green tree and have not obeyed My voice,’” declares the LORD.
contents: Only acknowledge your guilt,
that you have rebelled against the LORD your God.
You have scattered your favors to foreign gods
under every green tree
and have not obeyed My voice,’”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Return, O faithless children,” declares the LORD, “for I am your master, and I will take you—one from a city and two from a family—and bring you to Zion.
contents: “Return, O faithless children,” declares the LORD, “for I am your master, and I will take you—one from a city and two from a family—and bring you to Zion.

contents.verseText: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.”
contents: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.”

contents.verseText: “In those days, when you multiply and increase in the land,” declares the LORD, “they will no longer discuss the ark of the covenant of the LORD. It will never come to mind, and no one will remember it or miss it, nor will another one be made.
contents: “In those days, when you multiply and increase in the land,” declares the LORD, “they will no longer discuss the ark of the covenant of the LORD. It will never come to mind, and no one will remember it or miss it, nor will another one be made.

contents.verseText: At that time Jerusalem will be called The Throne of the LORD, and all the nations will be gathered in Jerusalem to honor the name of the LORD. They will no longer follow the stubbornness of their evil hearts.
contents: At that time Jerusalem will be called The Throne of the LORD, and all the nations will be gathered in Jerusalem to honor the name of the LORD. They will no longer follow the stubbornness of their evil hearts.

contents.verseText: In those days the house of Judah will walk with the house of Israel, and they will come together from the land of the north to the land that I gave to your fathers as an inheritance.
contents: In those days the house of Judah will walk with the house of Israel, and they will come together from the land of the north to the land that I gave to your fathers as an inheritance.

contents.verseText: Then I said, ‘How I long to make you My sons and give you a desirable land, the most beautiful inheritance of all the nations!’ I thought you would call Me ‘Father’ and never turn away from following Me.
contents: Then I said, ‘How I long to make you My sons
and give you a desirable land,
the most beautiful inheritance
of all the nations!’
I thought you would call Me ‘Father’
and never turn away from following Me.

contents.verseText: But as a woman may betray her husband, so you have betrayed Me, O house of Israel,” declares the LORD.
contents: But as a woman may betray her husband,
so you have betrayed Me, O house of Israel,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: A voice is heard on the barren heights, the children of Israel weeping and begging for mercy, because they have perverted their ways and forgotten the LORD their God.
contents: A voice is heard on the barren heights,
the children of Israel weeping and begging for mercy,
because they have perverted their ways
and forgotten the LORD their God.

contents.verseText: “Return, O faithless children, and I will heal your faithlessness.” “Here we are. We come to You, for You are the LORD our God.
contents: “Return, O faithless children,
and I will heal your faithlessness.”
“Here we are. We come to You,
for You are the LORD our God.

contents.verseText: Surely deception comes from the hills, and commotion from the mountains. Surely the salvation of Israel is in the LORD our God.
contents: Surely deception comes from the hills,
and commotion from the mountains.
Surely the salvation of Israel
is in the LORD our God.

contents.verseText: From our youth, that shameful god has consumed what our fathers have worked for—their flocks and herds, their sons and daughters.
contents: From our youth, that shameful god
has consumed what our fathers have worked for—
their flocks and herds,
their sons and daughters.

contents.verseText: Let us lie down in our shame; let our disgrace cover us. We have sinned against the LORD our God, both we and our fathers; from our youth even to this day we have not obeyed the voice of the LORD our God.”
contents: Let us lie down in our shame;
let our disgrace cover us.
We have sinned against the LORD our God,
both we and our fathers;
from our youth even to this day
we have not obeyed the voice of the LORD our God.”

contents.verseText: “If you will return, O Israel, return to Me,” declares the LORD. “If you will remove your detestable idols from My sight and no longer waver,
contents: “If you will return, O Israel,
return to Me,” declares the LORD.
“If you will remove your detestable idols from My sight
and no longer waver,

contents.verseText: and if you can swear, ‘As surely as the LORD lives,’ in truth, in justice, and in righteousness, then the nations will be blessed by Him, and in Him they will glory.”
contents: and if you can swear, ‘As surely as the LORD lives,’
in truth, in justice, and in righteousness,
then the nations will be blessed by Him,
and in Him they will glory.”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says to the men of Judah and Jerusalem: “Break up your unplowed ground, and do not sow among the thorns.
contents: For this is what the LORD says to the men of Judah and Jerusalem:
“Break up your unplowed ground,
and do not sow among the thorns.

contents.verseText: Circumcise yourselves to the LORD, and remove the foreskins of your hearts, O men of Judah and people of Jerusalem. Otherwise, My wrath will break out like fire and burn with no one to extinguish it, because of your evil deeds.”
contents: Circumcise yourselves to the LORD,
and remove the foreskins of your hearts,
O men of Judah and people of Jerusalem.
Otherwise, My wrath will break out like fire
and burn with no one to extinguish it,
because of your evil deeds.”

contents.verseText: Announce in Judah, proclaim in Jerusalem, and say: “Blow the ram’s horn throughout the land. Cry aloud and say, ‘Assemble yourselves and let us flee to the fortified cities.’
contents: Announce in Judah, proclaim in Jerusalem, and say:
“Blow the ram’s horn throughout the land.
Cry aloud and say,
‘Assemble yourselves
and let us flee to the fortified cities.’

contents.verseText: Raise a signal flag toward Zion. Seek refuge! Do not delay! For I am bringing disaster from the north, and terrible destruction.
contents: Raise a signal flag toward Zion.
Seek refuge! Do not delay!
For I am bringing disaster from the north,
and terrible destruction.

contents.verseText: A lion has gone up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations has set out. He has left his lair to lay waste your land. Your cities will be reduced to ruins and lie uninhabited.
contents: A lion has gone up from his thicket,
and a destroyer of nations has set out.
He has left his lair
to lay waste your land.
Your cities will be reduced to ruins
and lie uninhabited.

contents.verseText: So put on sackcloth, mourn and wail, for the fierce anger of the LORD has not turned away from us.”
contents: So put on sackcloth,
mourn and wail,
for the fierce anger of the LORD
has not turned away from us.”

contents.verseText: “In that day,” declares the LORD, “the king and officials will lose their courage. The priests will tremble in fear, and the prophets will be astounded.”
contents: “In that day,” declares the LORD,
“the king and officials will lose their courage.
The priests will tremble in fear,
and the prophets will be astounded.”

contents.verseText: Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD, how completely You have deceived this people and Jerusalem by saying, ‘You will have peace,’ while a sword is at our throats.”
contents: Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD, how completely You have deceived this people and Jerusalem by saying, ‘You will have peace,’ while a sword is at our throats.”

contents.verseText: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, “A searing wind from the barren heights in the desert blows toward the daughter of My people, but not to winnow or to sift;
contents: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, “A searing wind from the barren heights in the desert blows toward the daughter of My people, but not to winnow or to sift;

contents.verseText: a wind too strong for that comes from Me. Now I also pronounce judgments against them.”
contents: a wind too strong for that comes from Me. Now I also pronounce judgments against them.”

contents.verseText: Behold, he advances like the clouds, his chariots like the whirlwind. His horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us, for we are ruined!
contents: Behold, he advances like the clouds,
his chariots like the whirlwind.
His horses are swifter than eagles.
Woe to us, for we are ruined!

contents.verseText: Wash the evil from your heart, O Jerusalem, so that you may be saved. How long will you harbor wicked thoughts within you?
contents: Wash the evil from your heart, O Jerusalem,
so that you may be saved.
How long will you harbor
wicked thoughts within you?

contents.verseText: For a voice resounds from Dan, proclaiming disaster from the hills of Ephraim.
contents: For a voice resounds from Dan,
proclaiming disaster from the hills of Ephraim.

contents.verseText: Warn the nations now! Proclaim to Jerusalem: “A besieging army comes from a distant land; they raise their voices against the cities of Judah.
contents: Warn the nations now!
Proclaim to Jerusalem:
“A besieging army comes from a distant land;
they raise their voices against the cities of Judah.

contents.verseText: They surround her like men guarding a field, because she has rebelled against Me,” declares the LORD.
contents: They surround her like men guarding a field,
because she has rebelled against Me,” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Your ways and deeds have brought this upon you. This is your punishment; how bitter it is, because it pierces to the heart!”
contents: “Your ways and deeds
have brought this upon you.
This is your punishment; how bitter it is,
because it pierces to the heart!”

contents.verseText: My anguish, my anguish! I writhe in pain! Oh, the pain in my chest! My heart pounds within me; I cannot be silent. For I have heard the sound of the horn, the alarm of battle.
contents: My anguish, my anguish! I writhe in pain!
Oh, the pain in my chest!
My heart pounds within me;
I cannot be silent.
For I have heard the sound of the horn,
the alarm of battle.

contents.verseText: Disaster after disaster is proclaimed, for the whole land is laid waste. My tents are destroyed in an instant, my curtains in a moment.
contents: Disaster after disaster is proclaimed,
for the whole land is laid waste.
My tents are destroyed in an instant,
my curtains in a moment.

contents.verseText: How long must I see the signal flag and hear the sound of the horn?
contents: How long must I see the signal flag
and hear the sound of the horn?

contents.verseText: “For My people are fools; they have not known Me. They are foolish children, without understanding. They are skilled in doing evil, but they know not how to do good.”
contents: “For My people are fools;
they have not known Me.
They are foolish children,
without understanding.
They are skilled in doing evil,
but they know not how to do good.”

contents.verseText: I looked at the earth, and it was formless and void; I looked to the heavens, and they had no light.
contents: I looked at the earth,
and it was formless and void;
I looked to the heavens,
and they had no light.

contents.verseText: I looked at the mountains, and behold, they were quaking; all the hills were swaying.
contents: I looked at the mountains,
and behold, they were quaking;
all the hills were swaying.

contents.verseText: I looked, and no man was left; all the birds of the air had fled.
contents: I looked, and no man was left;
all the birds of the air had fled.

contents.verseText: I looked, and the fruitful land was a desert. All its cities were torn down before the LORD, before His fierce anger.
contents: I looked, and the fruitful land was a desert.
All its cities were torn down
before the LORD,
before His fierce anger.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: “The whole land will be desolate, but I will not finish its destruction.
contents: For this is what the LORD says:
“The whole land will be desolate,
but I will not finish its destruction.

contents.verseText: Therefore the earth will mourn and the heavens above will grow dark. I have spoken, I have planned, and I will not relent or turn back.”
contents: Therefore the earth will mourn
and the heavens above will grow dark.
I have spoken, I have planned,
and I will not relent or turn back.”

contents.verseText: Every city flees at the sound of the horseman and archer. They enter the thickets and climb among the rocks. Every city is abandoned; no inhabitant is left.
contents: Every city flees
at the sound of the horseman and archer.
They enter the thickets
and climb among the rocks.
Every city is abandoned;
no inhabitant is left.

contents.verseText: And you, O devastated one, what will you do, though you dress yourself in scarlet, though you adorn yourself with gold jewelry, though you enlarge your eyes with paint? You adorn yourself in vain; your lovers despise you; they want to take your life.
contents: And you, O devastated one, what will you do,
though you dress yourself in scarlet,
though you adorn yourself with gold jewelry,
though you enlarge your eyes with paint?
You adorn yourself in vain; your lovers despise you;
they want to take your life.

contents.verseText: For I hear a cry like a woman in labor, a cry of anguish like one bearing her first child—the cry of the Daughter of Zion gasping for breath, stretching out her hands to say, “Woe is me, for my soul faints before the murderers!”
contents: For I hear a cry like a woman in labor,
a cry of anguish like one bearing her first child—
the cry of the Daughter of Zion gasping for breath,
stretching out her hands to say,
“Woe is me,
for my soul faints before the murderers!”

contents.verseText: “Go up and down the streets of Jerusalem. Look now and take note; search her squares. If you can find a single person, anyone who acts justly, anyone who seeks the truth, then I will forgive the city.
contents: “Go up and down the streets of Jerusalem.
Look now and take note; search her squares.
If you can find a single person,
anyone who acts justly,
anyone who seeks the truth,
then I will forgive the city.

contents.verseText: Although they say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives,’ they are swearing falsely.”
contents: Although they say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives,’
they are swearing falsely.”

contents.verseText: O LORD, do not Your eyes look for truth? You struck them, but they felt no pain. You finished them off, but they refused to accept discipline. They have made their faces harder than stone and refused to repent.
contents: O LORD, do not Your eyes look for truth?
You struck them, but they felt no pain.
You finished them off,
but they refused to accept discipline.
They have made their faces harder than stone
and refused to repent.

contents.verseText: Then I said, “They are only the poor; they have played the fool, for they do not know the way of the LORD, the justice of their God.
contents: Then I said, “They are only the poor;
they have played the fool,
for they do not know the way of the LORD,
the justice of their God.

contents.verseText: I will go to the powerful and speak to them. Surely they know the way of the LORD, the justice of their God.” But they too, with one accord, had broken the yoke and torn off the chains.
contents: I will go to the powerful
and speak to them.
Surely they know the way of the LORD,
the justice of their God.”
But they too, with one accord, had broken the yoke
and torn off the chains.

contents.verseText: Therefore a lion from the forest will strike them down, a wolf from the desert will ravage them. A leopard will lie in wait near their cities, and everyone who ventures out will be torn to pieces. For their rebellious acts are many, and their unfaithful deeds are numerous.
contents: Therefore a lion from the forest will strike them down,
a wolf from the desert will ravage them.
A leopard will lie in wait near their cities,
and everyone who ventures out will be torn to pieces.
For their rebellious acts are many,
and their unfaithful deeds are numerous.

contents.verseText: “Why should I forgive you? Your children have forsaken Me and sworn by gods that are not gods. I satisfied their needs, yet they committed adultery and assembled at the houses of prostitutes.
contents: “Why should I forgive you?
Your children have forsaken Me
and sworn by gods that are not gods.
I satisfied their needs, yet they committed adultery
and assembled at the houses of prostitutes.

contents.verseText: They are well-fed, lusty stallions, each neighing after his neighbor’s wife.
contents: They are well-fed, lusty stallions,
each neighing after his neighbor’s wife.

contents.verseText: Should I not punish them for these things?” declares the LORD. “Should I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?
contents: Should I not punish them for these things?”
declares the LORD.
“Should I not avenge Myself
on such a nation as this?

contents.verseText: Go up through her vineyards and ravage them, but do not finish them off. Strip off her branches, for they do not belong to the LORD.
contents: Go up through her vineyards and ravage them,
but do not finish them off.
Strip off her branches,
for they do not belong to the LORD.

contents.verseText: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have been utterly unfaithful to Me,” declares the LORD.
contents: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah
have been utterly unfaithful to Me,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: They have lied about the LORD and said: “He will not do anything; harm will not come to us; we will not see sword or famine.
contents: They have lied about the LORD and said:
“He will not do anything; harm will not come to us;
we will not see sword or famine.

contents.verseText: The prophets are but wind, for the word is not in them. So let their own predictions befall them.”
contents: The prophets are but wind,
for the word is not in them.
So let their own predictions befall them.

footnote.ft: Literally let this befall them.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD God of Hosts says: “Because you have spoken this word, I will make My words a fire in your mouth and this people the wood it consumes.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD God of Hosts says:
“Because you have spoken this word,
I will make My words a fire in your mouth
and this people the wood it consumes.

contents.verseText: Behold, I am bringing a distant nation against you, O house of Israel,” declares the LORD. “It is an established nation, an ancient nation, a nation whose language you do not know and whose speech you do not understand.
contents: Behold, I am bringing a distant nation against you,
O house of Israel,” declares the LORD.
“It is an established nation,
an ancient nation,
a nation whose language you do not know
and whose speech you do not understand.

contents.verseText: Their quivers are like open graves; they are all mighty men.
contents: Their quivers are like open graves;
they are all mighty men.

contents.verseText: They will devour your harvest and food; they will consume your sons and daughters; they will eat up your flocks and herds; they will feed on your vines and fig trees. With the sword they will destroy the fortified cities in which you trust.”
contents: They will devour your harvest and food;
they will consume your sons and daughters;
they will eat up your flocks and herds;
they will feed on your vines and fig trees.
With the sword they will destroy
the fortified cities in which you trust.”

contents.verseText: “Yet even in those days,” declares the LORD, “I will not make a full end of you.
contents: “Yet even in those days,” declares the LORD, “I will not make a full end of you.

contents.verseText: And when the people ask, ‘For what offense has the LORD our God done all these things to us?’ You are to tell them, ‘Just as you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your land, so will you serve foreigners in a land that is not your own.’”
contents: And when the people ask, ‘For what offense has the LORD our God done all these things to us?’ You are to tell them, ‘Just as you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your land, so will you serve foreigners in a land that is not your own.’”

contents.verseText: Declare this in the house of Jacob and proclaim it in Judah:
contents: Declare this in the house of Jacob and proclaim it in Judah:

contents.verseText: “Hear this, O foolish and senseless people, who have eyes but do not see, who have ears but do not hear.
contents: “Hear this,
O foolish and senseless people,
who have eyes but do not see,
who have ears but do not hear.

contents.verseText: Do you not fear Me?” declares the LORD. “Do you not tremble before Me, the One who set the sand as the boundary for the sea, an enduring barrier it cannot cross? The waves surge, but they cannot prevail. They roar but cannot cross it.
contents: Do you not fear Me?”
declares the LORD.
“Do you not tremble before Me,
the One who set the sand as the boundary for the sea,
an enduring barrier it cannot cross?
The waves surge, but they cannot prevail.
They roar but cannot cross it.

contents.verseText: But these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts. They have turned aside and gone away.
contents: But these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts.
They have turned aside and gone away.

contents.verseText: They have not said in their hearts, ‘Let us fear the LORD our God, who gives the rains, both autumn and spring, in season, who keeps for us the appointed weeks of harvest.’
contents: They have not said in their hearts,
‘Let us fear the LORD our God,
who gives the rains, both autumn and spring, in season,
who keeps for us the appointed weeks of harvest.’

contents.verseText: Your iniquities have diverted these from you; your sins have deprived you of My bounty.
contents: Your iniquities have diverted these from you;
your sins have deprived you of My bounty.

contents.verseText: For among My people are wicked men; they watch like fowlers lying in wait; they set a trap to catch men.
contents: For among My people are wicked men;
they watch like fowlers lying in wait;
they set a trap to catch men.

contents.verseText: Like cages full of birds, so their houses are full of deceit. Therefore they have become powerful and rich.
contents: Like cages full of birds,
so their houses are full of deceit.
Therefore they have become powerful and rich.

contents.verseText: They have grown fat and sleek, and have excelled in the deeds of the wicked. They have not taken up the cause of the fatherless, that they might prosper; nor have they defended the rights of the needy.
contents: They have grown fat and sleek,
and have excelled in the deeds of the wicked.
They have not taken up the cause of the fatherless,
that they might prosper;
nor have they defended
the rights of the needy.

contents.verseText: Should I not punish them for these things?” declares the LORD. “Should I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?
contents: Should I not punish them for these things?”
declares the LORD.
“Should I not avenge Myself
on such a nation as this?

contents.verseText: A horrible and shocking thing has happened in the land.
contents: A horrible and shocking thing
has happened in the land.

contents.verseText: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests rule by their own authority. My people love it so, but what will you do in the end?
contents: The prophets prophesy falsely,
and the priests rule by their own authority.
My people love it so,
but what will you do in the end?

contents.verseText: “Run for cover, O sons of Benjamin; flee from Jerusalem! Sound the ram’s horn in Tekoa; send up a signal over Beth-haccherem, for disaster looms from the north, even great destruction.
contents: “Run for cover, O sons of Benjamin;
flee from Jerusalem!
Sound the ram’s horn in Tekoa;
send up a signal over Beth-haccherem,
for disaster looms from the north,
even great destruction.

contents.verseText: Though she is beautiful and delicate, I will destroy the Daughter of Zion.
contents: Though she is beautiful and delicate,
I will destroy the Daughter of Zion.

footnote.ft: Or To a lovely and delicate woman I have likened the Daughter of Zion

contents.verseText: Shepherds and their flocks will come against her; they will pitch their tents all around her, each tending his own portion:
contents: Shepherds and their flocks
will come against her;
they will pitch their tents all around her,
each tending his own portion:

contents.verseText: ‘Prepare for battle against her; rise up, let us attack at noon. Woe to us, for the daylight is fading; the evening shadows grow long.
contents: ‘Prepare for battle against her;
rise up, let us attack at noon.
Woe to us, for the daylight is fading;
the evening shadows grow long.

contents.verseText: Rise up, let us attack by night and destroy her fortresses!’”
contents: Rise up, let us attack by night
and destroy her fortresses!’”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Cut down the trees and raise a siege ramp against Jerusalem. This city must be punished; there is nothing but oppression in her midst.
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Cut down the trees
and raise a siege ramp against Jerusalem.
This city must be punished;
there is nothing but oppression in her midst.

contents.verseText: As a well gushes its water, so she pours out her evil. Violence and destruction resound in her; sickness and wounds are ever before Me.
contents: As a well gushes its water,
so she pours out her evil.
Violence and destruction resound in her;
sickness and wounds are ever before Me.

contents.verseText: Be forewarned, O Jerusalem, or I will turn away from you; I will make you a desolation, a land without inhabitant.”
contents: Be forewarned, O Jerusalem,
or I will turn away from you;
I will make you a desolation,
a land without inhabitant.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Glean the remnant of Israel as thoroughly as a vine. Pass your hand once more like a grape gatherer over the branches.”
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Glean the remnant of Israel
as thoroughly as a vine.
Pass your hand once more like a grape gatherer
over the branches.”

contents.verseText: To whom can I give this warning? Who will listen to me? Look, their ears are closed, so they cannot hear. See, the word of the LORD has become offensive to them; they find no pleasure in it.
contents: To whom can I give this warning?
Who will listen to me?
Look, their ears are closed,

footnote.ft: Hebrew uncircumcised

contents: so they cannot hear.
See, the word of the LORD has become offensive to them;
they find no pleasure in it.

contents.verseText: But I am full of the LORD’s wrath; I am tired of holding it back. “Pour it out on the children in the street, and on the young men gathered together. For both husband and wife will be captured, the old and the very old alike.
contents: But I am full of the LORD’s wrath;
I am tired of holding it back.
“Pour it out on the children in the street,
and on the young men gathered together.
For both husband and wife will be captured,
the old and the very old alike.

contents.verseText: Their houses will be turned over to others, their fields and wives as well, for I will stretch out My hand against the inhabitants of the land,” declares the LORD.
contents: Their houses will be turned over to others,
their fields and wives as well,
for I will stretch out My hand
against the inhabitants of the land,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “For from the least of them to the greatest, all are greedy for gain; from prophet to priest, all practice deceit.
contents: “For from the least of them to the greatest,
all are greedy for gain;
from prophet to priest,
all practice deceit.

contents.verseText: They dress the wound of My people with very little care, saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ when there is no peace at all.
contents: They dress the wound of My people
with very little care,
saying, ‘Peace, peace,’
when there is no peace at all.

contents.verseText: Are they ashamed of the abomination they have committed? No, they have no shame at all; they do not even know how to blush. So they will fall among the fallen; when I punish them, they will collapse,” says the LORD.
contents: Are they ashamed of the abomination they have committed?
No, they have no shame at all;
they do not even know how to blush.
So they will fall among the fallen;
when I punish them, they will collapse,”
says the LORD.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Stand at the crossroads and look. Ask for the ancient paths: ‘Where is the good way?’ Then walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls. But they said, ‘We will not walk in it!’
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Stand at the crossroads and look.
Ask for the ancient paths: ‘Where is the good way?’
Then walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls.
But they said, ‘We will not walk in it!’

contents.verseText: I appointed watchmen over you and said, ‘Listen for the sound of the ram’s horn.’ But they answered, ‘We will not listen!’
contents: I appointed watchmen over you and said,
‘Listen for the sound of the ram’s horn.’
But they answered, ‘We will not listen!’

contents.verseText: Therefore hear, O nations, and learn, O congregations, what will happen to them.
contents: Therefore hear, O nations,
and learn, O congregations,
what will happen to them.

contents.verseText: Hear, O earth! I am bringing disaster on this people, the fruit of their own schemes, because they have paid no attention to My word and have rejected My instruction.
contents: Hear, O earth! I am bringing disaster on this people,
the fruit of their own schemes,
because they have paid no attention to My word
and have rejected My instruction.

contents.verseText: What use to Me is frankincense from Sheba or sweet cane from a distant land? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable; your sacrifices do not please Me.”
contents: What use to Me is frankincense from Sheba
or sweet cane from a distant land?
Your burnt offerings are not acceptable;
your sacrifices do not please Me.”

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: “I will lay stumbling blocks before this people; fathers and sons alike will be staggered; friends and neighbors will perish.”
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says:
“I will lay stumbling blocks before this people;
fathers and sons alike will be staggered;
friends and neighbors will perish.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Behold, an army is coming from the land of the north; a great nation is stirred up from the ends of the earth.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Behold, an army is coming
from the land of the north;
a great nation is stirred up
from the ends of the earth.

contents.verseText: They grasp the bow and spear; they are cruel and merciless. Their voice roars like the sea, and they ride upon horses, lined up like men in formation against you, O Daughter of Zion.”
contents: They grasp the bow and spear;

footnote.ft: Or javelin

contents: they are cruel and merciless.
Their voice roars like the sea,
and they ride upon horses,
lined up like men in formation
against you, O Daughter of Zion.”

contents.verseText: We have heard the report; our hands hang limp. Anguish has gripped us, pain like that of a woman in labor.
contents: We have heard the report;
our hands hang limp.
Anguish has gripped us,
pain like that of a woman in labor.

contents.verseText: Do not go out to the fields; do not walk the road. For the enemy has a sword; terror is on every side.
contents: Do not go out to the fields;
do not walk the road.
For the enemy has a sword;
terror is on every side.

contents.verseText: O daughter of my people, dress yourselves in sackcloth and roll in ashes. Mourn with bitter wailing, as you would for an only son, for suddenly the destroyer will come upon us.
contents: O daughter of my people,
dress yourselves in sackcloth and roll in ashes.
Mourn with bitter wailing,
as you would for an only son,
for suddenly the destroyer
will come upon us.

contents.verseText: “I have appointed you to examine My people like ore, so you may know and try their ways.
contents: “I have appointed you to examine My people like ore,

footnote.ft: Or to examine My people, a fortress

contents: so you may know and try their ways.

contents.verseText: All are hardened rebels, walking around as slanderers. They are bronze and iron; all of them are corrupt.
contents: All are hardened rebels,
walking around as slanderers.
They are bronze and iron;
all of them are corrupt.

contents.verseText: The bellows blow fiercely, blasting away the lead with fire. The refining proceeds in vain, for the wicked are not purged.
contents: The bellows blow fiercely,
blasting away the lead with fire.
The refining proceeds in vain,
for the wicked are not purged.

contents.verseText: They are called rejected silver, because the LORD has rejected them.”
contents: They are called rejected silver,
because the LORD has rejected them.”

s1: Jeremiah’s Message at the Temple Gate

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

contents.verseText: “Stand in the gate of the house of the LORD and proclaim this message: Hear the word of the LORD, all you people of Judah who enter through these gates to worship the LORD.
contents: “Stand in the gate of the house of the LORD and proclaim this message: Hear the word of the LORD, all you people of Judah who enter through these gates to worship the LORD.

contents.verseText: Thus says the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Correct your ways and deeds, and I will let you live in this place.
contents: Thus says the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Correct your ways and deeds, and I will let you live in this place.

contents.verseText: Do not trust in deceptive words, chanting: ‘This is the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD.’
contents: Do not trust in deceptive words, chanting:
‘This is the temple of the LORD,
the temple of the LORD,
the temple of the LORD.’

contents.verseText: For if you really correct your ways and deeds, if you act justly toward one another,
contents: For if you really correct your ways and deeds, if you act justly toward one another,

contents.verseText: if you no longer oppress the foreigner and the fatherless and the widow, and if you no longer shed innocent blood in this place or follow other gods to your own harm,
contents: if you no longer oppress the foreigner and the fatherless and the widow, and if you no longer shed innocent blood in this place or follow other gods to your own harm,

contents.verseText: then I will let you live in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers forever and ever.
contents: then I will let you live in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers forever and ever.

contents.verseText: But look, you keep trusting in deceptive words to no avail.
contents: But look, you keep trusting in deceptive words to no avail.

contents.verseText: Will you steal and murder, commit adultery and perjury, burn incense to Baal, and follow other gods that you have not known,
contents: Will you steal and murder, commit adultery and perjury, burn incense to Baal, and follow other gods that you have not known,

contents.verseText: and then come and stand before Me in this house, which bears My Name, and say, ‘We are delivered, so we can continue with all these abominations’?
contents: and then come and stand before Me in this house, which bears My Name, and say, ‘We are delivered, so we can continue with all these abominations’?

contents.verseText: Has this house, which bears My Name, become a den of robbers in your sight? Yes, I too have seen it, declares the LORD.
contents: Has this house, which bears My Name, become a den of robbers

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 21:13, Mark 11:17, and Luke 19:46

contents: in your sight? Yes, I too have seen it, declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: But go now to the place in Shiloh where I first made a dwelling for My Name, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.
contents: But go now to the place in Shiloh where I first made a dwelling for My Name, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.

contents.verseText: And now, because you have done all these things, declares the LORD, and because I have spoken to you again and again but you would not listen, and I have called to you but you would not answer,
contents: And now, because you have done all these things, declares the LORD, and because I have spoken to you again and again

footnote.ft: Literally I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking,

contents: but you would not listen, and I have called to you but you would not answer,

contents.verseText: therefore what I did to Shiloh I will now do to the house that bears My Name, the house in which you trust, the place that I gave to you and your fathers.
contents: therefore what I did to Shiloh I will now do to the house that bears My Name, the house in which you trust, the place that I gave to you and your fathers.

contents.verseText: And I will cast you out of My presence, just as I have cast out all your brothers, all the descendants of Ephraim.
contents: And I will cast you out of My presence, just as I have cast out all your brothers, all the descendants of Ephraim.

contents.verseText: As for you, do not pray for these people, do not offer a plea or petition on their behalf, and do not beg Me, for I will not listen to you.
contents: As for you, do not pray for these people, do not offer a plea or petition on their behalf, and do not beg Me, for I will not listen to you.

contents.verseText: Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
contents: Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

contents.verseText: The sons gather wood, the fathers light the fire, and the women knead the dough to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven; they pour out drink offerings to other gods to provoke Me to anger.
contents: The sons gather wood, the fathers light the fire, and the women knead the dough to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven; they pour out drink offerings to other gods to provoke Me to anger.

contents.verseText: But am I the One they are provoking? declares the LORD. Is it not themselves they spite, to their own shame?
contents: But am I the One they are provoking? declares the LORD. Is it not themselves they spite, to their own shame?

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the Lord GOD says: Behold, My anger and My fury will be poured out on this place, on man and beast, on the trees of the field and the produce of the land, and it will burn and not be extinguished.
contents: Therefore this is what the Lord GOD says: Behold, My anger and My fury will be poured out on this place, on man and beast, on the trees of the field and the produce of the land, and it will burn and not be extinguished.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat yourselves!
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat yourselves!

contents.verseText: For when I brought your fathers out of the land of Egypt, I did not merely command them about burnt offerings and sacrifices,
contents: For when I brought your fathers out of the land of Egypt, I did not merely command them about burnt offerings and sacrifices,

contents.verseText: but this is what I commanded them: Obey Me, and I will be your God, and you will be My people. You must walk in all the ways I have commanded you, so that it may go well with you.
contents: but this is what I commanded them: Obey Me, and I will be your God, and you will be My people. You must walk in all the ways I have commanded you, so that it may go well with you.

contents.verseText: Yet they did not listen or incline their ear, but they followed the stubborn inclinations of their own evil hearts. They went backward and not forward.
contents: Yet they did not listen or incline their ear, but they followed the stubborn inclinations of their own evil hearts. They went backward and not forward.

contents.verseText: From the day your fathers came out of the land of Egypt until this day, I have sent you all My servants the prophets again and again.
contents: From the day your fathers came out of the land of Egypt until this day, I have sent you all My servants the prophets again and again.

footnote.ft: Literally I have sent you all My servants the prophets daily, rising up early and sending (them).

contents.verseText: Yet they would not listen to Me or incline their ear, but they stiffened their necks and did more evil than their fathers.
contents: Yet they would not listen to Me or incline their ear, but they stiffened their necks and did more evil than their fathers.

contents.verseText: When you tell them all these things, they will not listen to you. When you call to them, they will not answer.
contents: When you tell them all these things, they will not listen to you. When you call to them, they will not answer.

contents.verseText: Therefore you must say to them, ‘This is the nation that would not listen to the voice of the LORD their God and would not receive correction. Truth has perished; it has disappeared from their lips.
contents: Therefore you must say to them, ‘This is the nation that would not listen to the voice of the LORD their God and would not receive correction. Truth has perished; it has disappeared from their lips.

contents.verseText: Cut off your hair and throw it away. Raise up a lamentation on the barren heights, for the LORD has rejected and forsaken the generation of His wrath.’
contents: Cut off your hair and throw it away. Raise up a lamentation on the barren heights, for the LORD has rejected and forsaken the generation of His wrath.’

contents.verseText: For the people of Judah have done evil in My sight, declares the LORD. They have set up their abominations in the house that bears My Name, and so have defiled it.
contents: For the people of Judah have done evil in My sight, declares the LORD. They have set up their abominations in the house that bears My Name, and so have defiled it.

contents.verseText: They have built the high places of Topheth in the Valley of Hinnom so they could burn their sons and daughters in the fire—something I never commanded, nor did it even enter My mind.
contents: They have built the high places of Topheth in the Valley of Hinnom so they could burn their sons and daughters in the fire—something I never commanded, nor did it even enter My mind.

contents.verseText: So behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when this place will no longer be called Topheth and the Valley of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter. For they will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.
contents: So behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when this place will no longer be called Topheth and the Valley of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter. For they will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.

contents.verseText: The corpses of this people will become food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth, and there will be no one to scare them away.
contents: The corpses of this people will become food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth, and there will be no one to scare them away.

contents.verseText: I will remove from the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem the sounds of joy and gladness and the voices of the bride and bridegroom, for the land will become a wasteland.”
contents: I will remove from the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem the sounds of joy and gladness and the voices of the bride and bridegroom, for the land will become a wasteland.”

contents.verseText: “At that time,” declares the LORD, “the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of the officials, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem will be removed from their graves.
contents: “At that time,” declares the LORD, “the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of the officials, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem will be removed from their graves.

contents.verseText: They will be exposed to the sun and moon, and to all the host of heaven which they have loved, served, followed, consulted, and worshiped. Their bones will not be gathered up or buried, but will become like dung lying on the ground.
contents: They will be exposed to the sun and moon, and to all the host of heaven which they have loved, served, followed, consulted, and worshiped. Their bones will not be gathered up or buried, but will become like dung lying on the ground.

contents.verseText: And wherever I have banished them, the remnant of this evil family will choose death over life,” declares the LORD of Hosts.
contents: And wherever I have banished them, the remnant of this evil family will choose death over life,” declares the LORD of Hosts.

contents.verseText: So you are to tell them this is what the LORD says: “Do men fall and not get up again? Does one turn away and not return?
contents: So you are to tell them this is what the LORD says:
“Do men fall and not get up again?
Does one turn away and not return?

contents.verseText: Why then have these people turned away? Why does Jerusalem always turn away? They cling to deceit; they refuse to return.
contents: Why then have these people turned away?
Why does Jerusalem always turn away?
They cling to deceit;
they refuse to return.

contents.verseText: I have listened and heard; they do not speak what is right. No one repents of his wickedness, asking, ‘What have I done?’ Everyone has pursued his own course like a horse charging into battle.
contents: I have listened and heard;
they do not speak what is right.
No one repents of his wickedness,
asking, ‘What have I done?’
Everyone has pursued his own course
like a horse charging into battle.

contents.verseText: Even the stork in the sky knows her appointed seasons. The turtledove, the swift, and the thrush keep their time of migration, but My people do not know the requirements of the LORD.
contents: Even the stork in the sky
knows her appointed seasons.
The turtledove, the swift, and the thrush

footnote.ft: The precise identification of some of these birds is uncertain.

contents: keep their time of migration,
but My people do not know
the requirements of the LORD.

contents.verseText: How can you say, ‘We are wise, and the Law of the LORD is with us,’ when in fact the lying pen of the scribes has produced a deception?
contents: How can you say, ‘We are wise,
and the Law of the LORD is with us,’
when in fact the lying pen of the scribes
has produced a deception?

contents.verseText: The wise will be put to shame; they will be dismayed and trapped. Since they have rejected the word of the LORD, what wisdom do they really have?
contents: The wise will be put to shame;
they will be dismayed and trapped.
Since they have rejected the word of the LORD,
what wisdom do they really have?

contents.verseText: Therefore I will give their wives to other men and their fields to new owners. For from the least of them to the greatest, all are greedy for gain; from prophet to priest, all practice deceit.
contents: Therefore I will give their wives to other men
and their fields to new owners.
For from the least of them to the greatest,
all are greedy for gain;
from prophet to priest,
all practice deceit.

contents.verseText: They dress the wound of the daughter of My people with very little care, saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ when there is no peace at all.
contents: They dress the wound of the daughter of My people
with very little care,
saying, ‘Peace, peace,’
when there is no peace at all.

contents.verseText: Are they ashamed of the abomination they have committed? No, they have no shame at all; they do not even know how to blush. So they will fall among the fallen; when I punish them, they will collapse, says the LORD.
contents: Are they ashamed of the abomination they have committed?
No, they have no shame at all;
they do not even know how to blush.
So they will fall among the fallen;
when I punish them, they will collapse,
says the LORD.

contents.verseText: I will take away their harvest, declares the LORD. There will be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the tree, and even the leaf will wither. Whatever I have given them will be lost to them.”
contents: I will take away their harvest,
declares the LORD.
There will be no grapes on the vine,
nor figs on the tree,
and even the leaf will wither.
Whatever I have given them will be lost to them.”

contents.verseText: Why are we just sitting here? Gather together, let us flee to the fortified cities and perish there, for the LORD our God has doomed us. He has given us poisoned water to drink, because we have sinned against the LORD.
contents: Why are we just sitting here?
Gather together,
let us flee to the fortified cities and perish there,
for the LORD our God has doomed us.
He has given us poisoned water to drink,
because we have sinned against the LORD.

contents.verseText: We hoped for peace, but no good has come, for a time of healing, but there was only terror.
contents: We hoped for peace,
but no good has come,
for a time of healing,
but there was only terror.

contents.verseText: The snorting of enemy horses is heard from Dan. At the sound of the neighing of mighty steeds, the whole land quakes. They come to devour the land and everything in it, the city and all who dwell in it.
contents: The snorting of enemy horses
is heard from Dan.
At the sound of the neighing of mighty steeds,
the whole land quakes.
They come to devour the land and everything in it,
the city and all who dwell in it.

contents.verseText: “For behold, I will send snakes among you, vipers that cannot be charmed, and they will bite you,” declares the LORD.
contents: “For behold, I will send snakes among you,
vipers that cannot be charmed,
and they will bite you,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: My sorrow is beyond healing; my heart is faint within me.
contents: My sorrow is beyond healing;

footnote.ft: Or O my Comforter in sorrow,

contents: my heart is faint within me.

contents.verseText: Listen to the cry of the daughter of my people from a land far away: “Is the LORD no longer in Zion? Is her King no longer there?” “Why have they provoked Me to anger with their carved images, with their worthless foreign idols?”
contents: Listen to the cry of the daughter of my people
from a land far away:
“Is the LORD no longer in Zion?
Is her King no longer there?”
“Why have they provoked Me to anger
with their carved images,
with their worthless foreign idols?”

contents.verseText: “The harvest has passed, the summer has ended, but we have not been saved.”
contents: “The harvest has passed, the summer has ended,
but we have not been saved.”

contents.verseText: For the brokenness of the daughter of my people I am crushed. I mourn; horror has gripped me.
contents: For the brokenness of the daughter of my people I am crushed.
I mourn; horror has gripped me.

contents.verseText: Is there no balm in Gilead? Is no physician there? Why then has the health of the daughter of my people not been restored?
contents: Is there no balm in Gilead?
Is no physician there?
Why then has the health of the daughter of my people
not been restored?

contents.verseText: Oh, that my head were a spring of water, and my eyes a fountain of tears! I would weep day and night over the slain daughter of my people.
contents: Oh, that my head were a spring of water,
and my eyes a fountain of tears!
I would weep day and night
over the slain daughter of my people.

contents.verseText: If only I had a traveler’s lodge in the wilderness, I would abandon my people and depart from them, for they are all adulterers, a crowd of faithless people.
contents: If only I had a traveler’s lodge in the wilderness,
I would abandon my people and depart from them,
for they are all adulterers,
a crowd of faithless people.

contents.verseText: “They bend their tongues like bows; lies prevail over truth in the land. For they proceed from evil to evil, and they do not take Me into account,” declares the LORD.
contents: “They bend their tongues like bows;
lies prevail over truth in the land.
For they proceed from evil to evil,
and they do not take Me into account,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Let everyone guard against his neighbor; do not trust any brother, for every brother deals craftily, and every friend spreads slander.
contents: “Let everyone guard against his neighbor;
do not trust any brother,
for every brother deals craftily,
and every friend spreads slander.

contents.verseText: Each one betrays his friend; no one tells the truth. They have taught their tongues to lie; they wear themselves out committing iniquity.
contents: Each one betrays his friend;
no one tells the truth.
They have taught their tongues to lie;
they wear themselves out committing iniquity.

contents.verseText: You dwell in the midst of deception; in their deceit they refuse to know Me,” declares the LORD.
contents: You dwell

footnote.ft: That is, Jeremiah dwells (the Hebrew is singular)

contents: in the midst of deception;
in their deceit they refuse to know Me,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Behold, I will refine them and test them, for what else can I do because of the daughter of My people?
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Behold, I will refine them and test them,
for what else can I do
because of

footnote.ft: LXX because of the wickedness of

contents: the daughter of My people?

contents.verseText: Their tongues are deadly arrows; they speak deception. With his mouth a man speaks peace to his neighbor, but in his heart he sets a trap for him.
contents: Their tongues are deadly arrows;
they speak deception.
With his mouth a man speaks peace to his neighbor,
but in his heart he sets a trap for him.

contents.verseText: Should I not punish them for these things? declares the LORD. Should I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?”
contents: Should I not punish them for these things?
declares the LORD.
Should I not avenge Myself
on such a nation as this?”

contents.verseText: I will take up a weeping and wailing for the mountains, a dirge over the wilderness pasture, for they have been scorched so no one passes through, and the lowing of cattle is not heard. Both the birds of the air and the beasts have fled; they have gone away.
contents: I will take up a weeping and wailing for the mountains,
a dirge over the wilderness pasture,
for they have been scorched so no one passes through,
and the lowing of cattle is not heard.
Both the birds of the air and the beasts have fled;
they have gone away.

contents.verseText: “And I will make Jerusalem a heap of rubble, a haunt for jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.”
contents: “And I will make Jerusalem a heap of rubble,
a haunt for jackals;

footnote.ft: Or serpents or dragons

contents: and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation,
without inhabitant.”

contents.verseText: Who is the man wise enough to understand this? To whom has the mouth of the LORD spoken, that he may explain it? Why is the land destroyed and scorched like a desert, so no one can pass through it?
contents: Who is the man wise enough to understand this? To whom has the mouth of the LORD spoken, that he may explain it? Why is the land destroyed and scorched like a desert, so no one can pass through it?

contents.verseText: And the LORD answered, “It is because they have forsaken My law, which I set before them; they have not walked in it or obeyed My voice.
contents: And the LORD answered, “It is because they have forsaken My law, which I set before them; they have not walked in it or obeyed My voice.

contents.verseText: Instead, they have followed the stubbornness of their hearts and gone after the Baals, as their fathers taught them.”
contents: Instead, they have followed the stubbornness of their hearts and gone after the Baals, as their fathers taught them.”

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will feed this people wormwood and give them poisoned water to drink.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will feed this people wormwood and give them poisoned water to drink.

contents.verseText: I will scatter them among the nations that neither they nor their fathers have known, and I will send a sword after them until I have finished them off.”
contents: I will scatter them among the nations that neither they nor their fathers have known, and I will send a sword after them until I have finished them off.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Take note, and summon the wailing women; send for the most skillful among them.
