contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Take note, and summon the wailing women;
send for the most skillful among them.

contents.verseText: Let them come quickly and take up a lament over us, that our eyes may overflow with tears, and our eyelids may gush with water.
contents: Let them come quickly
and take up a lament over us,
that our eyes may overflow with tears,
and our eyelids may gush with water.

contents.verseText: For the sound of wailing is heard from Zion: ‘How devastated we are! How great is our shame! For we have abandoned the land because our dwellings have been torn down.’”
contents: For the sound of wailing
is heard from Zion:
‘How devastated we are!
How great is our shame!
For we have abandoned the land
because our dwellings have been torn down.’”

contents.verseText: Now, O women, hear the word of the LORD. Open your ears to the word of His mouth. Teach your daughters to wail, and one another to lament.
contents: Now, O women, hear the word of the LORD.
Open your ears to the word of His mouth.
Teach your daughters to wail,
and one another to lament.

contents.verseText: For death has climbed in through our windows; it has entered our fortresses to cut off the children from the streets, the young men from the town squares.
contents: For death has climbed in through our windows;
it has entered our fortresses
to cut off the children from the streets,
the young men from the town squares.

contents.verseText: Declare that this is what the LORD says: “The corpses of men will fall like dung upon the open field, like newly cut grain behind the reaper, with no one to gather it.”
contents: Declare that this is what the LORD says:
“The corpses of men will fall like dung
upon the open field,
like newly cut grain behind the reaper,
with no one to gather it.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Let not the wise man boast in his wisdom, nor the strong man in his strength, nor the wealthy man in his riches.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Let not the wise man boast in his wisdom,
nor the strong man in his strength,
nor the wealthy man in his riches.

contents.verseText: But let him who boasts boast in this, that he understands and knows Me, that I am the LORD, who exercises loving devotion, justice and righteousness on the earth—for I delight in these things,” declares the LORD.
contents: But let him who boasts boast in this,
that he understands and knows Me,
that I am the LORD,

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 1:31 and 2 Corinthians 10:17

contents: who exercises loving devotion,

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew chesed are translated here and in most cases throughout the Scriptures as loving devotion; the range of meaning includes love, goodness, kindness, faithfulness, and mercy, as well as loyalty to a covenant.

contents: justice and righteousness on the earth—
for I delight in these things,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Behold, the days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when I will punish all who are circumcised yet uncircumcised:
contents: “Behold, the days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when I will punish all who are circumcised yet uncircumcised:

contents.verseText: Egypt, Judah, Edom, Ammon, Moab, and all the inhabitants of the desert who clip the hair of their temples. For all these nations are uncircumcised, and the whole house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.”
contents: Egypt, Judah, Edom, Ammon, Moab, and all the inhabitants of the desert who clip the hair of their temples. For all these nations are uncircumcised, and the whole house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.”

contents.verseText: Hear the word that the LORD speaks to you, O house of Israel.
contents: Hear the word that the LORD speaks to you, O house of Israel.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Do not learn the ways of the nations or be terrified by the signs in the heavens, though the nations themselves are terrified by them.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Do not learn the ways of the nations
or be terrified by the signs in the heavens,
though the nations themselves are terrified by them.

contents.verseText: For the customs of the peoples are worthless; they cut down a tree from the forest; it is shaped with a chisel by the hands of a craftsman.
contents: For the customs of the peoples are worthless;
they cut down a tree from the forest;
it is shaped with a chisel
by the hands of a craftsman.

contents.verseText: They adorn it with silver and gold and fasten it with hammer and nails, so that it will not totter.
contents: They adorn it with silver and gold
and fasten it with hammer and nails,
so that it will not totter.

contents.verseText: Like scarecrows in a cucumber patch, their idols cannot speak. They must be carried because they cannot walk. Do not fear them, for they can do no harm, and neither can they do any good.”
contents: Like scarecrows in a cucumber patch,
their idols cannot speak.
They must be carried
because they cannot walk.
Do not fear them, for they can do no harm,
and neither can they do any good.”

contents.verseText: There is none like You, O LORD. You are great, and Your name is mighty in power.
contents: There is none like You, O LORD.
You are great, and Your name is mighty in power.

contents.verseText: Who would not fear You, O King of nations? This is Your due. For among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like You.
contents: Who would not fear You, O King of nations?
This is Your due.
For among all the wise men of the nations,
and in all their kingdoms,
there is none like You.

contents.verseText: But they are altogether senseless and foolish, instructed by worthless idols made of wood!
contents: But they are altogether senseless and foolish,
instructed by worthless idols made of wood!

contents.verseText: Hammered silver is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz—the work of a craftsman from the hands of a goldsmith. Their clothes are blue and purple, all fashioned by skilled workers.
contents: Hammered silver is brought from Tarshish,
and gold from Uphaz—
the work of a craftsman
from the hands of a goldsmith.
Their clothes are blue and purple,
all fashioned by skilled workers.

contents.verseText: But the LORD is the true God; He is the living God and eternal King. The earth quakes at His wrath, and the nations cannot endure His indignation.
contents: But the LORD is the true God;
He is the living God and eternal King.
The earth quakes at His wrath,
and the nations cannot endure His indignation.

contents.verseText: Thus you are to tell them: “These gods, who have made neither the heavens nor the earth, will perish from this earth and from under these heavens.”
contents: Thus you are to tell them: “These gods, who have made neither the heavens nor the earth, will perish from this earth and from under these heavens.”

footnote.ft: The original text of this verse is in Aramaic.

contents.verseText: The LORD made the earth by His power; He established the world by His wisdom and stretched out the heavens by His understanding.
contents: The LORD made the earth by His power;
He established the world by His wisdom
and stretched out the heavens by His understanding.

contents.verseText: When He thunders, the waters in the heavens roar; He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth. He generates the lightning with the rain and brings forth the wind from His storehouses.
contents: When He thunders,
the waters in the heavens roar;
He causes the clouds to rise
from the ends of the earth.
He generates the lightning with the rain
and brings forth the wind from His storehouses.

contents.verseText: Every man is senseless and devoid of knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his idols. For his molten images are a fraud, and there is no breath in them.
contents: Every man is senseless and devoid of knowledge;
every goldsmith is put to shame by his idols.
For his molten images are a fraud,
and there is no breath in them.

contents.verseText: They are worthless, a work to be mocked. In the time of their punishment they will perish.
contents: They are worthless, a work to be mocked.
In the time of their punishment they will perish.

contents.verseText: The Portion of Jacob is not like these, for He is the Maker of all things, and Israel is the tribe of His inheritance—the LORD of Hosts is His name.
contents: The Portion of Jacob is not like these,
for He is the Maker of all things,
and Israel is the tribe of His inheritance—
the LORD of Hosts is His name.

contents.verseText: Gather up your belongings from this land, you who live under siege.
contents: Gather up your belongings from this land, you who live under siege.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: “Behold, at this time I will sling out the inhabitants of the land and bring distress upon them so that they may be captured.”
contents: For this is what the LORD says:
“Behold, at this time I will sling out
the inhabitants of the land
and bring distress upon them
so that they may be captured.”

contents.verseText: Woe to me because of my brokenness; my wound is grievous! But I said, “This is truly my sickness, and I must bear it.”
contents: Woe to me because of my brokenness;
my wound is grievous!
But I said, “This is truly my sickness,
and I must bear it.”

contents.verseText: My tent is destroyed, and all its ropes are snapped. My sons have departed from me and are no more. I have no one left to pitch my tent or set up my curtains.
contents: My tent is destroyed,
and all its ropes are snapped.
My sons have departed from me
and are no more.
I have no one left to pitch my tent
or set up my curtains.

contents.verseText: For the shepherds have become senseless; they do not seek the LORD. Therefore they have not prospered, and all their flock is scattered.
contents: For the shepherds have become senseless;
they do not seek the LORD.
Therefore they have not prospered,
and all their flock is scattered.

contents.verseText: Listen! The sound of a report is coming—a great commotion from the land to the north. The cities of Judah will be made a desolation, a haunt for jackals.
contents: Listen! The sound of a report is coming—
a great commotion from the land to the north.
The cities of Judah will be made a desolation,
a haunt for jackals.

footnote.ft: Or serpents or dragons

contents.verseText: I know, O LORD, that a man’s way is not his own; no one who walks directs his own steps.
contents: I know, O LORD, that a man’s way is not his own;
no one who walks directs his own steps.

contents.verseText: Correct me, O LORD, but only with justice—not in Your anger, or You will bring me to nothing.
contents: Correct me, O LORD,
but only with justice—
not in Your anger,
or You will bring me to nothing.

contents.verseText: Pour out Your wrath on the nations that do not acknowledge You, and on the families that do not call on Your name. For they have devoured Jacob; they have consumed him and finished him off; they have devastated his homeland.
contents: Pour out Your wrath on the nations
that do not acknowledge You,
and on the families
that do not call on Your name.
For they have devoured Jacob;
they have consumed him and finished him off;
they have devastated his homeland.

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

contents.verseText: “Listen to the words of this covenant and tell them to the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.
contents: “Listen to the words of this covenant and tell them to the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: You must tell them that this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Cursed is the man who does not obey the words of this covenant,
contents: You must tell them that this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Cursed is the man who does not obey the words of this covenant,

contents.verseText: which I commanded your forefathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace, saying, ‘Obey Me, and do everything I command you, and you will be My people, and I will be your God.’
contents: which I commanded your forefathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace, saying, ‘Obey Me, and do everything I command you, and you will be My people, and I will be your God.’

contents.verseText: This was in order to establish the oath I swore to your forefathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is to this day.” “Amen, LORD,” I answered.
contents: This was in order to establish the oath I swore to your forefathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is to this day.”
“Amen, LORD,” I answered.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying: Hear the words of this covenant and carry them out.
contents: Then the LORD said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying: Hear the words of this covenant and carry them out.

contents.verseText: For from the time I brought your fathers out of the land of Egypt until today, I strongly warned them again and again, saying, ‘Obey My voice.’
contents: For from the time I brought your fathers out of the land of Egypt until today, I strongly warned them again and again,

footnote.ft: Literally I earnestly warned them, rising up early and warning (them),

contents: saying, ‘Obey My voice.’

contents.verseText: Yet they would not obey or incline their ears, but each one followed the stubbornness of his evil heart. So I brought on them all the curses of this covenant I had commanded them to follow but they did not keep.”
contents: Yet they would not obey or incline their ears, but each one followed the stubbornness of his evil heart. So I brought on them all the curses of this covenant I had commanded them to follow but they did not keep.”

contents.verseText: And the LORD told me, “There is a conspiracy among the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.
contents: And the LORD told me, “There is a conspiracy among the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: They have returned to the sins of their forefathers who refused to obey My words. They have followed other gods to serve them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken the covenant I made with their fathers.
contents: They have returned to the sins of their forefathers who refused to obey My words. They have followed other gods to serve them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken the covenant I made with their fathers.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: ‘I am about to bring upon them a disaster that they cannot escape. They will cry out to Me, but I will not listen to them.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says: ‘I am about to bring upon them a disaster that they cannot escape. They will cry out to Me, but I will not listen to them.

contents.verseText: Then the cities of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to which they have been burning incense, but these gods certainly will not save them in their time of disaster.
contents: Then the cities of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to which they have been burning incense, but these gods certainly will not save them in their time of disaster.

contents.verseText: Your gods are indeed as numerous as your cities, O Judah; the altars of shame you have set up—the altars to burn incense to Baal—are as many as the streets of Jerusalem.’
contents: Your gods are indeed as numerous as your cities, O Judah; the altars of shame you have set up—the altars to burn incense to Baal—are as many as the streets of Jerusalem.’

contents.verseText: As for you, do not pray for these people. Do not raise up a cry or a prayer on their behalf, for I will not be listening when they call out to Me in their time of disaster.
contents: As for you, do not pray for these people. Do not raise up a cry or a prayer on their behalf, for I will not be listening when they call out to Me in their time of disaster.

contents.verseText: What right has My beloved in My house, having carried out so many evil schemes? Can consecrated meat avert your doom, so that you can rejoice?
contents: What right has My beloved in My house,
having carried out so many evil schemes?
Can consecrated meat avert your doom,
so that you can rejoice?

contents.verseText: The LORD once called you a flourishing olive tree, beautiful with well-formed fruit. But with a mighty roar He will set it on fire, and its branches will be consumed.
contents: The LORD once called you a flourishing olive tree,
beautiful with well-formed fruit.
But with a mighty roar He will set it on fire,
and its branches will be consumed.

contents.verseText: The LORD of Hosts, who planted you, has decreed disaster against you on account of the evil that the house of Israel and the house of Judah have brought upon themselves, provoking Me to anger by burning incense to Baal.”
contents: The LORD of Hosts, who planted you, has decreed disaster against you on account of the evil that the house of Israel and the house of Judah have brought upon themselves, provoking Me to anger by burning incense to Baal.”

contents.verseText: And the LORD informed me, so I knew. Then You showed me their deeds.
contents: And the LORD informed me, so I knew.
Then You showed me their deeds.

contents.verseText: For I was like a gentle lamb led to slaughter; I did not know that they had plotted against me: “Let us destroy the tree with its fruit; let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be remembered no more.”
contents: For I was like a gentle lamb led to slaughter;
I did not know that they had plotted against me:
“Let us destroy the tree with its fruit;
let us cut him off from the land of the living,
that his name may be remembered no more.”

contents.verseText: O LORD of Hosts, who judges righteously, who examines the heart and mind, let me see Your vengeance upon them, for to You I have committed my cause.
contents: O LORD of Hosts, who judges righteously,
who examines the heart

footnote.ft: Hebrew the kidneys

contents: and mind,
let me see Your vengeance upon them,
for to You I have committed my cause.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says concerning the people of Anathoth who are seeking your life and saying, “You must not prophesy in the name of the LORD, or you will die by our hand.”
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says concerning the people of Anathoth who are seeking your life and saying, “You must not prophesy in the name of the LORD, or you will die by our hand.”

contents.verseText: So this is what the LORD of Hosts says: “I will punish them. Their young men will die by the sword, their sons and daughters by famine.
contents: So this is what the LORD of Hosts says: “I will punish them. Their young men will die by the sword, their sons and daughters by famine.

contents.verseText: There will be no remnant, for I will bring disaster on the people of Anathoth in the year of their punishment.”
contents: There will be no remnant, for I will bring disaster on the people of Anathoth in the year of their punishment.”

contents.verseText: Righteous are You, O LORD, when I plead before You. Yet about Your judgments I wish to contend with You: Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why do all the faithless live at ease?
contents: Righteous are You, O LORD,
when I plead before You.
Yet about Your judgments
I wish to contend with You:
Why does the way of the wicked prosper?
Why do all the faithless live at ease?

contents.verseText: You planted them, and they have taken root. They have grown and produced fruit. You are ever on their lips, but far from their hearts.
contents: You planted them, and they have taken root.
They have grown and produced fruit.
You are ever on their lips,
but far from their hearts.

footnote.ft: Hebrew their kidneys

contents.verseText: But You know me, O LORD; You see me and test my heart toward You. Drag away the wicked like sheep to the slaughter and set them apart for the day of carnage.
contents: But You know me, O LORD;
You see me and test my heart toward You.
Drag away the wicked like sheep to the slaughter
and set them apart for the day of carnage.

contents.verseText: How long will the land mourn and the grass of every field be withered? Because of the evil of its residents, the animals and birds have been swept away, for the people have said, “He cannot see what our end will be.”
contents: How long will the land mourn
and the grass of every field be withered?
Because of the evil of its residents,
the animals and birds have been swept away,
for the people have said,
“He cannot see what our end will be.”

contents.verseText: “If you have raced with men on foot and they have worn you out, how can you compete with horses? If you stumble in a peaceful land, how will you do in the thickets of the Jordan?
contents: “If you have raced with men on foot
and they have worn you out,
how can you compete with horses?
If you stumble in a peaceful land,
how will you do in the thickets of the Jordan?

contents.verseText: Even your brothers—your own father’s household—even they have betrayed you; even they have cried aloud against you. Do not trust them, though they speak well of you.
contents: Even your brothers—
your own father’s household—
even they have betrayed you;
even they have cried aloud against you.
Do not trust them,
though they speak well of you.

contents.verseText: I have forsaken My house; I have abandoned My inheritance. I have given the love of My life into the hands of her enemies.
contents: I have forsaken My house;
I have abandoned My inheritance.
I have given the love of My life
into the hands of her enemies.

contents.verseText: My inheritance has become to Me like a lion in the forest. She has roared against Me; therefore I hate her.
contents: My inheritance has become to Me
like a lion in the forest.
She has roared against Me;
therefore I hate her.

contents.verseText: Is not My inheritance to Me like a speckled bird of prey with other birds of prey circling against her? Go, gather all the beasts of the field; bring them to devour her.
contents: Is not My inheritance to Me
like a speckled bird of prey
with other birds of prey

footnote.ft: Or like a speckled hyena with birds of prey

contents: circling against her?
Go, gather all the beasts of the field;
bring them to devour her.

contents.verseText: Many shepherds have destroyed My vineyard; they have trampled My plot of ground. They have turned My pleasant field into a desolate wasteland.
contents: Many shepherds have destroyed My vineyard;
they have trampled My plot of ground.
They have turned My pleasant field
into a desolate wasteland.

contents.verseText: They have made it a desolation; desolate before Me, it mourns. All the land is laid waste, but no man takes it to heart.
contents: They have made it a desolation;
desolate before Me, it mourns.
All the land is laid waste,
but no man takes it to heart.

contents.verseText: Over all the barren heights in the wilderness the destroyers have come, for the sword of the LORD devours from one end of the earth to the other. No flesh has peace.
contents: Over all the barren heights in the wilderness
the destroyers have come,
for the sword of the LORD devours
from one end of the earth to the other.
No flesh has peace.

contents.verseText: They have sown wheat but harvested thorns. They have exhausted themselves to no avail. Bear the shame of your harvest because of the fierce anger of the LORD.”
contents: They have sown wheat but harvested thorns.
They have exhausted themselves to no avail.
Bear the shame of your harvest
because of the fierce anger of the LORD.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “As for all My evil neighbors who attack the inheritance that I bequeathed to My people Israel, I am about to uproot them from their land, and I will uproot the house of Judah from among them.
contents: This is what the LORD says: “As for all My evil neighbors who attack the inheritance that I bequeathed to My people Israel, I am about to uproot them from their land, and I will uproot the house of Judah from among them.

contents.verseText: But after I have uprooted them, I will once again have compassion on them and return each one to his inheritance and to his land.
contents: But after I have uprooted them, I will once again have compassion on them and return each one to his inheritance and to his land.

contents.verseText: And if they will diligently learn the ways of My people and swear by My name, saying, ‘As surely as the LORD lives’—just as they once taught My people to swear by Baal—then they will be established among My people.
contents: And if they will diligently learn the ways of My people and swear by My name, saying, ‘As surely as the LORD lives’—just as they once taught My people to swear by Baal—then they will be established among My people.

contents.verseText: But if they will not obey, then I will uproot that nation; I will uproot it and destroy it, declares the LORD.”
contents: But if they will not obey, then I will uproot that nation; I will uproot it and destroy it, declares the LORD.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD said to me: “Go and buy yourself a linen loincloth and put it around your waist, but do not let it touch water.”
contents: This is what the LORD said to me: “Go and buy yourself a linen loincloth and put it around your waist, but do not let it touch water.”

contents.verseText: So I bought a loincloth as the LORD had instructed me, and I put it around my waist.
contents: So I bought a loincloth as the LORD had instructed me, and I put it around my waist.

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to me a second time:
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to me a second time:

contents.verseText: “Take the loincloth that you bought and are wearing, and go at once to Perath and hide it there in a crevice of the rocks.”
contents: “Take the loincloth that you bought and are wearing, and go at once to Perath

footnote.ft: Or possibly to the Euphrates; similarly in verses 5–7

contents: and hide it there in a crevice of the rocks.”

contents.verseText: So I went and hid it at Perath, as the LORD had commanded me.
contents: So I went and hid it at Perath, as the LORD had commanded me.

contents.verseText: Many days later the LORD said to me, “Arise, go to Perath, and get the loincloth that I commanded you to hide there.”
contents: Many days later the LORD said to me, “Arise, go to Perath, and get the loincloth that I commanded you to hide there.”

contents.verseText: So I went to Perath and dug up the loincloth, and I took it from the place where I had hidden it. But now it was ruined—of no use at all.
contents: So I went to Perath and dug up the loincloth, and I took it from the place where I had hidden it. But now it was ruined—of no use at all.

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to me:
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to me:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD says: In the same way I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.
contents: “This is what the LORD says: In the same way I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: These evil people, who refuse to listen to My words, who follow the stubbornness of their own hearts, and who go after other gods to serve and worship them, they will be like this loincloth—of no use at all.
contents: These evil people, who refuse to listen to My words, who follow the stubbornness of their own hearts, and who go after other gods to serve and worship them, they will be like this loincloth—of no use at all.

contents.verseText: For just as a loincloth clings to a man’s waist, so I have made the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah cling to Me, declares the LORD, so that they might be My people for My renown and praise and glory. But they did not listen.
contents: For just as a loincloth clings to a man’s waist, so I have made the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah cling to Me, declares the LORD, so that they might be My people for My renown and praise and glory. But they did not listen.

contents.verseText: Therefore you are to tell them that this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Every wineskin shall be filled with wine.’ And when they reply, ‘Don’t we surely know that every wineskin should be filled with wine?’
contents: Therefore you are to tell them that this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Every wineskin shall be filled with wine.’
And when they reply, ‘Don’t we surely know that every wineskin should be filled with wine?’

contents.verseText: then you are to tell them that this is what the LORD says: ‘I am going to fill with drunkenness all who live in this land—the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the people of Jerusalem.
contents: then you are to tell them that this is what the LORD says: ‘I am going to fill with drunkenness all who live in this land—the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the people of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: I will smash them against one another, fathers and sons alike, declares the LORD. I will allow no mercy or pity or compassion to keep Me from destroying them.’”
contents: I will smash them against one another, fathers and sons alike, declares the LORD. I will allow no mercy or pity or compassion to keep Me from destroying them.’”

contents.verseText: Listen and give heed. Do not be arrogant, for the LORD has spoken.
contents: Listen and give heed. Do not be arrogant,
for the LORD has spoken.

contents.verseText: Give glory to the LORD your God before He brings darkness, before your feet stumble on the dusky mountains. You wait for light, but He turns it into deep gloom and thick darkness.
contents: Give glory to the LORD your God
before He brings darkness,
before your feet stumble
on the dusky mountains.
You wait for light,
but He turns it into deep gloom and thick darkness.

contents.verseText: But if you do not listen, I will weep in secret because of your pride. My eyes will overflow with tears, because the LORD’s flock has been taken captive.
contents: But if you do not listen,
I will weep in secret because of your pride.
My eyes will overflow with tears,
because the LORD’s flock has been taken captive.

contents.verseText: Say to the king and to the queen mother: “Take a lowly seat, for your glorious crowns have fallen from your heads.”
contents: Say to the king
and to the queen mother:
“Take a lowly seat,
for your glorious crowns have fallen from your heads.”

contents.verseText: The cities of the Negev have been shut tight, and no one can open them. All Judah has been carried into exile, wholly taken captive.
contents: The cities of the Negev have been shut tight,
and no one can open them.
All Judah has been carried into exile,
wholly taken captive.

contents.verseText: Lift up your eyes and see those coming from the north. Where is the flock entrusted to you, the sheep that were your pride?
contents: Lift up your eyes and see
those coming from the north.
Where is the flock entrusted to you,
the sheep that were your pride?

contents.verseText: What will you say when He sets over you close allies whom you yourself trained? Will not pangs of anguish grip you, as they do a woman in labor?
contents: What will you say when He sets over you
close allies whom you yourself trained?
Will not pangs of anguish grip you,
as they do a woman in labor?

contents.verseText: And if you ask yourself, “Why has this happened to me?” It is because of the magnitude of your iniquity that your skirts have been stripped off and your body has been exposed.
contents: And if you ask yourself,
“Why has this happened to me?”
It is because of the magnitude of your iniquity
that your skirts have been stripped off
and your body has been exposed.

footnote.ft: Literally and your heels have suffered violence

contents.verseText: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? Neither are you able to do good—you who are accustomed to doing evil.
contents: Can the Ethiopian

footnote.ft: Hebrew that Cushite; that is, probably a person from the upper Nile region

contents: change his skin,
or the leopard his spots?
Neither are you able to do good—
you who are accustomed to doing evil.

contents.verseText: “I will scatter you like chaff driven by the desert wind.
contents: “I will scatter you like chaff
driven by the desert wind.

contents.verseText: This is your lot, the portion I have measured to you,” declares the LORD, “because you have forgotten Me and trusted in falsehood.
contents: This is your lot,
the portion I have measured to you,”
declares the LORD,
“because you have forgotten Me
and trusted in falsehood.

contents.verseText: So I will pull your skirts up over your face, that your shame may be seen.
contents: So I will pull your skirts up over your face,
that your shame may be seen.

contents.verseText: Your adulteries and lustful neighings, your shameless prostitution on the hills and in the fields—I have seen your detestable acts. Woe to you, O Jerusalem! How long will you remain unclean?”
contents: Your adulteries and lustful neighings,
your shameless prostitution
on the hills and in the fields—
I have seen your detestable acts.
Woe to you, O Jerusalem!
How long will you remain unclean?”

contents.verseText: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
contents: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:

contents.verseText: “Judah mourns and her gates languish. Her people wail for the land, and a cry goes up from Jerusalem.
contents: “Judah mourns
and her gates languish.
Her people wail for the land,
and a cry goes up from Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: The nobles send their servants for water; they go to the cisterns, but find no water; their jars return empty. They are ashamed and humiliated; they cover their heads.
contents: The nobles send their servants for water;
they go to the cisterns, but find no water;
their jars return empty.
They are ashamed and humiliated;
they cover their heads.

contents.verseText: The ground is cracked because no rain has fallen on the land. The farmers are ashamed; they cover their heads.
contents: The ground is cracked
because no rain has fallen on the land.
The farmers are ashamed;
they cover their heads.

contents.verseText: Even the doe in the field deserts her newborn fawn because there is no grass.
contents: Even the doe in the field deserts her newborn fawn
because there is no grass.

contents.verseText: Wild donkeys stand on barren heights; they pant for air like jackals; their eyes fail for lack of pasture.”
contents: Wild donkeys stand on barren heights;
they pant for air like jackals;

footnote.ft: Or serpents or dragons

contents: their eyes fail for lack of pasture.”

contents.verseText: Although our iniquities testify against us, O LORD, act for the sake of Your name. Indeed, our rebellions are many; we have sinned against You.
contents: Although our iniquities testify against us, O LORD,
act for the sake of Your name.
Indeed, our rebellions are many;
we have sinned against You.

contents.verseText: O Hope of Israel, its Savior in times of distress, why are You like a stranger in the land, like a traveler who stays but a night?
contents: O Hope of Israel,
its Savior in times of distress,
why are You like a stranger in the land,
like a traveler who stays but a night?

contents.verseText: Why are You like a man taken by surprise, like a warrior powerless to save? Yet You are among us, O LORD, and we are called by Your name. Do not forsake us!
contents: Why are You like a man taken by surprise,
like a warrior powerless to save?
Yet You are among us, O LORD,
and we are called by Your name.
Do not forsake us!

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says about this people: “Truly they love to wander; they have not restrained their feet. So the LORD does not accept them; He will now remember their guilt and call their sins to account.”
contents: This is what the LORD says about this people:
“Truly they love to wander;
they have not restrained their feet.
So the LORD does not accept them;
He will now remember their guilt
and call their sins to account.”

contents.verseText: Then the LORD said to me, “Do not pray for the well-being of this people.
contents: Then the LORD said to me, “Do not pray for the well-being of this people.

contents.verseText: Although they may fast, I will not listen to their cry; although they may offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Instead, I will finish them off by sword and famine and plague.”
contents: Although they may fast, I will not listen to their cry; although they may offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Instead, I will finish them off by sword and famine and plague.”

contents.verseText: “Ah, Lord GOD!” I replied, “Look, the prophets are telling them, ‘You will not see the sword or suffer famine, but I will give you lasting peace in this place.’”
contents: “Ah, Lord GOD!” I replied, “Look, the prophets are telling them, ‘You will not see the sword or suffer famine, but I will give you lasting peace in this place.’”

contents.verseText: “The prophets are prophesying lies in My name,” replied the LORD. “I did not send them or appoint them or speak to them. They are prophesying to you a false vision, a worthless divination, the futility and delusion of their own minds.
contents: “The prophets are prophesying lies in My name,” replied the LORD. “I did not send them or appoint them or speak to them. They are prophesying to you a false vision, a worthless divination, the futility and delusion of their own minds.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says about the prophets who prophesy in My name: I did not send them, yet they say, ‘No sword or famine will touch this land.’ By sword and famine these very prophets will meet their end!
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says about the prophets who prophesy in My name: I did not send them, yet they say, ‘No sword or famine will touch this land.’
By sword and famine these very prophets will meet their end!

contents.verseText: And the people to whom they prophesy will be thrown into the streets of Jerusalem because of famine and sword. There will be no one to bury them or their wives, their sons or their daughters. I will pour out their own evil upon them.
contents: And the people to whom they prophesy will be thrown into the streets of Jerusalem because of famine and sword. There will be no one to bury them or their wives, their sons or their daughters. I will pour out their own evil upon them.

contents.verseText: You are to speak this word to them: ‘My eyes overflow with tears; day and night they do not cease, for the virgin daughter of my people has been shattered by a crushing blow, a severely grievous wound.
contents: You are to speak this word to them:
‘My eyes overflow with tears;
day and night they do not cease,
for the virgin daughter of my people
has been shattered by a crushing blow,
a severely grievous wound.

contents.verseText: If I go out to the country, I see those slain by the sword; if I enter the city, I see those ravaged by famine! For both prophet and priest travel to a land they do not know.’”
contents: If I go out to the country,
I see those slain by the sword;
if I enter the city,
I see those ravaged by famine!
For both prophet and priest
travel to a land they do not know.’”

contents.verseText: Have You rejected Judah completely? Do You despise Zion? Why have You stricken us so that we are beyond healing? We hoped for peace, but no good has come, and for the time of healing, but there was only terror.
contents: Have You rejected Judah completely?
Do You despise Zion?
Why have You stricken us
so that we are beyond healing?
We hoped for peace,
but no good has come,
and for the time of healing,
but there was only terror.

contents.verseText: We acknowledge our wickedness, O LORD, the guilt of our fathers; indeed, we have sinned against You.
contents: We acknowledge our wickedness, O LORD,
the guilt of our fathers;
indeed, we have sinned against You.

contents.verseText: For the sake of Your name do not despise us; do not disgrace Your glorious throne. Remember Your covenant with us; do not break it.
contents: For the sake of Your name do not despise us;
do not disgrace Your glorious throne.
Remember Your covenant with us;
do not break it.

contents.verseText: Can the worthless idols of the nations bring rain? Do the skies alone send showers? Is this not by You, O LORD our God? So we put our hope in You, for You have done all these things.
contents: Can the worthless idols of the nations bring rain?
Do the skies alone send showers?
Is this not by You, O LORD our God?
So we put our hope in You,
for You have done all these things.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD said to me: “Even if Moses and Samuel should stand before Me, My heart would not go out to this people. Send them from My presence, and let them go.
contents: Then the LORD said to me: “Even if Moses and Samuel should stand before Me, My heart would not go out to this people. Send them from My presence, and let them go.

contents.verseText: If they ask you, ‘Where shall we go?’ you are to tell them that this is what the LORD says: ‘Those destined for death, to death; those destined for the sword, to the sword; those destined for famine, to famine; and those destined for captivity, to captivity.’
contents: If they ask you, ‘Where shall we go?’ you are to tell them that this is what the LORD says:
‘Those destined for death, to death;
those destined for the sword, to the sword;

footnote.ft: See Revelation 13:10.

contents: those destined for famine, to famine;
and those destined for captivity, to captivity.’

contents.verseText: I will appoint over them four kinds of destroyers, declares the LORD: the sword to kill, the dogs to drag away, and the birds of the air and beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
contents: I will appoint over them four kinds of destroyers, declares the LORD: the sword to kill, the dogs to drag away, and the birds of the air and beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.

contents.verseText: I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah king of Judah did in Jerusalem.
contents: I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah king of Judah did in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem? Who will mourn for you? Who will turn aside to ask about your welfare?
contents: Who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem?
Who will mourn for you?
Who will turn aside
to ask about your welfare?

contents.verseText: You have forsaken Me, declares the LORD. You have turned your back. So I will stretch out My hand against you and I will destroy you; I am weary of showing compassion.
contents: You have forsaken Me, declares the LORD.
You have turned your back.
So I will stretch out My hand against you
and I will destroy you;
I am weary of showing compassion.

contents.verseText: I will scatter them with a winnowing fork at the gates of the land. I will bereave and destroy My people who have not turned from their ways.
contents: I will scatter them with a winnowing fork
at the gates of the land.
I will bereave and destroy My people
who have not turned from their ways.

contents.verseText: I will make their widows more numerous than the sand of the sea. I will bring a destroyer at noon against the mothers of young men. I will suddenly bring upon them anguish and dismay.
contents: I will make their widows more numerous
than the sand of the sea.
I will bring a destroyer at noon
against the mothers of young men.
I will suddenly bring upon them
anguish and dismay.

contents.verseText: The mother of seven will grow faint; she will breathe her last breath. Her sun will set while it is still day; she will be disgraced and humiliated. And the rest I will put to the sword in the presence of their enemies,” declares the LORD.
contents: The mother of seven will grow faint;
she will breathe her last breath.
Her sun will set while it is still day;
she will be disgraced and humiliated.
And the rest I will put to the sword
in the presence of their enemies,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Woe to me, my mother, that you have borne me, a man of strife and conflict in all the land. I have neither lent nor borrowed, yet everyone curses me.
contents: Woe to me, my mother,
that you have borne me,
a man of strife and conflict
in all the land.
I have neither lent nor borrowed,
yet everyone curses me.

contents.verseText: The LORD said: “Surely I will deliver you for a good purpose; surely I will intercede with your enemy in your time of trouble, in your time of distress.
contents: The LORD said:
“Surely I will deliver you for a good purpose;
surely I will intercede with your enemy
in your time of trouble,
in your time of distress.

contents.verseText: Can anyone smash iron—iron from the north—or bronze?
contents: Can anyone smash iron—
iron from the north—or bronze?

contents.verseText: Your wealth and your treasures I will give up as plunder, without charge for all your sins within all your borders.
contents: Your wealth and your treasures
I will give up as plunder,
without charge for all your sins
within all your borders.

contents.verseText: Then I will enslave you to your enemies in a land you do not know, for My anger will kindle a fire that will burn against you.”
contents: Then I will enslave you to your enemies
in a land

footnote.ft: Some Hebrew manuscripts, LXX, and Syriac (see also Jeremiah 17:4); most Hebrew manuscripts Then I will cause your enemies to bring you into a land

contents: you do not know,
for My anger will kindle a fire
that will burn against you.”

contents.verseText: You understand, O LORD; remember me and attend to me. Avenge me against my persecutors. In Your patience, do not take me away. Know that I endure reproach for Your honor.
contents: You understand, O LORD;
remember me and attend to me.
Avenge me against my persecutors.
In Your patience, do not take me away.
Know that I endure reproach for Your honor.

contents.verseText: Your words were found, and I ate them. Your words became my joy and my heart’s delight. For I bear Your name, O LORD God of Hosts.
contents: Your words were found, and I ate them.
Your words became my joy
and my heart’s delight.
For I bear Your name,
O LORD God of Hosts.

contents.verseText: I never sat with the band of revelers, nor did I celebrate with them. Because Your hand was on me, I sat alone, for You have filled me with indignation.
contents: I never sat with the band of revelers,
nor did I celebrate with them.
Because Your hand was on me, I sat alone,
for You have filled me with indignation.

contents.verseText: Why is my pain unending, and my wound incurable, refusing to be healed? You have indeed become like a mirage to me—water that is not there.
contents: Why is my pain unending,
and my wound incurable,
refusing to be healed?
You have indeed become like a mirage to me—
water that is not there.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: “If you return, I will restore you; you will stand in My presence. And if you speak words that are noble instead of worthless, you will be My spokesman. It is they who must turn to you, but you must not turn to them.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says:
“If you return, I will restore you;
you will stand in My presence.
And if you speak words that are noble instead of worthless,
you will be My spokesman.
It is they who must turn to you,
but you must not turn to them.

contents.verseText: Then I will make you a wall to this people, a fortified wall of bronze; they will fight against you but will not overcome you, for I am with you to save and deliver you, declares the LORD.
contents: Then I will make you a wall to this people,
a fortified wall of bronze;
they will fight against you
but will not overcome you,
for I am with you to save and deliver you,
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked and redeem you from the grasp of the ruthless.”
contents: I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked
and redeem you from the grasp of the ruthless.”

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

contents.verseText: “You must not marry or have sons or daughters in this place.”
contents: “You must not marry or have sons or daughters in this place.”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says concerning the sons and daughters born in this place, and the mothers who bore them, and the fathers who fathered them in this land:
contents: For this is what the LORD says concerning the sons and daughters born in this place, and the mothers who bore them, and the fathers who fathered them in this land:

contents.verseText: “They will die from deadly diseases. They will not be mourned or buried, but will lie like dung on the ground. They will be finished off by sword and famine, and their corpses will become food for the birds of the air and beasts of the earth.”
contents: “They will die from deadly diseases. They will not be mourned or buried, but will lie like dung on the ground. They will be finished off by sword and famine, and their corpses will become food for the birds of the air and beasts of the earth.”

contents.verseText: Indeed, this is what the LORD says: “Do not enter a house where there is a funeral meal. Do not go to mourn or show sympathy, for I have removed from this people My peace, My loving devotion, and My compassion,” declares the LORD.
contents: Indeed, this is what the LORD says: “Do not enter a house where there is a funeral meal. Do not go to mourn or show sympathy, for I have removed from this people My peace, My loving devotion, and My compassion,” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Both great and small will die in this land. They will not be buried or mourned, nor will anyone cut himself or shave his head for them.
contents: “Both great and small will die in this land. They will not be buried or mourned, nor will anyone cut himself or shave his head for them.

contents.verseText: No food will be offered to comfort those who mourn the dead; not even a cup of consolation will be given for the loss of a father or mother.
contents: No food will be offered to comfort those who mourn the dead; not even a cup of consolation will be given for the loss of a father or mother.

contents.verseText: You must not enter a house where there is feasting and sit down with them to eat and drink.
contents: You must not enter a house where there is feasting and sit down with them to eat and drink.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am going to remove from this place, before your very eyes and in your days, the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of the bride and bridegroom.
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am going to remove from this place, before your very eyes and in your days, the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of the bride and bridegroom.

contents.verseText: When you tell these people all these things, they will ask you, ‘Why has the LORD pronounced all this great disaster against us? What is our guilt? What is the sin that we have committed against the LORD our God?’
contents: When you tell these people all these things, they will ask you, ‘Why has the LORD pronounced all this great disaster against us? What is our guilt? What is the sin that we have committed against the LORD our God?’

contents.verseText: Then you are to answer them: ‘It is because your fathers have forsaken Me, declares the LORD, and followed other gods, and served and worshiped them. They abandoned Me and did not keep My instruction.
contents: Then you are to answer them: ‘It is because your fathers have forsaken Me, declares the LORD, and followed other gods, and served and worshiped them. They abandoned Me and did not keep My instruction.

contents.verseText: And you have done more evil than your fathers. See how each of you follows the stubbornness of his evil heart instead of obeying Me.
contents: And you have done more evil than your fathers. See how each of you follows the stubbornness of his evil heart instead of obeying Me.

contents.verseText: So I will cast you out of this land into a land that neither you nor your fathers have known. There you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.’
contents: So I will cast you out of this land into a land that neither you nor your fathers have known. There you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.’

contents.verseText: Yet behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when they will no longer say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of Egypt.’
contents: Yet behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when they will no longer say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of Egypt.’

contents.verseText: Instead they will say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of the north and all the other lands to which He had banished them.’ For I will return them to their land that I gave to their forefathers.
contents: Instead they will say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of the north and all the other lands to which He had banished them.’ For I will return them to their land that I gave to their forefathers.

contents.verseText: But for now I will send for many fishermen, declares the LORD, and they will catch them. After that I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them down on every mountain and hill, even from the clefts of the rocks.
contents: But for now I will send for many fishermen, declares the LORD, and they will catch them. After that I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them down on every mountain and hill, even from the clefts of the rocks.

contents.verseText: For My eyes are on all their ways. They are not hidden from My face, and their guilt is not concealed from My eyes.
contents: For My eyes are on all their ways. They are not hidden from My face, and their guilt is not concealed from My eyes.

contents.verseText: And I will first repay them double their iniquity and their sin, because they have defiled My land with the carcasses of their detestable idols, and they have filled My inheritance with their abominations.”
contents: And I will first repay them double their iniquity and their sin, because they have defiled My land with the carcasses of their detestable idols, and they have filled My inheritance with their abominations.”

contents.verseText: O LORD, my strength and my fortress, my refuge in the day of distress, the nations will come to You from the ends of the earth, and they will say, “Our fathers inherited nothing but lies, worthless idols of no benefit at all.
contents: O LORD, my strength and my fortress,
my refuge in the day of distress,
the nations will come to You
from the ends of the earth, and they will say,
“Our fathers inherited nothing but lies,
worthless idols of no benefit at all.

contents.verseText: Can man make gods for himself? Such are not gods!”
contents: Can man make gods for himself?
Such are not gods!”

contents.verseText: “Therefore behold, I will inform them, and this time I will make them know My power and My might; then they will know that My name is the LORD.
contents: “Therefore behold, I will inform them,
and this time I will make them know
My power and My might;
then they will know
that My name is the LORD.

s1: The Sin and Punishment of Judah

contents.verseText: “The sin of Judah is written with an iron stylus, engraved with a diamond point on the tablets of their hearts and on the horns of their altars.
contents: “The sin of Judah is written with an iron stylus,
engraved with a diamond point
on the tablets of their hearts
and on the horns of their altars.

contents.verseText: Even their children remember their altars and Asherah poles by the green trees and on the high hills.
contents: Even their children remember their altars and Asherah poles
by the green trees and on the high hills.

contents.verseText: O My mountain in the countryside, I will give over your wealth and all your treasures as plunder, because of the sin of your high places, within all your borders.
contents: O My mountain in the countryside,
I will give over your wealth
and all your treasures as plunder,
because of the sin of your high places,
within all your borders.

contents.verseText: And you yourself will relinquish the inheritance that I gave you. I will enslave you to your enemies in a land that you do not know, for you have kindled My anger; it will burn forever.”
contents: And you yourself will relinquish
the inheritance that I gave you.
I will enslave you to your enemies
in a land that you do not know,
for you have kindled My anger;
it will burn forever.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Cursed is the man who trusts in mankind, who makes the flesh his strength and turns his heart from the LORD.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Cursed is the man who trusts in mankind,
who makes the flesh his strength

footnote.ft: Hebrew arm

contents: and turns his heart from the LORD.

contents.verseText: He will be like a shrub in the desert; he will not see when prosperity comes. He will dwell in the parched places of the desert, in a salt land where no one lives.
contents: He will be like a shrub in the desert;
he will not see when prosperity comes.
He will dwell in the parched places of the desert,
in a salt land where no one lives.

contents.verseText: But blessed is the man who trusts in the LORD, whose confidence is in Him.
contents: But blessed is the man who trusts in the LORD,
whose confidence is in Him.

contents.verseText: He is like a tree planted by the waters that sends out its roots toward the stream. It does not fear when the heat comes, and its leaves are always green. It does not worry in a year of drought, nor does it cease to produce fruit.
contents: He is like a tree planted by the waters
that sends out its roots toward the stream.
It does not fear when the heat comes,
and its leaves are always green.
It does not worry in a year of drought,
nor does it cease to produce fruit.

contents.verseText: The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
contents: The heart is deceitful above all things
and beyond cure.
Who can understand it?

contents.verseText: I, the LORD, search the heart; I examine the mind to reward a man according to his way, by what his deeds deserve.
contents: I, the LORD, search the heart;
I examine the mind

footnote.ft: Hebrew kidneys

contents: to reward a man according to his way,
by what his deeds deserve.

contents.verseText: Like a partridge hatching eggs it did not lay is the man who makes a fortune unjustly. In the middle of his days his riches will desert him, and in the end he will be the fool.”
contents: Like a partridge hatching eggs it did not lay
is the man who makes a fortune unjustly.
In the middle of his days his riches will desert him,
and in the end he will be the fool.”

contents.verseText: A glorious throne, exalted from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary.
contents: A glorious throne, exalted from the beginning,
is the place of our sanctuary.

contents.verseText: O LORD, the hope of Israel, all who abandon You will be put to shame. All who turn away will be written in the dust, for they have abandoned the LORD, the fountain of living water.
contents: O LORD, the hope of Israel,
all who abandon You will be put to shame.
All who turn away will be written in the dust,
for they have abandoned the LORD,
the fountain of living water.

contents.verseText: Heal me, O LORD, and I will be healed; save me, and I will be saved, for You are my praise.
contents: Heal me, O LORD, and I will be healed;
save me, and I will be saved,
for You are my praise.

contents.verseText: Behold, they keep saying to me, “Where is the word of the LORD? Let it come now!”
contents: Behold, they keep saying to me,
“Where is the word of the LORD?
Let it come now!”

contents.verseText: But I have not run away from being Your shepherd; I have not desired the day of despair. You know that the utterance of my lips was spoken in Your presence.
contents: But I have not run away from being Your shepherd;
I have not desired the day of despair.
You know that the utterance of my lips
was spoken in Your presence.

contents.verseText: Do not become a terror to me; You are my refuge in the day of disaster.
contents: Do not become a terror to me;
You are my refuge in the day of disaster.

contents.verseText: Let my persecutors be put to shame, but do not let me be put to shame. Let them be terrified, but do not let me be terrified. Bring upon them the day of disaster and shatter them with double destruction.
contents: Let my persecutors be put to shame,
but do not let me be put to shame.
Let them be terrified,
but do not let me be terrified.
Bring upon them the day of disaster
and shatter them with double destruction.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD said to me: “Go and stand at the gate of the people, through which the kings of Judah go in and out; and stand at all the other gates of Jerusalem.
contents: This is what the LORD said to me: “Go and stand at the gate of the people, through which the kings of Judah go in and out; and stand at all the other gates of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Say to them, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah, all people of Judah and Jerusalem who enter through these gates.
contents: Say to them, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah, all people of Judah and Jerusalem who enter through these gates.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: Take heed for yourselves; do not carry a load or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day.
contents: This is what the LORD says: Take heed for yourselves; do not carry a load or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day.

contents.verseText: You must not carry a load out of your houses or do any work on the Sabbath day, but you must keep the Sabbath day holy, just as I commanded your forefathers.
contents: You must not carry a load out of your houses or do any work on the Sabbath day, but you must keep the Sabbath day holy, just as I commanded your forefathers.

contents.verseText: Yet they would not listen or incline their ear, but they stiffened their necks and would not listen or receive My discipline.
contents: Yet they would not listen or incline their ear, but they stiffened their necks and would not listen or receive My discipline.

contents.verseText: If, however, you listen carefully to Me, says the LORD, and bring no load through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, and keep the Sabbath day holy, and do no work on it,
contents: If, however, you listen carefully to Me, says the LORD, and bring no load through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, and keep the Sabbath day holy, and do no work on it,

contents.verseText: then kings and princes will enter through the gates of this city. They will sit on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses with their officials, along with the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem, and this city will be inhabited forever.
contents: then kings and princes will enter through the gates of this city. They will sit on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses with their officials, along with the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem, and this city will be inhabited forever.

contents.verseText: And people will come from the cities of Judah and the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, and from the foothills, the hill country, and the Negev, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and frankincense, and thank offerings to the house of the LORD.
contents: And people will come from the cities of Judah and the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, and from the foothills,

footnote.ft: Hebrew Shephelah or lowlands; that is, the western foothills of Judea

contents: the hill country, and the Negev, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and frankincense, and thank offerings to the house of the LORD.

contents.verseText: But if you do not listen to Me to keep the Sabbath day holy by not carrying a load while entering the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle an unquenchable fire in its gates to consume the citadels of Jerusalem.’”
contents: But if you do not listen to Me to keep the Sabbath day holy by not carrying a load while entering the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle an unquenchable fire in its gates to consume the citadels of Jerusalem.’”

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

contents.verseText: “Go down at once to the potter’s house, and there I will reveal My message to you.”
contents: “Go down at once to the potter’s house, and there I will reveal My message to you.”

contents.verseText: So I went down to the potter’s house and saw him working at the wheel.
contents: So I went down to the potter’s house and saw him working at the wheel.

contents.verseText: But the vessel that he was shaping from the clay became flawed in his hand; so he formed it into another vessel, as it seemed best for him to do.
contents: But the vessel that he was shaping from the clay became flawed in his hand; so he formed it into another vessel, as it seemed best for him to do.

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

contents.verseText: “O house of Israel, declares the LORD, can I not treat you as this potter treats his clay? Just like clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in My hand, O house of Israel.
contents: “O house of Israel, declares the LORD, can I not treat you as this potter treats his clay? Just like clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in My hand, O house of Israel.

contents.verseText: At any time I might announce that a nation or kingdom will be uprooted, torn down, and destroyed.
contents: At any time I might announce that a nation or kingdom will be uprooted, torn down, and destroyed.

contents.verseText: But if that nation I warned turns from its evil, then I will relent of the disaster I had planned to bring.
contents: But if that nation I warned turns from its evil, then I will relent of the disaster I had planned to bring.

contents.verseText: And if at another time I announce that I will build up and establish a nation or kingdom,
contents: And if at another time I announce that I will build up and establish a nation or kingdom,

contents.verseText: and if it does evil in My sight and does not listen to My voice, then I will relent of the good I had intended for it.
contents: and if it does evil in My sight and does not listen to My voice, then I will relent of the good I had intended for it.

contents.verseText: Now therefore, tell the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem that this is what the LORD says: ‘Behold, I am planning a disaster for you and devising a plan against you. Turn now, each of you, from your evil ways, and correct your ways and deeds.’
contents: Now therefore, tell the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem that this is what the LORD says: ‘Behold, I am planning a disaster for you and devising a plan against you. Turn now, each of you, from your evil ways, and correct your ways and deeds.’

contents.verseText: But they will reply, ‘It is hopeless. We will follow our own plans, and each of us will act according to the stubbornness of his evil heart.’”
contents: But they will reply, ‘It is hopeless. We will follow our own plans, and each of us will act according to the stubbornness of his evil heart.’”

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: “Inquire among the nations: Who has ever heard things like these? Virgin Israel has done a most terrible thing.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says:
“Inquire among the nations:
Who has ever heard things like these?
Virgin Israel has done a most terrible thing.

contents.verseText: Does the snow of Lebanon ever leave its rocky slopes? Or do its cool waters flowing from a distance ever run dry?
contents: Does the snow of Lebanon
ever leave its rocky slopes?
Or do its cool waters flowing from a distance
ever run dry?

contents.verseText: Yet My people have forgotten Me. They burn incense to worthless idols that make them stumble in their ways, leaving the ancient roads to walk on rutted bypaths instead of on the highway.
contents: Yet My people have forgotten Me.
They burn incense to worthless idols
that make them stumble in their ways,
leaving the ancient roads
to walk on rutted bypaths
instead of on the highway.

contents.verseText: They have made their land a desolation, a perpetual object of scorn; all who pass by will be appalled and shake their heads.
contents: They have made their land a desolation,
a perpetual object of scorn;
all who pass by will be appalled
and shake their heads.

contents.verseText: I will scatter them before the enemy like the east wind. I will show them My back and not My face in the day of their calamity.”
contents: I will scatter them before the enemy
like the east wind.
I will show them My back and not My face
in the day of their calamity.”

contents.verseText: Then some said, “Come, let us make plans against Jeremiah, for the law will never be lost to the priest, nor counsel to the wise, nor an oracle to the prophet. Come, let us denounce him and pay no heed to any of his words.”
contents: Then some said, “Come, let us make plans against Jeremiah, for the law will never be lost to the priest, nor counsel to the wise, nor an oracle to the prophet. Come, let us denounce him and pay no heed to any of his words.”

contents.verseText: Attend to me, O LORD. Hear what my accusers are saying!
contents: Attend to me, O LORD.
Hear what my accusers are saying!

contents.verseText: Should good be repaid with evil? Yet they have dug a pit for me. Remember how I stood before You to speak good on their behalf, to turn Your wrath from them.
contents: Should good be repaid with evil?
Yet they have dug a pit for me.
Remember how I stood before You
to speak good on their behalf,
to turn Your wrath from them.

contents.verseText: Therefore, hand their children over to famine; pour out the power of the sword upon them. Let their wives become childless and widowed; let their husbands be slain by disease, their young men struck down by the sword in battle.
contents: Therefore, hand their children over to famine;
pour out the power of the sword upon them.
Let their wives become childless and widowed;
let their husbands be slain by disease,
their young men struck down by the sword in battle.

contents.verseText: Let a cry be heard from their houses when You suddenly bring raiders against them, for they have dug a pit to capture me and have hidden snares for my feet.
contents: Let a cry be heard from their houses
when You suddenly bring raiders against them,
for they have dug a pit to capture me
and have hidden snares for my feet.

contents.verseText: But You, O LORD, know all their deadly plots against me. Do not wipe out their guilt or blot out their sin from Your sight. Let them be overthrown before You; deal with them in the time of Your anger.
contents: But You, O LORD, know all their deadly plots against me.
Do not wipe out their guilt
or blot out their sin from Your sight.
Let them be overthrown before You;
deal with them in the time of Your anger.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Go and buy a clay jar from a potter. Take some of the elders of the people and leaders of the priests,
contents: This is what the LORD says: “Go and buy a clay jar from a potter. Take some of the elders of the people and leaders of the priests,

contents.verseText: and go out to the Valley of Ben-hinnom near the entrance of the Potsherd Gate. Proclaim there the words I speak to you,
contents: and go out to the Valley of Ben-hinnom near the entrance of the Potsherd Gate.
Proclaim there the words I speak to you,

contents.verseText: saying, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and residents of Jerusalem. This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am going to bring such disaster on this place that the ears of all who hear of it will ring,
contents: saying, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and residents of Jerusalem. This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am going to bring such disaster on this place that the ears of all who hear of it will ring,

contents.verseText: because they have abandoned Me and made this a foreign place. They have burned incense in this place to other gods that neither they nor their fathers nor the kings of Judah have ever known. They have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
contents: because they have abandoned Me and made this a foreign place. They have burned incense in this place to other gods that neither they nor their fathers nor the kings of Judah have ever known. They have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.

contents.verseText: They have built high places to Baal on which to burn their children in the fire as offerings to Baal—something I never commanded or mentioned, nor did it even enter My mind.
contents: They have built high places to Baal on which to burn their children in the fire as offerings to Baal—something I never commanded or mentioned, nor did it even enter My mind.

contents.verseText: So behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the Valley of Ben-hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
contents: So behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the Valley of Ben-hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.

contents.verseText: And in this place I will ruin the plans of Judah and Jerusalem. I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies, by the hands of those who seek their lives, and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth.
contents: And in this place I will ruin

footnote.ft: The Hebrew term for ruin sounds like the Hebrew for jar; see verses 1 and 10.

contents: the plans of Judah and Jerusalem. I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies, by the hands of those who seek their lives, and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth.

contents.verseText: I will make this city a desolation and an object of scorn. All who pass by will be appalled and will scoff at all her wounds.
contents: I will make this city a desolation and an object of scorn.

footnote.ft: Literally and a hissing

contents: All who pass by will be appalled and will scoff at all her wounds.

contents.verseText: I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters, and they will eat one another’s flesh in the siege and distress inflicted on them by their enemies who seek their lives.’
contents: I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters, and they will eat one another’s flesh in the siege and distress inflicted on them by their enemies who seek their lives.’

contents.verseText: Then you are to shatter the jar in the presence of the men who accompany you,
contents: Then you are to shatter the jar in the presence of the men who accompany you,

contents.verseText: and you are to proclaim to them that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: I will shatter this nation and this city, like one shatters a potter’s jar that can never again be repaired. They will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room to bury them.
contents: and you are to proclaim to them that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: I will shatter this nation and this city, like one shatters a potter’s jar that can never again be repaired. They will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room to bury them.

contents.verseText: This is what I will do to this place and to its residents, declares the LORD. I will make this city like Topheth.
contents: This is what I will do to this place and to its residents, declares the LORD. I will make this city like Topheth.

contents.verseText: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah will be defiled like that place, Topheth—all the houses on whose rooftops they burned incense to all the host of heaven and poured out drink offerings to other gods.”
contents: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah will be defiled like that place, Topheth—all the houses on whose rooftops they burned incense to all the host of heaven and poured out drink offerings to other gods.”

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah returned from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the courtyard of the house of the LORD and proclaimed to all the people,
contents: Then Jeremiah returned from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the courtyard of the house of the LORD and proclaimed to all the people,

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I am about to bring on this city and on all the villages around it every disaster I have pronounced against them, because they have stiffened their necks so as not to heed My words.’”
contents: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I am about to bring on this city and on all the villages around it every disaster I have pronounced against them, because they have stiffened their necks so as not to heed My words.’”

contents.verseText: When Pashhur the priest, the son of Immer and the chief official in the house of the LORD, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things,
contents: When Pashhur the priest, the son of Immer and the chief official in the house of the LORD, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things,

contents.verseText: he had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and put in the stocks at the Upper Gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the LORD.
contents: he had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and put in the stocks at the Upper Gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the LORD.

contents.verseText: The next day, when Pashhur released Jeremiah from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The LORD does not call you Pashhur, but Magor-missabib.
contents: The next day, when Pashhur released Jeremiah from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The LORD does not call you Pashhur, but Magor-missabib.

footnote.ft: Magor-missabib means terror on every side or the man who lives in terror.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: ‘I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies before your very eyes. And I will hand Judah over to the king of Babylon, and he will carry them away to Babylon and put them to the sword.
