contents: For this is what the LORD says: ‘I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies before your very eyes. And I will hand Judah over to the king of Babylon, and he will carry them away to Babylon and put them to the sword.

contents.verseText: I will give away all the wealth of this city—all its products and valuables, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah—to their enemies. They will plunder them, seize them, and carry them off to Babylon.
contents: I will give away all the wealth of this city—all its products and valuables, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah—to their enemies. They will plunder them, seize them, and carry them off to Babylon.

contents.verseText: And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, will go into captivity. You will go to Babylon, and there you will die and be buried—you and all your friends to whom you have prophesied these lies.’”
contents: And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, will go into captivity. You will go to Babylon, and there you will die and be buried—you and all your friends to whom you have prophesied these lies.’”

contents.verseText: You have deceived me, O LORD, and I was deceived. You have overcome me and prevailed. I am a laughingstock all day long; everyone mocks me.
contents: You have deceived me, O LORD, and I was deceived.
You have overcome me and prevailed.
I am a laughingstock all day long;
everyone mocks me.

contents.verseText: For whenever I speak, I cry out; I proclaim violence and destruction. For the word of the LORD has become to me a reproach and derision all day long.
contents: For whenever I speak, I cry out;
I proclaim violence and destruction.
For the word of the LORD has become to me
a reproach and derision all day long.

contents.verseText: If I say, “I will not mention Him or speak any more in His name,” His message becomes a fire burning in my heart, shut up in my bones, and I become weary of holding it in, and I cannot prevail.
contents: If I say, “I will not mention Him
or speak any more in His name,”
His message becomes a fire burning in my heart,
shut up in my bones,
and I become weary of holding it in,
and I cannot prevail.

contents.verseText: For I have heard the whispering of many: “Terror is on every side! Report him; let us report him!” All my trusted friends watch for my fall: “Perhaps he will be deceived so that we may prevail against him and take our vengeance upon him.”
contents: For I have heard the whispering of many:
“Terror is on every side!
Report him; let us report him!”
All my trusted friends
watch for my fall:
“Perhaps he will be deceived
so that we may prevail against him
and take our vengeance upon him.”

contents.verseText: But the LORD is with me like a fearsome warrior. Therefore, my persecutors will stumble and will not prevail. Since they have not succeeded, they will be utterly put to shame, with an everlasting disgrace that will never be forgotten.
contents: But the LORD is with me like a fearsome warrior.
Therefore, my persecutors will stumble and will not prevail.
Since they have not succeeded, they will be utterly put to shame,
with an everlasting disgrace that will never be forgotten.

contents.verseText: O LORD of Hosts, who examines the righteous, who sees the heart and mind, let me see Your vengeance upon them, for to You I have committed my cause.
contents: O LORD of Hosts, who examines the righteous,
who sees the heart

footnote.ft: Hebrew kidneys

contents: and mind,
let me see Your vengeance upon them,
for to You I have committed my cause.

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD! Praise the LORD! For He rescues the life of the needy from the hands of evildoers.
contents: Sing to the LORD!
Praise the LORD!
For He rescues the life of the needy
from the hands of evildoers.

contents.verseText: Cursed be the day I was born! May the day my mother bore me never be blessed.
contents: Cursed be the day I was born!
May the day my mother bore me never be blessed.

contents.verseText: Cursed be the man who brought my father the news, saying, “A son is born to you,” bringing him great joy.
contents: Cursed be the man who brought my father the news,
saying, “A son is born to you,”
bringing him great joy.

contents.verseText: May that man be like the cities that the LORD overthrew without compassion. May he hear an outcry in the morning and a battle cry at noon,
contents: May that man be like the cities
that the LORD overthrew without compassion.
May he hear an outcry in the morning
and a battle cry at noon,

contents.verseText: because he did not kill me in the womb so that my mother might have been my grave, and her womb forever enlarged.
contents: because he did not kill me in the womb
so that my mother might have been my grave,
and her womb forever enlarged.

contents.verseText: Why did I come out of the womb to see only trouble and sorrow, and to end my days in shame?
contents: Why did I come out of the womb
to see only trouble and sorrow,
and to end my days in shame?

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malchijah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah. They said,
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malchijah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah. They said,

contents.verseText: “Please inquire of the LORD on our behalf, since Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is waging war against us. Perhaps the LORD will perform for us something like all His past wonders, so that Nebuchadnezzar will withdraw from us.”
contents: “Please inquire of the LORD on our behalf, since Nebuchadnezzar

footnote.ft: Hebrew Nebuchadrezzar, a variant of Nebuchadnezzar (king of Babylon), which occurs frequently in Jeremiah. The latter spelling is used throughout Jeremiah for consistency.

contents: king of Babylon is waging war against us. Perhaps the LORD will perform for us something like all His past wonders, so that Nebuchadnezzar will withdraw from us.”

contents.verseText: But Jeremiah answered, “You are to tell Zedekiah that
contents: But Jeremiah answered, “You are to tell Zedekiah that

contents.verseText: this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I will turn against you the weapons of war in your hands, with which you are fighting the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans who besiege you outside the wall, and I will assemble their forces in the center of this city.
contents: this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I will turn against you the weapons of war in your hands, with which you are fighting the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verse 9

contents: who besiege you outside the wall, and I will assemble their forces in the center of this city.

contents.verseText: And I Myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm, with anger, fury, and great wrath.
contents: And I Myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm, with anger, fury, and great wrath.

contents.verseText: I will strike down the residents of this city, both man and beast. They will die in a terrible plague.’
contents: I will strike down the residents of this city, both man and beast. They will die in a terrible plague.’

contents.verseText: ‘After that,’ declares the LORD, ‘I will hand over Zedekiah king of Judah, his officers, and the people in this city who survive the plague and sword and famine, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to their enemies who seek their lives. He will put them to the sword; he will not spare them or show pity or compassion.’
contents: ‘After that,’ declares the LORD, ‘I will hand over Zedekiah king of Judah, his officers, and the people in this city who survive the plague and sword and famine, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to their enemies who seek their lives. He will put them to the sword; he will not spare them or show pity or compassion.’

contents.verseText: Furthermore, you are to tell this people that this is what the LORD says: ‘Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
contents: Furthermore, you are to tell this people that this is what the LORD says: ‘Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.

contents.verseText: Whoever stays in this city will die by sword and famine and plague, but whoever goes out and surrenders to the Chaldeans who besiege you will live; he will retain his life like a spoil of war.
contents: Whoever stays in this city will die by sword and famine and plague, but whoever goes out and surrenders to the Chaldeans who besiege you will live; he will retain his life like a spoil of war.

contents.verseText: For I have set My face against this city to bring disaster and not good, declares the LORD. It will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, who will destroy it with fire.’
contents: For I have set My face against this city to bring disaster and not good, declares the LORD. It will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, who will destroy it with fire.’

s1: A Message to the House of David

contents.verseText: Moreover, tell the house of the king of Judah to hear the word of the LORD.
contents: Moreover, tell the house of the king of Judah to hear the word of the LORD.

contents.verseText: O house of David, this is what the LORD says: ‘Administer justice every morning, and rescue the victim of robbery from the hand of his oppressor, or My wrath will go forth like fire and burn with no one to extinguish it because of their evil deeds.
contents: O house of David, this is what the LORD says:
‘Administer justice every morning,
and rescue the victim of robbery
from the hand of his oppressor,
or My wrath will go forth like fire
and burn with no one to extinguish it
because of their evil deeds.

contents.verseText: Behold, I am against you who dwell above the valley, atop the rocky plateau—declares the LORD—you who say, “Who can come against us? Who can enter our dwellings?”
contents: Behold, I am against you who dwell above the valley,
atop the rocky plateau—
declares the LORD—
you who say, “Who can come against us?
Who can enter our dwellings?”

contents.verseText: I will punish you as your deeds deserve, declares the LORD. I will kindle a fire in your forest that will consume everything around you.’”
contents: I will punish you as your deeds deserve,
declares the LORD.
I will kindle a fire in your forest
that will consume everything around you.’”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and proclaim this message there,
contents: This is what the LORD says: “Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and proclaim this message there,

contents.verseText: saying, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O king of Judah, who sits on the throne of David—you and your officials and your people who enter these gates.
contents: saying, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O king of Judah, who sits on the throne of David—you and your officials and your people who enter these gates.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: Administer justice and righteousness. Rescue the victim of robbery from the hand of his oppressor. Do no wrong or violence to the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow. Do not shed innocent blood in this place.
contents: This is what the LORD says: Administer justice and righteousness. Rescue the victim of robbery from the hand of his oppressor. Do no wrong or violence to the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow. Do not shed innocent blood in this place.

contents.verseText: For if you will indeed carry out these commands, then kings who sit on David’s throne will enter through the gates of this palace riding on chariots and horses—they and their officials and their people.
contents: For if you will indeed carry out these commands, then kings who sit on David’s throne will enter through the gates of this palace riding on chariots and horses—they and their officials and their people.

contents.verseText: But if you do not obey these words, then I swear by Myself, declares the LORD, that this house will become a pile of rubble.’”
contents: But if you do not obey these words, then I swear by Myself, declares the LORD, that this house will become a pile of rubble.’”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says concerning the house of the king of Judah: “You are like Gilead to Me, like the summit of Lebanon; but I will surely turn you into a desert, like cities that are uninhabited.
contents: For this is what the LORD says concerning the house of the king of Judah:
“You are like Gilead to Me,
like the summit of Lebanon;
but I will surely turn you into a desert,
like cities that are uninhabited.

contents.verseText: I will appoint destroyers against you, each man with his weapons, and they will cut down the choicest of your cedars and throw them into the fire.
contents: I will appoint destroyers against you,
each man with his weapons,
and they will cut down the choicest of your cedars
and throw them into the fire.

contents.verseText: And many nations will pass by this city and ask one another, ‘Why has the LORD done such a thing to this great city?’
contents: And many nations will pass by this city and ask one another, ‘Why has the LORD done such a thing to this great city?’

contents.verseText: Then people will reply, ‘Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD their God and have worshiped and served other gods.’”
contents: Then people will reply, ‘Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD their God and have worshiped and served other gods.’”

contents.verseText: Do not weep for the dead king; do not mourn his loss. Weep bitterly for the one who is exiled, for he will never return to see his native land.
contents: Do not weep for the dead king;
do not mourn his loss.
Weep bitterly for the one who is exiled,
for he will never return
to see his native land.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says concerning Shallum son of Josiah, king of Judah, who succeeded his father Josiah but has gone forth from this place: “He will never return,
contents: For this is what the LORD says concerning Shallum

footnote.ft: Shallum was also called Jehoahaz.

contents: son of Josiah, king of Judah, who succeeded his father Josiah but has gone forth from this place: “He will never return,

contents.verseText: but he will die in the place to which he was exiled; he will never see this land again.”
contents: but he will die in the place to which he was exiled; he will never see this land again.”

contents.verseText: “Woe to him who builds his palace by unrighteousness, and his upper rooms without justice, who makes his countrymen serve without pay, and fails to pay their wages,
contents: “Woe to him who builds his palace by unrighteousness,
and his upper rooms without justice,
who makes his countrymen serve without pay,
and fails to pay their wages,

contents.verseText: who says, ‘I will build myself a great palace, with spacious upper rooms.’ So he cuts windows in it, panels it with cedar, and paints it with vermilion.
contents: who says, ‘I will build myself a great palace,
with spacious upper rooms.’
So he cuts windows in it,
panels it with cedar,
and paints it with vermilion.

contents.verseText: Does it make you a king to excel in cedar? Did not your father have food and drink? He administered justice and righteousness, and so it went well with him.
contents: Does it make you a king to excel

footnote.ft: Or because you enclose yourself

contents: in cedar?
Did not your father have food and drink?
He administered justice and righteousness,
and so it went well with him.

contents.verseText: He took up the cause of the poor and needy, and so it went well with him. Is this not what it means to know Me?” declares the LORD.
contents: He took up the cause of the poor and needy,
and so it went well with him.
Is this not what it means to know Me?”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “But your eyes and heart are set on nothing except your own dishonest gain, on shedding innocent blood, on practicing extortion and oppression.”
contents: “But your eyes and heart are set on nothing
except your own dishonest gain,
on shedding innocent blood,
on practicing extortion and oppression.”

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says concerning Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah: “They will not mourn for him: ‘Alas, my brother! Alas, my sister!’ They will not mourn for him: ‘Alas, my master! Alas, his splendor!’
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says concerning Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
“They will not mourn for him:
‘Alas, my brother! Alas, my sister!’
They will not mourn for him:
‘Alas, my master! Alas, his splendor!’

contents.verseText: He will be buried like a donkey, dragged away and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.
contents: He will be buried like a donkey,
dragged away and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Go up to Lebanon and cry out; raise your voice in Bashan; cry out from Abarim, for all your lovers have been crushed.
contents: Go up to Lebanon and cry out;
raise your voice in Bashan;
cry out from Abarim,
for all your lovers have been crushed.

contents.verseText: I warned you when you were secure. You said, ‘I will not listen.’ This has been your way from youth, that you have not obeyed My voice.
contents: I warned you when you were secure.
You said, ‘I will not listen.’
This has been your way from youth,
that you have not obeyed My voice.

contents.verseText: The wind will drive away all your shepherds, and your lovers will go into captivity. Then you will be ashamed and humiliated because of all your wickedness.
contents: The wind will drive away all your shepherds,
and your lovers will go into captivity.
Then you will be ashamed and humiliated
because of all your wickedness.

contents.verseText: O inhabitant of Lebanon, nestled in the cedars, how you will groan when pangs of anguish come upon you, agony like a woman in labor.”
contents: O inhabitant of Lebanon,

footnote.ft: That is, the palace in Jerusalem; see 1 Kings 7:2.

contents: nestled in the cedars,
how you will groan when pangs of anguish come upon you,
agony like a woman in labor.”

contents.verseText: “As surely as I live,” declares the LORD, “even if you, Coniah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, were a signet ring on My right hand, I would pull you off.
contents: “As surely as I live,” declares the LORD, “even if you, Coniah

footnote.ft: Coniah is a variant of Jehoiachin; also in verse 28.

contents: son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, were a signet ring on My right hand, I would pull you off.

contents.verseText: In fact, I will hand you over to those you dread, who want to take your life—to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to the Chaldeans.
contents: In fact, I will hand you over to those you dread, who want to take your life—to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to the Chaldeans.

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians

contents.verseText: I will hurl you and the mother who gave you birth into another land, where neither of you were born—and there you both will die.
contents: I will hurl you and the mother who gave you birth into another land, where neither of you were born—and there you both will die.

contents.verseText: You will never return to the land for which you long.”
contents: You will never return to the land for which you long.”

contents.verseText: Is this man Coniah a despised and shattered pot, a jar that no one wants? Why are he and his descendants hurled out and cast into a land they do not know?
contents: Is this man Coniah a despised and shattered pot,
a jar that no one wants?
Why are he and his descendants hurled out
and cast into a land they do not know?

contents.verseText: O land, land, land, hear the word of the LORD!
contents: O land, land, land,
hear the word of the LORD!

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Enroll this man as childless, a man who will not prosper in his lifetime. None of his descendants will prosper to sit on the throne of David or to rule again in Judah.”
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Enroll this man as childless,
a man who will not prosper in his lifetime.
None of his descendants will prosper
to sit on the throne of David
or to rule again in Judah.”

contents.verseText: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of My pasture!” declares the LORD.
contents: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of My pasture!” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about the shepherds who tend My people: “You have scattered My flock and driven them away, and have not attended to them. Behold, I will attend to you for the evil of your deeds, declares the LORD.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about the shepherds who tend My people: “You have scattered My flock and driven them away, and have not attended to them. Behold, I will attend to you for the evil of your deeds, declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Then I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock from all the lands to which I have banished them, and I will return them to their pasture, where they will be fruitful and multiply.
contents: Then I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock from all the lands to which I have banished them, and I will return them to their pasture, where they will be fruitful and multiply.

contents.verseText: I will raise up shepherds over them who will tend them, and they will no longer be afraid or dismayed, nor will any go missing, declares the LORD.
contents: I will raise up shepherds over them who will tend them, and they will no longer be afraid or dismayed, nor will any go missing, declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and He will reign wisely as King and will administer justice and righteousness in the land.
contents: Behold, the days are coming,
declares the LORD,
when I will raise up for David

footnote.ft: Or up for David’s line

contents: a righteous Branch,
and He will reign wisely as King
and will administer justice and righteousness in the land.

contents.verseText: In His days Judah will be saved, and Israel will dwell securely. And this is His name by which He will be called: The LORD Our Righteousness.
contents: In His days Judah will be saved,
and Israel will dwell securely.
And this is His name by which He will be called:
The LORD Our Righteousness.

footnote.ft: Hebrew YHWH Tsidqenu

contents.verseText: So behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when they will no longer say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of Egypt.’
contents: So behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when they will no longer say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of Egypt.’

contents.verseText: Instead they will say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought and led the descendants of the house of Israel up out of the land of the north and all the other lands to which He had banished them.’ Then they will dwell once more in their own land.”
contents: Instead they will say, ‘As surely as the LORD lives, who brought and led the descendants of the house of Israel up out of the land of the north and all the other lands to which He had banished them.’ Then they will dwell once more in their own land.”

contents.verseText: As for the prophets: My heart is broken within me, and all my bones tremble. I have become like a drunkard, like a man overcome by wine, because of the LORD, because of His holy words.
contents: As for the prophets:
My heart is broken within me,
and all my bones tremble.
I have become like a drunkard,
like a man overcome by wine,
because of the LORD,
because of His holy words.

contents.verseText: For the land is full of adulterers—because of the curse, the land mourns and the pastures of the wilderness have dried up—their course is evil and their power is misused.
contents: For the land is full of adulterers—
because of the curse, the land mourns
and the pastures of the wilderness have dried up—
their course is evil
and their power is misused.

contents.verseText: “For both prophet and priest are ungodly; even in My house I have found their wickedness,” declares the LORD.
contents: “For both prophet and priest are ungodly;
even in My house I have found their wickedness,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Therefore their path will become slick; they will be driven away into the darkness and fall into it. For I will bring disaster upon them in the year of their punishment,” declares the LORD.
contents: “Therefore their path will become slick;
they will be driven away into the darkness and fall into it.
For I will bring disaster upon them
in the year of their punishment,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Among the prophets of Samaria I saw an offensive thing: They prophesied by Baal and led My people Israel astray.
contents: “Among the prophets of Samaria
I saw an offensive thing:
They prophesied by Baal
and led My people Israel astray.

contents.verseText: And among the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a horrible thing: They commit adultery and walk in lies. They strengthen the hands of evildoers, so that no one turns his back on wickedness. They are all like Sodom to Me; the people of Jerusalem are like Gomorrah.”
contents: And among the prophets of Jerusalem
I have seen a horrible thing:
They commit adultery
and walk in lies.
They strengthen the hands of evildoers,
so that no one turns his back on wickedness.
They are all like Sodom to Me;
the people of Jerusalem are like Gomorrah.”

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts says concerning the prophets: “I will feed them wormwood and give them poisoned water to drink, for from the prophets of Jerusalem ungodliness has spread throughout the land.”
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts says concerning the prophets:
“I will feed them wormwood
and give them poisoned water to drink,
for from the prophets of Jerusalem
ungodliness has spread throughout the land.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you. They are filling you with false hopes. They speak visions from their own minds, not from the mouth of the LORD.
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you.
They are filling you with false hopes.
They speak visions from their own minds,
not from the mouth of the LORD.

contents.verseText: They keep saying to those who despise Me, ‘The LORD says that you will have peace,’ and to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart, ‘No harm will come to you.’
contents: They keep saying to those who despise Me,
‘The LORD says that you will have peace,’
and to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart,
‘No harm will come to you.’

contents.verseText: But which of them has stood in the council of the LORD to see and hear His word? Who has given heed to His word and obeyed it?
contents: But which of them has stood in the council of the LORD
to see and hear His word?
Who has given heed to His word
and obeyed it?

contents.verseText: Behold, the storm of the LORD has gone out with fury, a whirlwind swirling down upon the heads of the wicked.
contents: Behold, the storm of the LORD
has gone out with fury,
a whirlwind swirling down
upon the heads of the wicked.

contents.verseText: The anger of the LORD will not turn back until He has fully accomplished the purposes of His heart. In the days to come you will understand this clearly.
contents: The anger of the LORD will not turn back
until He has fully accomplished the purposes of His heart.
In the days to come
you will understand this clearly.

contents.verseText: I did not send these prophets, yet they have run with their message; I did not speak to them, yet they have prophesied.
contents: I did not send these prophets,
yet they have run with their message;
I did not speak to them,
yet they have prophesied.

contents.verseText: But if they had stood in My council, they would have proclaimed My words to My people and turned them back from their evil ways and deeds.”
contents: But if they had stood in My council,
they would have proclaimed My words to My people
and turned them back
from their evil ways and deeds.”

contents.verseText: “Am I only a God nearby,” declares the LORD, “and not a God far away?”
contents: “Am I only a God nearby,” declares the LORD, “and not a God far away?”

contents.verseText: “Can a man hide in secret places where I cannot see him?” declares the LORD. “Do I not fill the heavens and the earth?” declares the LORD.
contents: “Can a man hide in secret places where I cannot see him?” declares the LORD.
“Do I not fill the heavens and the earth?” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “I have heard the sayings of the prophets who prophesy lies in My name: ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’
contents: “I have heard the sayings of the prophets who prophesy lies in My name: ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’

contents.verseText: How long will this continue in the hearts of these prophets who prophesy falsehood, these prophets of the delusion of their own minds?
contents: How long will this continue in the hearts of these prophets who prophesy falsehood, these prophets of the delusion of their own minds?

contents.verseText: They suppose the dreams that they tell one another will make My people forget My name, just as their fathers forgot My name through the worship of Baal.
contents: They suppose the dreams that they tell one another will make My people forget My name, just as their fathers forgot My name through the worship of Baal.

contents.verseText: Let the prophet who has a dream retell it, but let him who has My word speak it truthfully. For what is straw compared to grain?” declares the LORD.
contents: Let the prophet who has a dream retell it, but let him who has My word speak it truthfully. For what is straw compared to grain?” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Is not My word like fire,” declares the LORD, “and like a hammer that smashes a rock?”
contents: “Is not My word like fire,” declares the LORD, “and like a hammer that smashes a rock?”

contents.verseText: “Therefore behold,” declares the LORD, “I am against the prophets who steal from one another words they attribute to Me.”
contents: “Therefore behold,” declares the LORD, “I am against the prophets who steal from one another words they attribute to Me.”

contents.verseText: “Yes,” declares the LORD, “I am against the prophets who wag their own tongues and proclaim, ‘The LORD declares it.’”
contents: “Yes,” declares the LORD, “I am against the prophets who wag their own tongues and proclaim, ‘The LORD declares it.’”

contents.verseText: “Indeed,” declares the LORD, “I am against those who prophesy false dreams and retell them to lead My people astray with their reckless lies. It was not I who sent them or commanded them, and they are of no benefit at all to these people,” declares the LORD.
contents: “Indeed,” declares the LORD, “I am against those who prophesy false dreams and retell them to lead My people astray with their reckless lies. It was not I who sent them or commanded them, and they are of no benefit at all to these people,” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Now when this people or a prophet or priest asks you, ‘What is the burden of the LORD?’ you are to say to them, ‘What burden? I will forsake you, declares the LORD.’
contents: “Now when this people or a prophet or priest asks you, ‘What is the burden of the LORD?’ you are to say to them, ‘What burden? I will forsake you, declares the LORD.’

contents.verseText: As for the prophet or priest or anyone who claims, ‘This is the burden of the LORD,’ I will punish that man and his household.
contents: As for the prophet or priest or anyone who claims, ‘This is the burden of the LORD,’ I will punish that man and his household.

contents.verseText: This is what each man is to say to his friend and to his brother: ‘What has the LORD answered?’ or ‘What has the LORD spoken?’
contents: This is what each man is to say to his friend and to his brother: ‘What has the LORD answered?’ or ‘What has the LORD spoken?’

contents.verseText: But refer no more to the burden of the LORD, for each man’s word becomes the burden, so that you pervert the words of the living God, the LORD of Hosts, our God.
contents: But refer no more to the burden of the LORD, for each man’s word becomes the burden, so that you pervert the words of the living God, the LORD of Hosts, our God.

contents.verseText: Thus you are to say to the prophet: ‘What has the LORD answered you?’ and ‘What has the LORD spoken?’
contents: Thus you are to say to the prophet: ‘What has the LORD answered you?’ and ‘What has the LORD spoken?’

contents.verseText: But if you claim, ‘This is the burden of the LORD,’ then this is what the LORD says: Because you have said, ‘This is the burden of the LORD,’ and I specifically told you not to make this claim,
contents: But if you claim, ‘This is the burden of the LORD,’ then this is what the LORD says: Because you have said, ‘This is the burden of the LORD,’ and I specifically told you not to make this claim,

contents.verseText: therefore I will surely forget you and will cast you out of My presence, both you and the city that I gave to you and your fathers.
contents: therefore I will surely forget you and will cast you out of My presence, both you and the city that I gave to you and your fathers.

contents.verseText: And I will bring upon you everlasting shame and perpetual humiliation that will never be forgotten.”
contents: And I will bring upon you everlasting shame and perpetual humiliation that will never be forgotten.”

contents.verseText: After Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, as well as the officials of Judah and the craftsmen and metalsmiths from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon, the LORD showed me two baskets of figs placed in front of the temple of the LORD.
contents: After Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away Jeconiah

footnote.ft: Jeconiah is a variant of Jehoiachin; see 2 Kings 24:12.

contents: son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, as well as the officials of Judah and the craftsmen and metalsmiths from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon,

footnote.ft: Or metalsmiths, and had brought them from Jerusalem to Babylon

contents: the LORD showed me two baskets of figs placed in front of the temple of the LORD.

contents.verseText: One basket had very good figs, like those that ripen early, but the other basket contained very poor figs, so bad they could not be eaten.
contents: One basket had very good figs, like those that ripen early, but the other basket contained very poor figs, so bad they could not be eaten.

contents.verseText: “Jeremiah,” the LORD asked, “what do you see?” “Figs!” I replied. “The good figs are very good, but the bad figs are very bad, so bad they cannot be eaten.”
contents: “Jeremiah,” the LORD asked, “what do you see?”
“Figs!” I replied. “The good figs are very good, but the bad figs are very bad, so bad they cannot be eaten.”

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Like these good figs, so I regard as good the exiles from Judah, whom I have sent away from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.
contents: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Like these good figs, so I regard as good the exiles from Judah, whom I have sent away from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians

contents.verseText: I will keep My eyes on them for good and will return them to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down; I will plant them and not uproot them.
contents: I will keep My eyes on them for good and will return them to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down; I will plant them and not uproot them.

contents.verseText: I will give them a heart to know Me, that I am the LORD. They will be My people, and I will be their God, for they will return to Me with all their heart.
contents: I will give them a heart to know Me, that I am the LORD. They will be My people, and I will be their God, for they will return to Me with all their heart.

contents.verseText: But like the bad figs, so bad they cannot be eaten,’ says the LORD, ‘so will I deal with Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials, and the remnant of Jerusalem—those remaining in this land and those living in the land of Egypt.
contents: But like the bad figs, so bad they cannot be eaten,’ says the LORD, ‘so will I deal with Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials, and the remnant of Jerusalem—those remaining in this land and those living in the land of Egypt.

contents.verseText: I will make them a horror and an offense to all the kingdoms of the earth, a disgrace and an object of scorn, ridicule, and cursing wherever I have banished them.
contents: I will make them a horror and an offense to all the kingdoms of the earth, a disgrace and an object of scorn, ridicule, and cursing wherever I have banished them.

contents.verseText: And I will send against them sword and famine and plague, until they have perished from the land that I gave to them and their fathers.’”
contents: And I will send against them sword and famine and plague, until they have perished from the land that I gave to them and their fathers.’”

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, which was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, which was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.

contents.verseText: So the prophet Jeremiah spoke to all the people of Judah and all the residents of Jerusalem as follows:
contents: So the prophet Jeremiah spoke to all the people of Judah and all the residents of Jerusalem as follows:

contents.verseText: “From the thirteenth year of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah until this very day—twenty-three years—the word of the LORD has come to me, and I have spoken to you again and again, but you have not listened.
contents: “From the thirteenth year of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah until this very day—twenty-three years—the word of the LORD has come to me, and I have spoken to you again and again,

footnote.ft: Literally I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking,

contents: but you have not listened.

contents.verseText: And the LORD has sent all His servants the prophets to you again and again, but you have not listened or inclined your ear to hear.
contents: And the LORD has sent all His servants the prophets to you again and again,

footnote.ft: Literally to you, rising up early and sending (them),

contents: but you have not listened or inclined your ear to hear.

contents.verseText: The prophets told you, ‘Turn now, each of you, from your evil ways and deeds, and you can dwell in the land that the LORD has given to you and your fathers forever and ever.
contents: The prophets told you, ‘Turn now, each of you, from your evil ways and deeds, and you can dwell in the land that the LORD has given to you and your fathers forever and ever.

contents.verseText: Do not follow other gods to serve and worship them, and do not provoke Me to anger with the works of your hands. Then I will do you no harm.’
contents: Do not follow other gods to serve and worship them, and do not provoke Me to anger with the works of your hands. Then I will do you no harm.’

contents.verseText: ‘But to your own harm, you have not listened to Me,’ declares the LORD, ‘so you have provoked Me to anger with the works of your hands.’
contents: ‘But to your own harm, you have not listened to Me,’ declares the LORD, ‘so you have provoked Me to anger with the works of your hands.’

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts says: ‘Because you have not obeyed My words,
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts says: ‘Because you have not obeyed My words,

contents.verseText: behold, I will summon all the families of the north, declares the LORD, and I will send for My servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, whom I will bring against this land, against its residents, and against all the surrounding nations. So I will devote them to destruction and make them an object of horror and contempt, an everlasting desolation.
contents: behold, I will summon all the families of the north, declares the LORD, and I will send for My servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, whom I will bring against this land, against its residents, and against all the surrounding nations. So I will devote them to destruction

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering.

contents: and make them an object of horror and contempt, an everlasting desolation.

contents.verseText: Moreover, I will banish from them the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of the bride and bridegroom, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp.
contents: Moreover, I will banish from them the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of the bride and bridegroom, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp.

contents.verseText: And this whole land will become a desolate wasteland, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon for seventy years.
contents: And this whole land will become a desolate wasteland, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon for seventy years.

contents.verseText: But when seventy years are complete, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, the land of the Chaldeans, for their guilt, declares the LORD, and I will make it an everlasting desolation.
contents: But when seventy years are complete, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, the land of the Chaldeans,

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians

contents: for their guilt, declares the LORD, and I will make it an everlasting desolation.

contents.verseText: I will bring upon that land all the words I have pronounced against it, all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.
contents: I will bring upon that land all the words I have pronounced against it, all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.

contents.verseText: For many nations and great kings will enslave them, and I will repay them according to their deeds and according to the work of their hands.’”
contents: For many nations and great kings will enslave them, and I will repay them according to their deeds and according to the work of their hands.’”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, said to me: “Take from My hand this cup of the wine of wrath, and make all the nations to whom I send you drink from it.
contents: This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, said to me: “Take from My hand this cup of the wine of wrath, and make all the nations to whom I send you drink from it.

contents.verseText: And they will drink and stagger and go out of their minds, because of the sword that I will send among them.”
contents: And they will drink and stagger and go out of their minds, because of the sword that I will send among them.”

contents.verseText: So I took the cup from the LORD’s hand and made all the nations drink from it, each one to whom the LORD had sent me,
contents: So I took the cup from the LORD’s hand and made all the nations drink from it, each one to whom the LORD had sent me,

contents.verseText: to make them a ruin, an object of horror and contempt and cursing, as they are to this day—Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, its kings and officials;
contents: to make them a ruin, an object of horror and contempt and cursing, as they are to this day—Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, its kings and officials;

contents.verseText: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his officials, his leaders, and all his people;
contents: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his officials, his leaders, and all his people;

contents.verseText: all the mixed tribes; all the kings of Uz; all the kings of the Philistines: Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;
contents: all the mixed tribes; all the kings of Uz; all the kings of the Philistines: Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;

contents.verseText: Edom, Moab, and the Ammonites;
contents: Edom, Moab, and the Ammonites;

contents.verseText: all the kings of Tyre and Sidon; the kings of the coastlands across the sea;
contents: all the kings of Tyre and Sidon; the kings of the coastlands across the sea;

contents.verseText: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who cut the corners of their hair;
contents: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who cut the corners of their hair;

contents.verseText: all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed tribes who dwell in the desert;
contents: all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed tribes who dwell in the desert;

contents.verseText: all the kings of Zimri, Elam, and Media;
contents: all the kings of Zimri, Elam, and Media;

contents.verseText: all the kings of the north, both near and far, one after another—all the kingdoms on the face of the earth. And after all of them, the king of Sheshach will drink it too.
contents: all the kings of the north, both near and far, one after another—all the kingdoms on the face of the earth. And after all of them, the king of Sheshach

footnote.ft: Sheshach is a code name for Babylon.

contents: will drink it too.

contents.verseText: “Then you are to tell them that this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Drink, get drunk, and vomit. Fall down and never get up again, because of the sword I will send among you.’
contents: “Then you are to tell them that this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Drink, get drunk, and vomit. Fall down and never get up again, because of the sword I will send among you.’

contents.verseText: If they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink it, you are to tell them that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: ‘You most certainly must drink it!
contents: If they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink it, you are to tell them that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: ‘You most certainly must drink it!

contents.verseText: For behold, I am beginning to bring disaster on the city that bears My Name, so how could you possibly go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am calling down a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, declares the LORD of Hosts.’
contents: For behold, I am beginning to bring disaster on the city that bears My Name, so how could you possibly go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am calling down a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, declares the LORD of Hosts.’

contents.verseText: So you are to prophesy all these words against them and say to them: ‘The LORD will roar from on high; He will raise His voice from His holy habitation. He will roar loudly over His pasture; like those who tread the grapes, He will call out with a shout against all the inhabitants of the earth.
contents: So you are to prophesy all these words against them and say to them:
‘The LORD will roar from on high;
He will raise His voice from His holy habitation.
He will roar loudly over His pasture;
like those who tread the grapes,
He will call out with a shout
against all the inhabitants of the earth.

contents.verseText: The tumult will resound to the ends of the earth because the LORD brings a charge against the nations. He brings judgment on all mankind and puts the wicked to the sword,’” declares the LORD.
contents: The tumult will resound to the ends of the earth
because the LORD brings a charge against the nations.
He brings judgment on all mankind
and puts the wicked to the sword,’”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Behold! Disaster is spreading from nation to nation; a mighty storm is rising from the ends of the earth.”
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Behold! Disaster is spreading
from nation to nation;
a mighty storm is rising
from the ends of the earth.”

contents.verseText: Those slain by the LORD on that day will be spread from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be mourned, gathered, or buried. They will be like dung lying on the ground.
contents: Those slain by the LORD on that day will be spread from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be mourned, gathered, or buried. They will be like dung lying on the ground.

contents.verseText: Wail, you shepherds, and cry out; roll in the dust, you leaders of the flock. For the days of your slaughter have come; you will fall and be shattered like fine pottery.
contents: Wail, you shepherds, and cry out;
roll in the dust, you leaders of the flock.
For the days of your slaughter have come;
you will fall and be shattered like fine pottery.

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX you will fall like the best of the rams

contents.verseText: Flight will evade the shepherds, and escape will elude the leaders of the flock.
contents: Flight will evade the shepherds,
and escape will elude the leaders of the flock.

contents.verseText: Hear the cry of the shepherds, the wailing of the leaders of the flock, for the LORD is destroying their pasture.
contents: Hear the cry of the shepherds,
the wailing of the leaders of the flock,
for the LORD is destroying their pasture.

contents.verseText: The peaceful meadows have been silenced because of the LORD’s burning anger.
contents: The peaceful meadows have been silenced
because of the LORD’s burning anger.

contents.verseText: He has left His den like a lion, for their land has been made a desolation by the sword of the oppressor, and because of the fierce anger of the LORD.
contents: He has left His den like a lion,
for their land has been made a desolation
by the sword

footnote.ft: Some Hebrew manuscripts and LXX (see also Jeremiah 46:16 and Jeremiah 50:16); most Hebrew manuscripts anger

contents: of the oppressor,
and because of the fierce anger of the LORD.

s1: A Warning to the Cities of Judah

contents.verseText: At the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came from the LORD:
contents: At the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came from the LORD:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD says: Stand in the courtyard of the house of the LORD and speak all the words I have commanded you to speak to all the cities of Judah who come to worship there. Do not omit a word.
contents: “This is what the LORD says: Stand in the courtyard of the house of the LORD and speak all the words I have commanded you to speak to all the cities of Judah who come to worship there. Do not omit a word.

contents.verseText: Perhaps they will listen and turn—each from his evil way of life—so that I may relent of the disaster I am planning to bring upon them because of the evil of their deeds.
contents: Perhaps they will listen and turn—each from his evil way of life—so that I may relent of the disaster I am planning to bring upon them because of the evil of their deeds.

contents.verseText: And you are to tell them that this is what the LORD says: ‘If you do not listen to Me and walk in My law, which I have set before you,
contents: And you are to tell them that this is what the LORD says: ‘If you do not listen to Me and walk in My law, which I have set before you,

contents.verseText: and if you do not listen to the words of My servants the prophets, whom I have sent you again and again even though you did not listen,
contents: and if you do not listen to the words of My servants the prophets, whom I have sent you again and again

footnote.ft: Literally I have sent you, rising up early and sending (them),

contents: even though you did not listen,

contents.verseText: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and I will make this city an object of cursing among all the nations of the earth.’”
contents: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and I will make this city an object of cursing among all the nations of the earth.’”

contents.verseText: Now the priests and prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the LORD,
contents: Now the priests and prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the LORD,

contents.verseText: and as soon as he had finished telling all the people everything the LORD had commanded him to say, the priests and prophets and all the people seized him, shouting, “You must surely die!
contents: and as soon as he had finished telling all the people everything the LORD had commanded him to say, the priests and prophets and all the people seized him, shouting, “You must surely die!

contents.verseText: How dare you prophesy in the name of the LORD that this house will become like Shiloh and this city will be desolate and deserted!” And all the people assembled against Jeremiah in the house of the LORD.
contents: How dare you prophesy in the name of the LORD that this house will become like Shiloh and this city will be desolate and deserted!”
And all the people assembled against Jeremiah in the house of the LORD.

contents.verseText: When the officials of Judah heard these things, they went up from the king’s palace to the house of the LORD and sat there at the entrance of the New Gate.
contents: When the officials of Judah heard these things, they went up from the king’s palace to the house of the LORD and sat there at the entrance of the New Gate.

contents.verseText: Then the priests and prophets said to the officials and all the people, “This man is worthy of death, for he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your own ears!”
contents: Then the priests and prophets said to the officials and all the people, “This man is worthy of death, for he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your own ears!”

contents.verseText: But Jeremiah said to all the officials and all the people, “The LORD sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.
contents: But Jeremiah said to all the officials and all the people, “The LORD sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.

contents.verseText: So now, correct your ways and deeds, and obey the voice of the LORD your God, so that He might relent of the disaster He has pronounced against you.
contents: So now, correct your ways and deeds, and obey the voice of the LORD your God, so that He might relent of the disaster He has pronounced against you.

contents.verseText: As for me, here I am in your hands; do to me what you think is good and right.
contents: As for me, here I am in your hands; do to me what you think is good and right.

contents.verseText: But know for certain that if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood upon yourselves, upon this city, and upon its residents; for truly the LORD has sent me to speak all these words in your hearing.”
contents: But know for certain that if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood upon yourselves, upon this city, and upon its residents; for truly the LORD has sent me to speak all these words in your hearing.”

contents.verseText: Then the officials and all the people told the priests and prophets, “This man is not worthy of death, for he has spoken to us in the name of the LORD our God!”
contents: Then the officials and all the people told the priests and prophets, “This man is not worthy of death, for he has spoken to us in the name of the LORD our God!”

contents.verseText: Some of the elders of the land stood up and said to the whole assembly of the people,
contents: Some of the elders of the land stood up and said to the whole assembly of the people,

contents.verseText: “Micah the Moreshite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah and told all the people of Judah that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: ‘Zion will be plowed like a field, Jerusalem will become a heap of rubble, and the temple mount a wooded ridge.’
contents: “Micah the Moreshite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah and told all the people of Judah that this is what the LORD of Hosts says:
‘Zion will be plowed like a field,
Jerusalem will become a heap of rubble,
and the temple mount a wooded ridge.’

footnote.ft: Micah 3:12

contents.verseText: Did Hezekiah king of Judah or anyone else in Judah put him to death? Did Hezekiah not fear the LORD and seek His favor, and did not the LORD relent of the disaster He had pronounced against them? But we are about to bring great harm on ourselves!”
contents: Did Hezekiah king of Judah or anyone else in Judah put him to death? Did Hezekiah not fear the LORD and seek His favor, and did not the LORD relent of the disaster He had pronounced against them? But we are about to bring great harm on ourselves!”

contents.verseText: Now there was another man prophesying in the name of the LORD, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim. He prophesied against this city and against this land the same things that Jeremiah did.
contents: Now there was another man prophesying in the name of the LORD, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim. He prophesied against this city and against this land the same things that Jeremiah did.

footnote.ft: Literally according to all the words of Jeremiah

contents.verseText: King Jehoiakim and all his mighty men and officials heard his words, and the king sought to put him to death. But when Uriah found out about it, he fled in fear and went to Egypt.
contents: King Jehoiakim and all his mighty men and officials heard his words, and the king sought to put him to death. But when Uriah found out about it, he fled in fear and went to Egypt.

contents.verseText: Then King Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt: Elnathan son of Achbor along with some other men.
contents: Then King Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt: Elnathan son of Achbor along with some other men.

contents.verseText: They brought Uriah out of Egypt and took him to King Jehoiakim, who had him put to the sword and his body thrown into the burial place of the common people.
contents: They brought Uriah out of Egypt and took him to King Jehoiakim, who had him put to the sword and his body thrown into the burial place of the common people.

contents.verseText: Nevertheless, Ahikam son of Shaphan supported Jeremiah, so he was not handed over to the people to be put to death.
contents: Nevertheless, Ahikam son of Shaphan supported Jeremiah, so he was not handed over to the people to be put to death.

contents.verseText: At the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD.
contents: At the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah

footnote.ft: A few Hebrew manuscripts and Syriac (see also verses 3 and 12, and Jeremiah 28:1); most Hebrew manuscripts Jehoiakim

contents: son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD.

footnote.ft: Most LXX manuscripts do not include this verse.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD said to me: “Make for yourself a yoke out of leather straps and put it on your neck.
contents: This is what the LORD said to me:
“Make for yourself a yoke out of leather straps and put it on your neck.

contents.verseText: Send word to the kings of Edom, Moab, Ammon, Tyre, and Sidon through the envoys who have come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
contents: Send word to the kings of Edom, Moab, Ammon, Tyre, and Sidon through the envoys who have come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.

contents.verseText: Give them a message from the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, to relay to their masters:
contents: Give them a message from the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, to relay to their masters:

contents.verseText: By My great power and outstretched arm, I made the earth and the men and beasts on the face of it, and I give it to whom I please.
contents: By My great power and outstretched arm, I made the earth and the men and beasts on the face of it, and I give it to whom I please.

contents.verseText: So now I have placed all these lands under the authority of My servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. I have even made the beasts of the field subject to him.
contents: So now I have placed all these lands under the authority of My servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. I have even made the beasts of the field subject to him.

contents.verseText: All nations will serve him and his son and grandson, until the time of his own land comes; then many nations and great kings will enslave him.
contents: All nations will serve him and his son and grandson, until the time of his own land comes; then many nations and great kings will enslave him.

contents.verseText: As for the nation or kingdom that does not serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and does not place its neck under his yoke, I will punish that nation by sword and famine and plague, declares the LORD, until I have destroyed it by his hand.
contents: As for the nation or kingdom that does not serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and does not place its neck under his yoke, I will punish that nation by sword and famine and plague, declares the LORD, until I have destroyed it by his hand.

contents.verseText: But as for you, do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your interpreters of dreams, your mediums, or your sorcerers who declare, ‘You will not serve the king of Babylon.’
contents: But as for you, do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your interpreters of dreams, your mediums, or your sorcerers who declare, ‘You will not serve the king of Babylon.’

contents.verseText: For they prophesy to you a lie that will serve to remove you from your land; I will banish you and you will perish.
contents: For they prophesy to you a lie that will serve to remove you from your land; I will banish you and you will perish.

contents.verseText: But the nation that will put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will leave in its own land, to cultivate it and reside in it, declares the LORD.”
contents: But the nation that will put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will leave in its own land, to cultivate it and reside in it, declares the LORD.”

contents.verseText: And to Zedekiah king of Judah I spoke the same message: “Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon; serve him and his people, and live!
contents: And to Zedekiah king of Judah I spoke the same message: “Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon; serve him and his people, and live!

contents.verseText: Why should you and your people die by sword and famine and plague, as the LORD has decreed against any nation that does not serve the king of Babylon?
contents: Why should you and your people die by sword and famine and plague, as the LORD has decreed against any nation that does not serve the king of Babylon?

contents.verseText: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who say, ‘You must not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they are prophesying to you a lie.
contents: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who say, ‘You must not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they are prophesying to you a lie.

contents.verseText: For I have not sent them, declares the LORD, and yet they are prophesying falsely in My name; therefore I will banish you, and you will perish—you and the prophets who prophesy to you.”
contents: For I have not sent them, declares the LORD, and yet they are prophesying falsely in My name; therefore I will banish you, and you will perish—you and the prophets who prophesy to you.”

contents.verseText: Then I said to the priests and to all this people, “This is what the LORD says: Do not listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, ‘Look, very soon now the articles from the house of the LORD will be brought back from Babylon.’ They are prophesying to you a lie.
contents: Then I said to the priests and to all this people, “This is what the LORD says: Do not listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, ‘Look, very soon now the articles from the house of the LORD will be brought back from Babylon.’ They are prophesying to you a lie.

contents.verseText: Do not listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon and live! Why should this city become a ruin?
contents: Do not listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon and live! Why should this city become a ruin?

contents.verseText: If they are indeed prophets and the word of the LORD is with them, let them now plead with the LORD of Hosts that the articles remaining in the house of the LORD, in the palace of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem, not be taken to Babylon.
contents: If they are indeed prophets and the word of the LORD is with them, let them now plead with the LORD of Hosts that the articles remaining in the house of the LORD, in the palace of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem, not be taken to Babylon.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts says about the pillars, the sea, the bases, and the rest of the articles that remain in this city,
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts says about the pillars, the sea, the bases, and the rest of the articles that remain in this city,

contents.verseText: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take when he carried Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem.
contents: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take when he carried Jeconiah

footnote.ft: Jeconiah is a variant of Jehoiachin; see 2 Kings 24:12.

contents: son of Jehoiakim king of Judah into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Yes, this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says about the articles that remain in the house of the LORD, in the palace of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem:
contents: Yes, this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says about the articles that remain in the house of the LORD, in the palace of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem:

contents.verseText: ‘They will be carried to Babylon and will remain there until the day I attend to them again,’ declares the LORD. ‘Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place.’”
contents: ‘They will be carried to Babylon and will remain there until the day I attend to them again,’ declares the LORD. ‘Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place.’”

contents.verseText: In the fifth month of that same year, the fourth year, near the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah, the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, said to me in the house of the LORD in the presence of the priests and all the people:
contents: In the fifth month of that same year, the fourth year, near the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah, the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, said to me in the house of the LORD in the presence of the priests and all the people:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
contents: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.

contents.verseText: Within two years I will restore to this place all the articles of the house of the LORD that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon removed from here and carried to Babylon.
contents: Within two years I will restore to this place all the articles of the house of the LORD that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon removed from here and carried to Babylon.

contents.verseText: And I will restore to this place Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, along with all the exiles from Judah who went to Babylon,’ declares the LORD, ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’”
contents: And I will restore to this place Jeconiah

footnote.ft: Jeconiah is a variant of Jehoiachin; see 2 Kings 24:12.

contents: son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, along with all the exiles from Judah who went to Babylon,’ declares the LORD, ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’”

contents.verseText: Then the prophet Jeremiah replied to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and all the people who were standing in the house of the LORD.
contents: Then the prophet Jeremiah replied to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and all the people who were standing in the house of the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Amen!” Jeremiah said. “May the LORD do so! May the LORD fulfill the words you have prophesied, and may He restore the articles of His house and all the exiles back to this place from Babylon.
contents: “Amen!” Jeremiah said. “May the LORD do so! May the LORD fulfill the words you have prophesied, and may He restore the articles of His house and all the exiles back to this place from Babylon.

contents.verseText: Nevertheless, listen now to this message I am speaking in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people.
contents: Nevertheless, listen now to this message I am speaking in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people.

contents.verseText: The prophets of old who preceded you and me prophesied war, disaster, and plague against many lands and great kingdoms.
contents: The prophets of old who preceded you and me prophesied war, disaster, and plague against many lands and great kingdoms.

contents.verseText: As for the prophet who prophesies peace, only if the word of the prophet comes true will the prophet be recognized as one the LORD has truly sent.”
contents: As for the prophet who prophesies peace, only if the word of the prophet comes true will the prophet be recognized as one the LORD has truly sent.”

contents.verseText: Then the prophet Hananiah took the yoke off the neck of Jeremiah the prophet and broke it.
contents: Then the prophet Hananiah took the yoke off the neck of Jeremiah the prophet and broke it.

contents.verseText: And in the presence of all the people Hananiah proclaimed, “This is what the LORD says: ‘In this way, within two years I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon off the neck of all the nations.’” At this, Jeremiah the prophet went on his way.
contents: And in the presence of all the people Hananiah proclaimed, “This is what the LORD says: ‘In this way, within two years I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon off the neck of all the nations.’”
At this, Jeremiah the prophet went on his way.

contents.verseText: But shortly after Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke off his neck, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
contents: But shortly after Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke off his neck, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

contents.verseText: “Go and tell Hananiah that this is what the LORD says: ‘You have broken a yoke of wood, but in its place you have fashioned a yoke of iron.’
contents: “Go and tell Hananiah that this is what the LORD says: ‘You have broken a yoke of wood, but in its place you have fashioned a yoke of iron.’

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations to make them serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they will serve him. I have even given him control of the beasts of the field.’”
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations to make them serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they will serve him. I have even given him control of the beasts of the field.’”

contents.verseText: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, “Listen, Hananiah! The LORD did not send you, but you have persuaded this people to trust in a lie.
contents: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, “Listen, Hananiah! The LORD did not send you, but you have persuaded this people to trust in a lie.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: ‘I am about to remove you from the face of the earth. You will die this year because you have preached rebellion against the LORD.’”
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says: ‘I am about to remove you from the face of the earth. You will die this year because you have preached rebellion against the LORD.’”

contents.verseText: And in the seventh month of that very year, the prophet Hananiah died.
contents: And in the seventh month of that very year, the prophet Hananiah died.

contents.verseText: This is the text of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the surviving elders among the exiles and to the priests, the prophets, and all the others Nebuchadnezzar had carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon.
contents: This is the text of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the surviving elders among the exiles and to the priests, the prophets, and all the others Nebuchadnezzar had carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon.

contents.verseText: (This was after King Jeconiah, the queen mother, the court officials, the officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the metalsmiths had been exiled from Jerusalem.)
contents: (This was after King Jeconiah,

footnote.ft: Jeconiah is a variant of Jehoiachin; see 2 Kings 24:12.

contents: the queen mother, the court officials, the officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the metalsmiths had been exiled from Jerusalem.)

contents.verseText: The letter was entrusted to Elasah son of Shaphan and Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to King Nebuchadnezzar in Babylon. It stated:
contents: The letter was entrusted to Elasah son of Shaphan and Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to King Nebuchadnezzar in Babylon. It stated:

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says to all the exiles who were carried away from Jerusalem to Babylon:
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says to all the exiles who were carried away from Jerusalem to Babylon:

contents.verseText: “Build houses and settle down. Plant gardens and eat their produce.
contents: “Build houses and settle down. Plant gardens and eat their produce.

contents.verseText: Take wives and have sons and daughters. Take wives for your sons and give your daughters in marriage, so that they too may have sons and daughters. Multiply there; do not decrease.
contents: Take wives and have sons and daughters. Take wives for your sons and give your daughters in marriage, so that they too may have sons and daughters. Multiply there; do not decrease.

contents.verseText: Seek the prosperity of the city to which I have sent you as exiles. Pray to the LORD on its behalf, for if it prospers, you too will prosper.”
contents: Seek the prosperity of the city to which I have sent you as exiles. Pray to the LORD on its behalf, for if it prospers, you too will prosper.”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Do not be deceived by the prophets and diviners among you, and do not listen to the dreams you elicit from them.
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Do not be deceived by the prophets and diviners among you, and do not listen to the dreams you elicit from them.

contents.verseText: For they are falsely prophesying to you in My name; I have not sent them, declares the LORD.”
contents: For they are falsely prophesying to you in My name; I have not sent them, declares the LORD.”

footnote.ft: Some translators close the written portion of this letter later in the chapter.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: “When Babylon’s seventy years are complete, I will attend to you and confirm My promise to restore you to this place.
contents: For this is what the LORD says: “When Babylon’s seventy years are complete, I will attend to you and confirm My promise to restore you to this place.

contents.verseText: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, to give you a future and a hope.
contents: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, to give you a future and a hope.

contents.verseText: Then you will call upon Me and come and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.
contents: Then you will call upon Me and come and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.

contents.verseText: You will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.
contents: You will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.

contents.verseText: I will be found by you, declares the LORD, and I will restore you from captivity and gather you from all the nations and places to which I have banished you, declares the LORD. I will restore you to the place from which I sent you into exile.”
contents: I will be found by you, declares the LORD, and I will restore you from captivity

footnote.ft: Or restore your fortunes

contents: and gather you from all the nations and places to which I have banished you, declares the LORD. I will restore you to the place from which I sent you into exile.”

contents.verseText: Because you may say, “The LORD has raised up for us prophets in Babylon,”
contents: Because you may say, “The LORD has raised up for us prophets in Babylon,”

contents.verseText: this is what the LORD says about the king who sits on David’s throne and all the people who remain in this city, your brothers who did not go with you into exile—
contents: this is what the LORD says about the king who sits on David’s throne and all the people who remain in this city, your brothers who did not go with you into exile—

contents.verseText: this is what the LORD of Hosts says: “I will send against them sword and famine and plague, and I will make them like rotten figs, so bad they cannot be eaten.
contents: this is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“I will send against them sword and famine and plague, and I will make them like rotten figs, so bad they cannot be eaten.

contents.verseText: I will pursue them with sword and famine and plague. I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth—a curse, a desolation, and an object of scorn and reproach among all the nations to which I banish them.
contents: I will pursue them with sword and famine and plague. I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth—a curse, a desolation, and an object of scorn and reproach among all the nations to which I banish them.

contents.verseText: I will do this because they have not listened to My words, declares the LORD, which I sent to them again and again through My servants the prophets. And neither have you exiles listened, declares the LORD.”
contents: I will do this because they have not listened to My words, declares the LORD, which I sent to them again and again

footnote.ft: Literally I sent to them, rising up early and sending (to them)

contents: through My servants the prophets. And neither have you exiles listened, declares the LORD.”
