contents.verseText: So hear the word of the LORD, all you exiles I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
contents: So hear the word of the LORD, all you exiles I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says about Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who are prophesying to you lies in My name: “I will deliver them to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will kill them before your very eyes.
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says about Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who are prophesying to you lies in My name: “I will deliver them to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will kill them before your very eyes.

contents.verseText: Because of them, all the exiles of Judah who are in Babylon will use this curse: ‘May the LORD make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire!’
contents: Because of them, all the exiles of Judah who are in Babylon will use this curse: ‘May the LORD make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire!’

contents.verseText: For they have committed an outrage in Israel by committing adultery with the wives of their neighbors and speaking lies in My name, which I did not command them to do. I am He who knows, and I am a witness, declares the LORD.”
contents: For they have committed an outrage in Israel by committing adultery with the wives of their neighbors and speaking lies in My name, which I did not command them to do. I am He who knows, and I am a witness, declares the LORD.”

contents.verseText: You are to tell Shemaiah the Nehelamite that
contents: You are to tell Shemaiah the Nehelamite that

contents.verseText: this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “In your own name you have sent out letters to all the people of Jerusalem, to the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah, and to all the priests. You said to Zephaniah:
contents: this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “In your own name you have sent out letters to all the people of Jerusalem, to the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah, and to all the priests. You said to Zephaniah:

footnote.ft: Hebrew You said; the addressee Zephaniah is added for clarity.

contents.verseText: ‘The LORD has appointed you priest in place of Jehoiada, to be the chief officer in the house of the LORD, responsible for any madman who acts like a prophet—you must put him in stocks and neck irons.
contents: ‘The LORD has appointed you priest in place of Jehoiada, to be the chief officer in the house of the LORD, responsible for any madman who acts like a prophet—you must put him in stocks and neck irons.

contents.verseText: So now, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who poses as a prophet among you?
contents: So now, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who poses as a prophet among you?

contents.verseText: For he has sent to us in Babylon, claiming: Since the exile will be lengthy, build houses and settle down; plant gardens and eat their produce.’”
contents: For he has sent to us in Babylon, claiming: Since the exile will be lengthy, build houses and settle down; plant gardens and eat their produce.’”

contents.verseText: (Zephaniah the priest, however, had read this letter to Jeremiah the prophet.)
contents: (Zephaniah the priest, however, had read this letter to Jeremiah the prophet.)

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

contents.verseText: “Send a message telling all the exiles what the LORD says concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite. Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you—though I did not send him—and has made you trust in a lie,
contents: “Send a message telling all the exiles what the LORD says concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite. Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you—though I did not send him—and has made you trust in a lie,

contents.verseText: this is what the LORD says: ‘I will surely punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants. He will have no one left among this people, nor will he see the good that I will bring to My people, declares the LORD, for he has preached rebellion against the LORD.’”
contents: this is what the LORD says: ‘I will surely punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants. He will have no one left among this people, nor will he see the good that I will bring to My people, declares the LORD, for he has preached rebellion against the LORD.’”

s1: The Restoration of Israel and Judah

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Write in a book all the words that I have spoken to you.
contents: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Write in a book all the words that I have spoken to you.

contents.verseText: For behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will restore from captivity My people Israel and Judah, declares the LORD. I will restore them to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they will possess it.’”
contents: For behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will restore from captivity

footnote.ft: Or restore the fortunes of

contents: My people Israel and Judah, declares the LORD. I will restore them to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they will possess it.’”

contents.verseText: These are the words that the LORD spoke concerning Israel and Judah.
contents: These are the words that the LORD spoke concerning Israel and Judah.

contents.verseText: Yes, this is what the LORD says: “A cry of panic is heard—a cry of terror, not of peace.
contents: Yes, this is what the LORD says:
“A cry of panic is heard—
a cry of terror, not of peace.

contents.verseText: Ask now, and see: Can a male give birth? Why then do I see every man with his hands on his stomach like a woman in labor and every face turned pale?
contents: Ask now, and see:
Can a male give birth?
Why then do I see every man
with his hands on his stomach like a woman in labor
and every face turned pale?

contents.verseText: How awful that day will be! None will be like it! It is the time of Jacob’s distress, but he will be saved out of it.
contents: How awful that day will be!
None will be like it!
It is the time of Jacob’s distress,
but he will be saved out of it.

contents.verseText: On that day, declares the LORD of Hosts, I will break the yoke off their necks and tear off their bonds, and no longer will strangers enslave them.
contents: On that day,
declares the LORD of Hosts,
I will break the yoke off their necks
and tear off their bonds,
and no longer will strangers enslave them.

contents.verseText: Instead, they will serve the LORD their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.
contents: Instead, they will serve the LORD their God
and David their king,
whom I will raise up for them.

contents.verseText: As for you, O Jacob My servant, do not be afraid, declares the LORD, and do not be dismayed, O Israel. For I will surely save you out of a distant place, your descendants from the land of their captivity! Jacob will return to quiet and ease, with no one to make him afraid.
contents: As for you, O Jacob My servant, do not be afraid,
declares the LORD,
and do not be dismayed,
O Israel.
For I will surely save you out of a distant place,
your descendants from the land of their captivity!
Jacob will return to quiet and ease,
with no one to make him afraid.

contents.verseText: For I am with you to save you, declares the LORD. Though I will completely destroy all the nations to which I have scattered you, I will not completely destroy you. Yet I will discipline you justly, and will by no means leave you unpunished.”
contents: For I am with you to save you,
declares the LORD.
Though I will completely destroy all the nations to which I have scattered you,
I will not completely destroy you.
Yet I will discipline you justly,
and will by no means leave you unpunished.”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: “Your injury is incurable; your wound is grievous.
contents: For this is what the LORD says:
“Your injury is incurable;
your wound is grievous.

contents.verseText: There is no one to plead your cause, no remedy for your sores, no recovery for you.
contents: There is no one to plead your cause,
no remedy for your sores,
no recovery for you.

contents.verseText: All your lovers have forgotten you; they no longer seek you, for I have struck you as an enemy would, with the discipline of someone cruel, because of your great iniquity and your numerous sins.
contents: All your lovers have forgotten you;
they no longer seek you,
for I have struck you as an enemy would,
with the discipline of someone cruel,
because of your great iniquity
and your numerous sins.

contents.verseText: Why do you cry out over your wound? Your pain has no cure! Because of your great iniquity and your numerous sins I have done these things to you.
contents: Why do you cry out over your wound?
Your pain has no cure!
Because of your great iniquity
and your numerous sins
I have done these things to you.

contents.verseText: Nevertheless, all who devour you will be devoured, and all your adversaries—every one of them—will go off into exile. Those who plundered you will be plundered, and all who raided you will be raided.
contents: Nevertheless, all who devour you will be devoured,
and all your adversaries—every one of them—
will go off into exile.
Those who plundered you will be plundered,
and all who raided you will be raided.

contents.verseText: But I will restore your health and heal your wounds, declares the LORD, because they call you an outcast, Zion, for whom no one cares.”
contents: But I will restore your health and heal your wounds,
declares the LORD,
because they call you an outcast,
Zion, for whom no one cares.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “I will restore the fortunes of Jacob’s tents and have compassion on his dwellings. And the city will be rebuilt on her own ruins, and the palace will stand in its rightful place.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“I will restore the fortunes of

footnote.ft: Or restore from captivity

contents: Jacob’s tents
and have compassion on his dwellings.
And the city will be rebuilt on her own ruins,
and the palace will stand in its rightful place.

contents.verseText: Thanksgiving will proceed from them, a sound of celebration. I will multiply them, and they will not be decreased; I will honor them, and they will not be belittled.
contents: Thanksgiving will proceed from them,
a sound of celebration.
I will multiply them, and they will not be decreased;
I will honor them, and they will not be belittled.

contents.verseText: Their children will be as in days of old, and their congregation will be established before Me; and I will punish all their oppressors.
contents: Their children will be as in days of old,
and their congregation will be established before Me;
and I will punish all their oppressors.

contents.verseText: Their leader will be one of their own, and their ruler will arise from their midst. And I will bring him near, and he will approach Me, for who would dare on his own to approach Me?” declares the LORD.
contents: Their leader will be one of their own,
and their ruler will arise from their midst.
And I will bring him near, and he will approach Me,
for who would dare on his own to approach Me?”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “And you will be My people, and I will be your God.”
contents: “And you will be My people,
and I will be your God.”

contents.verseText: Behold, the storm of the LORD has gone out with fury, a whirlwind swirling down upon the heads of the wicked.
contents: Behold, the storm of the LORD
has gone out with fury,
a whirlwind swirling down
upon the heads of the wicked.

contents.verseText: The fierce anger of the LORD will not turn back until He has fully accomplished the purposes of His heart. In the days to come you will understand this.
contents: The fierce anger of the LORD will not turn back
until He has fully accomplished the purposes of His heart.
In the days to come
you will understand this.

contents.verseText: “At that time,” declares the LORD, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be My people.”
contents: “At that time,” declares the LORD, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be My people.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “The people who survived the sword found favor in the wilderness when Israel went to find rest.”
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“The people who survived the sword
found favor in the wilderness
when Israel went to find rest.”

contents.verseText: The LORD appeared to us in the past, saying: “I have loved you with an everlasting love; therefore I have drawn you with loving devotion.
contents: The LORD appeared to us in the past, saying:

footnote.ft: Or The LORD appeared to him from afar, saying

contents: “I have loved you with an everlasting love;
therefore I have drawn you with loving devotion.

contents.verseText: Again I will build you, and you will be rebuilt, O Virgin Israel. Again you will take up your tambourines and go out in joyful dancing.
contents: Again I will build you, and you will be rebuilt,
O Virgin Israel.
Again you will take up your tambourines
and go out in joyful dancing.

contents.verseText: Again you will plant vineyards on the hills of Samaria; the farmers will plant and enjoy the fruit.
contents: Again you will plant vineyards on the hills of Samaria;
the farmers will plant and enjoy the fruit.

contents.verseText: For there will be a day when watchmen will call out on the hills of Ephraim, ‘Arise, let us go up to Zion, to the LORD our God!’”
contents: For there will be a day when watchmen will call out
on the hills of Ephraim,
‘Arise, let us go up to Zion,
to the LORD our God!’”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: “Sing with joy for Jacob; shout for the foremost of the nations! Make your praises heard, and say, ‘O LORD, save Your people, the remnant of Israel!’
contents: For this is what the LORD says:
“Sing with joy for Jacob;
shout for the foremost of the nations!
Make your praises heard, and say,
‘O LORD, save Your people,
the remnant of Israel!’

contents.verseText: Behold, I will bring them from the land of the north and gather them from the farthest parts of the earth, including the blind and the lame, expectant mothers and women in labor. They will return as a great assembly!
contents: Behold, I will bring them from the land of the north
and gather them from the farthest parts of the earth,
including the blind and the lame,
expectant mothers and women in labor.
They will return as a great assembly!

contents.verseText: They will come with weeping, and by their supplication I will lead them; I will make them walk beside streams of waters, on a level path where they will not stumble. For I am Israel’s Father, and Ephraim is My firstborn.”
contents: They will come with weeping,
and by their supplication I will lead them;
I will make them walk beside streams of waters,
on a level path where they will not stumble.
For I am Israel’s Father,
and Ephraim is My firstborn.”

contents.verseText: Hear, O nations, the word of the LORD, and proclaim it in distant coastlands: “The One who scattered Israel will gather them and keep them as a shepherd keeps his flock.
contents: Hear, O nations, the word of the LORD,
and proclaim it in distant coastlands:
“The One who scattered Israel will gather them and keep them
as a shepherd keeps his flock.

contents.verseText: For the LORD has ransomed Jacob and redeemed him from the hand that had overpowered him.
contents: For the LORD has ransomed Jacob
and redeemed him from the hand that had overpowered him.

contents.verseText: They will come and shout for joy on the heights of Zion; they will be radiant over the bounty of the LORD—the grain, new wine, and oil, and the young of the flocks and herds. Their life will be like a well-watered garden, and never again will they languish.
contents: They will come and shout for joy on the heights of Zion;
they will be radiant over the bounty of the LORD—
the grain, new wine, and oil,
and the young of the flocks and herds.
Their life will be like a well-watered garden,
and never again will they languish.

contents.verseText: Then the maidens will rejoice with dancing, young men and old as well. I will turn their mourning into joy, and give them comfort and joy for their sorrow.
contents: Then the maidens will rejoice with dancing,
young men and old as well.
I will turn their mourning into joy,
and give them comfort and joy for their sorrow.

contents.verseText: I will fill the souls of the priests abundantly, and will fill My people with My goodness,” declares the LORD.
contents: I will fill the souls of the priests abundantly,
and will fill My people with My goodness,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “A voice is heard in Ramah, mourning and great weeping, Rachel weeping for her children, and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.”
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“A voice is heard in Ramah,
mourning and great weeping,
Rachel weeping for her children,
and refusing to be comforted,
because they are no more.”

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 2:18

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Keep your voice from weeping and your eyes from tears, for the reward for your work will come, declares the LORD. Then your children will return from the land of the enemy.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Keep your voice from weeping
and your eyes from tears,
for the reward for your work will come,
declares the LORD.
Then your children will return
from the land of the enemy.

contents.verseText: So there is hope for your future, declares the LORD, and your children will return to their own land.
contents: So there is hope for your future,
declares the LORD,
and your children will return
to their own land.

contents.verseText: I have surely heard Ephraim’s moaning: ‘You disciplined me severely, like an untrained calf. Restore me, that I may return, for You are the LORD my God.
contents: I have surely heard Ephraim’s

footnote.ft: That is, the northern kingdom of Israel; also in verse 20

contents: moaning:
‘You disciplined me severely,
like an untrained calf.
Restore me, that I may return,
for You are the LORD my God.

contents.verseText: After I returned, I repented; and after I was instructed, I struck my thigh in grief. I was ashamed and humiliated because I bore the disgrace of my youth.’
contents: After I returned, I repented;
and after I was instructed, I struck my thigh in grief.
I was ashamed and humiliated
because I bore the disgrace of my youth.’

contents.verseText: Is not Ephraim a precious son to Me, a delightful child? Though I often speak against him, I still remember him. Therefore My heart yearns for him; I have great compassion for him,” declares the LORD.
contents: Is not Ephraim a precious son to Me,
a delightful child?
Though I often speak against him,
I still remember him.
Therefore My heart yearns for him;

footnote.ft: Hebrew My bowels yearn for him

contents: I have great compassion for him,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Set up the roadmarks, establish the signposts. Keep the highway in mind, the road you have traveled. Return, O Virgin Israel, return to these cities of yours.
contents: “Set up the roadmarks,
establish the signposts.
Keep the highway in mind,
the road you have traveled.
Return, O Virgin Israel,
return to these cities of yours.

contents.verseText: How long will you wander, O faithless daughter? For the LORD has created a new thing in the land—a woman will shelter a man.”
contents: How long will you wander,
O faithless daughter?
For the LORD has created a new thing in the land—
a woman will shelter

footnote.ft: Or will surround or will return to

contents: a man.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “When I restore them from captivity, they will once again speak this word in the land of Judah and in its cities: ‘May the LORD bless you, O righteous dwelling place, O holy mountain.’
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “When I restore them from captivity,

footnote.ft: Or restore their fortunes

contents: they will once again speak this word in the land of Judah and in its cities: ‘May the LORD bless you, O righteous dwelling place, O holy mountain.’

contents.verseText: And Judah and all its cities will dwell together in the land, the farmers and those who move with the flocks,
contents: And Judah and all its cities will dwell together in the land, the farmers and those who move with the flocks,

contents.verseText: for I will refresh the weary soul and replenish all who are weak.”
contents: for I will refresh the weary soul and replenish all who are weak.”

contents.verseText: At this I awoke and looked around. My sleep had been most pleasant to me.
contents: At this I awoke and looked around. My sleep had been most pleasant to me.

contents.verseText: “The days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and of beast.
contents: “The days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and of beast.

contents.verseText: Just as I watched over them to uproot and tear down, to demolish, destroy, and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” declares the LORD.
contents: Just as I watched over them to uproot and tear down, to demolish, destroy, and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “In those days, it will no longer be said: ‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the teeth of the children are set on edge.’
contents: “In those days, it will no longer be said:
‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes,
and the teeth of the children are set on edge.’

contents.verseText: Instead, each will die for his own iniquity. If anyone eats the sour grapes, his own teeth will be set on edge.
contents: Instead, each will die for his own iniquity. If anyone eats the sour grapes, his own teeth will be set on edge.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah.
contents: Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD,
when I will make a new covenant
with the house of Israel
and with the house of Judah.

contents.verseText: It will not be like the covenant I made with their fathers when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt—a covenant they broke, though I was a husband to them,” declares the LORD.
contents: It will not be like the covenant
I made with their fathers
when I took them by the hand
to lead them out of the land of Egypt—
a covenant they broke,
though I was a husband to them,

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX for they did not abide in My covenant, and I disregarded them; see also Syriac.

contents: declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “But this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after those days, declares the LORD. I will put My law in their minds and inscribe it on their hearts. And I will be their God, and they will be My people.
contents: “But this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel
after those days, declares the LORD.
I will put My law in their minds
and inscribe it on their hearts.
And I will be their God,
and they will be My people.

contents.verseText: No longer will each man teach his neighbor or his brother, saying, ‘Know the LORD,’ because they will all know Me, from the least of them to the greatest, declares the LORD. For I will forgive their iniquities and will remember their sins no more.”
contents: No longer will each man teach his neighbor or his brother,
saying, ‘Know the LORD,’
because they will all know Me,
from the least of them to the greatest, declares the LORD.
For I will forgive their iniquities
and will remember their sins no more.”

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 8:8–12 and Hebrews 10:16–17

contents.verseText: Thus says the LORD, who gives the sun for light by day, who sets in order the moon and stars for light by night, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar—the LORD of Hosts is His name:
contents: Thus says the LORD, who gives the sun for light by day, who sets in order the moon and stars for light by night, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar—the LORD of Hosts is His name:

contents.verseText: “Only if this fixed order departed from My presence, declares the LORD, would Israel’s descendants ever cease to be a nation before Me.”
contents: “Only if this fixed order departed from My presence,
declares the LORD,
would Israel’s descendants ever cease
to be a nation before Me.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Only if the heavens above could be measured and the foundations of the earth below searched out would I reject all of Israel’s descendants because of all they have done,” declares the LORD.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Only if the heavens above could be measured
and the foundations of the earth below searched out
would I reject all of Israel’s descendants
because of all they have done,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “The days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when this city will be rebuilt for Me, from the tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
contents: “The days are coming,”

footnote.ft: Literally Behold, the days; alternate MT reading Behold, the days are coming

contents: declares the LORD, “when this city will be rebuilt for Me, from the tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.

contents.verseText: The measuring line will once again stretch out straight to the hill of Gareb and then turn toward Goah.
contents: The measuring line will once again stretch out straight to the hill of Gareb and then turn toward Goah.

contents.verseText: The whole valley of the dead bodies and ashes, and all the fields as far as the Kidron Valley, to the corner of the Horse Gate to the east, will be holy to the LORD. It will never again be uprooted or demolished.”
contents: The whole valley of the dead bodies and ashes, and all the fields as far as the Kidron Valley, to the corner of the Horse Gate to the east, will be holy to the LORD. It will never again be uprooted or demolished.”

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.

contents.verseText: At that time the army of the king of Babylon was besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was imprisoned in the courtyard of the guard, which was in the palace of the king of Judah.
contents: At that time the army of the king of Babylon was besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was imprisoned in the courtyard of the guard, which was in the palace of the king of Judah.

contents.verseText: For Zedekiah king of Judah had imprisoned him, saying: “Why are you prophesying like this? You claim that the LORD says, ‘Behold, I am about to deliver this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.
contents: For Zedekiah king of Judah had imprisoned him, saying: “Why are you prophesying like this? You claim that the LORD says, ‘Behold, I am about to deliver this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.

contents.verseText: Zedekiah king of Judah will not escape from the hands of the Chaldeans, but he will surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and will speak with him face to face and see him eye to eye.
contents: Zedekiah king of Judah will not escape from the hands of the Chaldeans,

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verses 5, 24, 25, 28, 29, and 43

contents: but he will surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and will speak with him face to face and see him eye to eye.

contents.verseText: He will take Zedekiah to Babylon, where he will stay until I attend to him, declares the LORD. If you fight against the Chaldeans, you will not succeed.’”
contents: He will take Zedekiah to Babylon, where he will stay until I attend to him, declares the LORD. If you fight against the Chaldeans, you will not succeed.’”

contents.verseText: Jeremiah replied, “The word of the LORD came to me, saying:
contents: Jeremiah replied, “The word of the LORD came to me, saying:

contents.verseText: Behold! Hanamel, the son of your uncle Shallum, is coming to you to say, ‘Buy for yourself my field in Anathoth, for you have the right of redemption to buy it.’
contents: Behold! Hanamel, the son of your uncle Shallum, is coming to you to say, ‘Buy for yourself my field in Anathoth, for you have the right of redemption to buy it.’

contents.verseText: Then, as the LORD had said, my cousin Hanamel came to me in the courtyard of the guard and urged me, ‘Please buy my field in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin, for you own the right of inheritance and redemption. Buy it for yourself.’” Then I knew that this was the word of the LORD.
contents: Then, as the LORD had said, my cousin Hanamel came to me in the courtyard of the guard and urged me, ‘Please buy my field in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin, for you own the right of inheritance and redemption. Buy it for yourself.’”
Then I knew that this was the word of the LORD.

contents.verseText: So I bought the field in Anathoth from my cousin Hanamel, and I weighed out seventeen shekels of silver.
contents: So I bought the field in Anathoth from my cousin Hanamel, and I weighed out seventeen shekels of silver.

footnote.ft: 17 shekels is approximately 6.8 ounces or 193.8 grams of silver.

contents.verseText: I signed and sealed the deed, called in witnesses, and weighed out the silver on the scales.
contents: I signed and sealed the deed, called in witnesses, and weighed out the silver on the scales.

contents.verseText: Then I took the deed of purchase—the sealed copy with its terms and conditions, as well as the open copy—
contents: Then I took the deed of purchase—the sealed copy with its terms and conditions, as well as the open copy—

contents.verseText: and I gave this deed to Baruch son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the sight of my cousin Hanamel and the witnesses who were signing the purchase agreement and all the Jews sitting in the courtyard of the guard.
contents: and I gave this deed to Baruch son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the sight of my cousin Hanamel and the witnesses who were signing the purchase agreement and all the Jews sitting in the courtyard of the guard.

contents.verseText: In their sight I instructed Baruch,
contents: In their sight I instructed Baruch,

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Take these deeds—both the sealed copy and the open copy of the deed of purchase—and put them in a clay jar to preserve them for a long time.
contents: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Take these deeds—both the sealed copy and the open copy of the deed of purchase—and put them in a clay jar to preserve them for a long time.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Houses, fields, and vineyards will again be bought in this land.”
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Houses, fields, and vineyards will again be bought in this land.”

contents.verseText: After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to the LORD:
contents: After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to the LORD:

contents.verseText: “Oh, Lord GOD! You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and outstretched arm. Nothing is too difficult for You!
contents: “Oh, Lord GOD! You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and outstretched arm. Nothing is too difficult for You!

contents.verseText: You show loving devotion to thousands but lay the iniquity of the fathers into the laps of their children after them, O great and mighty God whose name is the LORD of Hosts,
contents: You show loving devotion to thousands but lay the iniquity of the fathers into the laps

footnote.ft: Hebrew into the bosom

contents: of their children after them, O great and mighty God whose name is the LORD of Hosts,

contents.verseText: the One great in counsel and mighty in deed, whose eyes are on all the ways of the sons of men, to reward each one according to his ways and according to the fruit of his deeds.
contents: the One great in counsel and mighty in deed, whose eyes are on all the ways of the sons of men, to reward each one according to his ways and according to the fruit of his deeds.

contents.verseText: You performed signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, and You do so to this very day, both in Israel and among all mankind. And You have made a name for Yourself, as is the case to this day.
contents: You performed signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, and You do so to this very day, both in Israel and among all mankind. And You have made a name for Yourself, as is the case to this day.

contents.verseText: You brought Your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror.
contents: You brought Your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror.

contents.verseText: You gave them this land that You had sworn to give their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.
contents: You gave them this land that You had sworn to give their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.

contents.verseText: They came in and possessed it, but they did not obey Your voice or walk in Your law. They failed to perform all that You commanded them to do, and so You have brought upon them all this disaster.
contents: They came in and possessed it, but they did not obey Your voice or walk in Your law. They failed to perform all that You commanded them to do, and so You have brought upon them all this disaster.

contents.verseText: See how the siege ramps are mounted against the city to capture it. And by sword and famine and plague, the city has been given into the hands of the Chaldeans who are fighting against it. What You have spoken has happened, as You now see!
contents: See how the siege ramps are mounted against the city to capture it. And by sword and famine and plague, the city has been given into the hands of the Chaldeans who are fighting against it. What You have spoken has happened, as You now see!

contents.verseText: Yet You, O Lord GOD, have said to me, ‘Buy for yourself the field with silver and call in witnesses, even though the city has been delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans!’”
contents: Yet You, O Lord GOD, have said to me, ‘Buy for yourself the field with silver and call in witnesses, even though the city has been delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans!’”

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

contents.verseText: “Behold, I am the LORD, the God of all flesh. Is anything too difficult for Me?
contents: “Behold, I am the LORD, the God of all flesh. Is anything too difficult for Me?

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: Behold, I am about to deliver this city into the hands of the Chaldeans and of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who will capture it.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says: Behold, I am about to deliver this city into the hands of the Chaldeans and of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who will capture it.

contents.verseText: And the Chaldeans who are fighting against this city will come in, set it on fire, and burn it, along with the houses of those who provoked Me to anger by burning incense to Baal on their rooftops and by pouring out drink offerings to other gods.
contents: And the Chaldeans who are fighting against this city will come in, set it on fire, and burn it, along with the houses of those who provoked Me to anger by burning incense to Baal on their rooftops and by pouring out drink offerings to other gods.

contents.verseText: For the children of Israel and of Judah have done nothing but evil in My sight from their youth; indeed, they have done nothing but provoke Me to anger by the work of their hands, declares the LORD.
contents: For the children of Israel and of Judah have done nothing but evil in My sight from their youth; indeed, they have done nothing but provoke Me to anger by the work of their hands, declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: For this city has aroused My wrath and fury from the day it was built until now. Therefore I will remove it from My presence
contents: For this city has aroused My wrath and fury from the day it was built until now. Therefore I will remove it from My presence

contents.verseText: because of all the evil the children of Israel and of Judah have done to provoke Me to anger—they, their kings, their officials, their priests and prophets, the men of Judah, and the residents of Jerusalem.
contents: because of all the evil the children of Israel and of Judah have done to provoke Me to anger—they, their kings, their officials, their priests and prophets, the men of Judah, and the residents of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: They have turned their backs to Me and not their faces. Though I taught them again and again, they would not listen or respond to discipline.
contents: They have turned their backs to Me and not their faces. Though I taught them again and again,

footnote.ft: Literally I taught them, rising up early and teaching,

contents: they would not listen or respond to discipline.

contents.verseText: They have placed their abominations in the house that bears My Name, and so have defiled it.
contents: They have placed their abominations in the house that bears My Name, and so have defiled it.

contents.verseText: They have built the high places of Baal in the Valley of Hinnom to make their sons and daughters pass through the fire to Molech—something I never commanded them, nor had it ever entered My mind, that they should commit such an abomination and cause Judah to sin.
contents: They have built the high places of Baal in the Valley of Hinnom to make their sons and daughters pass through the fire to Molech—something I never commanded them, nor had it ever entered My mind, that they should commit such an abomination and cause Judah to sin.

contents.verseText: Now therefore, about this city of which you say, ‘It will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by sword and famine and plague,’ this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says:
contents: Now therefore, about this city of which you say, ‘It will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by sword and famine and plague,’ this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says:

contents.verseText: I will surely gather My people from all the lands to which I have banished them in My furious anger and great wrath, and I will return them to this place and make them dwell in safety.
contents: I will surely gather My people from all the lands to which I have banished them in My furious anger and great wrath, and I will return them to this place and make them dwell in safety.

contents.verseText: They will be My people, and I will be their God.
contents: They will be My people, and I will be their God.

footnote.ft: Cited in 2 Corinthians 6:16

contents.verseText: I will give them one heart and one way, so that they will always fear Me for their own good and for the good of their children after them.
contents: I will give them one heart and one way, so that they will always fear Me for their own good and for the good of their children after them.

contents.verseText: I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never turn away from doing good to them, and I will put My fear in their hearts, so that they will never turn away from Me.
contents: I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never turn away from doing good to them, and I will put My fear in their hearts, so that they will never turn away from Me.

contents.verseText: Yes, I will rejoice in doing them good, and I will faithfully plant them in this land with all My heart and with all My soul.
contents: Yes, I will rejoice in doing them good, and I will faithfully plant them in this land with all My heart and with all My soul.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: Just as I have brought all this great disaster on this people, so I will bring on them all the good I have promised them.
contents: For this is what the LORD says: Just as I have brought all this great disaster on this people, so I will bring on them all the good I have promised them.

contents.verseText: And fields will be bought in this land about which you are saying, ‘It is a desolation, without man or beast; it has been delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans.’
contents: And fields will be bought in this land about which you are saying, ‘It is a desolation, without man or beast; it has been delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans.’

contents.verseText: Fields will be purchased with silver, and deeds will be signed, sealed, and witnessed in the land of Benjamin, in the areas surrounding Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah—the cities of the hill country, the foothills, and the Negev—because I will restore them from captivity, declares the LORD.”
contents: Fields will be purchased with silver, and deeds will be signed, sealed, and witnessed in the land of Benjamin, in the areas surrounding Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah—the cities of the hill country, the foothills,

footnote.ft: Hebrew Shephelah or lowlands; that is, the western foothills of Judea

contents: and the Negev—because I will restore them from captivity,

footnote.ft: Or restore their fortunes

contents: declares the LORD.”

s1: The Excellence of the Restored Nation

contents.verseText: While Jeremiah was still confined in the courtyard of the guard, the word of the LORD came to him a second time:
contents: While Jeremiah was still confined in the courtyard of the guard, the word of the LORD came to him a second time:

contents.verseText: “Thus says the LORD who made the earth, the LORD who formed it and established it, the LORD is His name:
contents: “Thus says the LORD who made the earth,

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew who made it

contents: the LORD who formed it and established it, the LORD is His name:

contents.verseText: Call to Me, and I will answer and show you great and unsearchable things you do not know.
contents: Call to Me, and I will answer and show you great and unsearchable things you do not know.

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about the houses of this city and the palaces of the kings of Judah that have been torn down for defense against the siege ramps and the sword:
contents: For this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about the houses of this city and the palaces of the kings of Judah that have been torn down for defense against the siege ramps and the sword:

contents.verseText: The Chaldeans are coming to fight and to fill those places with the corpses of the men I will strike down in My anger and in My wrath. I have hidden My face from this city because of all its wickedness.
contents: The Chaldeans are coming to fight

footnote.ft: Or They are coming to fight the Chaldeans; that is, the Babylonians

contents: and to fill those places with the corpses of the men I will strike down in My anger and in My wrath. I have hidden My face from this city because of all its wickedness.

contents.verseText: Nevertheless, I will bring to it health and healing, and I will heal its people and reveal to them the abundance of peace and truth.
contents: Nevertheless, I will bring to it health and healing, and I will heal its people and reveal to them the abundance of peace and truth.

contents.verseText: I will restore Judah and Israel from captivity and will rebuild them as in former times.
contents: I will restore Judah and Israel from captivity

footnote.ft: Or restore the fortunes of Judah and Israel

contents: and will rebuild them as in former times.

contents.verseText: And I will cleanse them from all the iniquity they have committed against Me, and will forgive all their sins of rebellion against Me.
contents: And I will cleanse them from all the iniquity they have committed against Me, and will forgive all their sins of rebellion against Me.

contents.verseText: So this city will bring Me renown, joy, praise, and glory before all the nations of the earth, who will hear of all the good I do for it. They will tremble in awe because of all the goodness and prosperity that I will provide for it.
contents: So this city will bring Me renown, joy, praise, and glory before all the nations of the earth, who will hear of all the good I do for it. They will tremble in awe because of all the goodness and prosperity that I will provide for it.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: In this place you say is a wasteland without man or beast, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem that are deserted—inhabited by neither man nor beast—there will be heard again
contents: This is what the LORD says: In this place you say is a wasteland without man or beast, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem that are deserted—inhabited by neither man nor beast—there will be heard again

contents.verseText: the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of the bride and bridegroom, and the voices of those bringing thank offerings into the house of the LORD, saying: ‘Give thanks to the LORD of Hosts, for the LORD is good; His loving devotion endures forever.’ For I will restore the land from captivity as in former times, says the LORD.
contents: the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of the bride and bridegroom, and the voices of those bringing thank offerings into the house of the LORD, saying:
‘Give thanks to the LORD of Hosts,
for the LORD is good;
His loving devotion endures forever.’
For I will restore the land from captivity

footnote.ft: Or restore the fortunes of the land

contents: as in former times, says the LORD.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: In this desolate place, without man or beast, and in all its cities, there will once more be pastures for shepherds to rest their flocks.
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: In this desolate place, without man or beast, and in all its cities, there will once more be pastures for shepherds to rest their flocks.

contents.verseText: In the cities of the hill country, the foothills, and the Negev, in the land of Benjamin and the cities surrounding Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, the flocks will again pass under the hands of the one who counts them, says the LORD.
contents: In the cities of the hill country, the foothills,

footnote.ft: Hebrew Shephelah or lowlands; that is, the western foothills of Judea

contents: and the Negev, in the land of Benjamin and the cities surrounding Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, the flocks will again pass under the hands of the one who counts them, says the LORD.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will fulfill the gracious promise that I have spoken to the house of Israel and the house of Judah.
contents: Behold, the days are coming,
declares the LORD,
when I will fulfill the gracious promise
that I have spoken
to the house of Israel
and the house of Judah.

contents.verseText: In those days and at that time I will cause to sprout for David a righteous Branch, and He will administer justice and righteousness in the land.
contents: In those days and at that time
I will cause to sprout for David a righteous Branch,
and He will administer justice
and righteousness in the land.

contents.verseText: In those days Judah will be saved, and Jerusalem will dwell securely, and this is the name by which it will be called: The LORD Our Righteousness.
contents: In those days Judah will be saved,
and Jerusalem will dwell securely,
and this is the name by which it will be called:
The LORD Our Righteousness.

footnote.ft: Hebrew YHWH Tsidqenu

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: David will never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel,
contents: For this is what the LORD says: David will never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel,

contents.verseText: nor will the priests who are Levites ever fail to have a man before Me to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings, and to present sacrifices.”
contents: nor will the priests who are Levites ever fail to have a man before Me to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings, and to present sacrifices.”

contents.verseText: And the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
contents: And the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD says: If you can break My covenant with the day and My covenant with the night, so that day and night cease to occupy their appointed time,
contents: “This is what the LORD says: If you can break My covenant with the day and My covenant with the night, so that day and night cease to occupy their appointed time,

contents.verseText: then My covenant may also be broken with David My servant and with My ministers the Levites who are priests, so that David will not have a son to reign on his throne.
contents: then My covenant may also be broken with David My servant and with My ministers the Levites who are priests, so that David will not have a son to reign on his throne.

contents.verseText: As the hosts of heaven cannot be counted and as the sand on the seashore cannot be measured, so too will I multiply the descendants of My servant David and the Levites who minister before Me.”
contents: As the hosts of heaven cannot be counted and as the sand on the seashore cannot be measured, so too will I multiply the descendants of My servant David and the Levites who minister before Me.”

contents.verseText: Moreover, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
contents: Moreover, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

contents.verseText: “Have you not noticed what these people are saying: ‘The LORD has rejected the two families He had chosen’? So they despise My people and no longer regard them as a nation.
contents: “Have you not noticed what these people are saying: ‘The LORD has rejected the two families He had chosen’? So they despise My people and no longer regard them as a nation.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: If I have not established My covenant with the day and the night and the fixed order of heaven and earth,
contents: This is what the LORD says: If I have not established My covenant with the day and the night and the fixed order of heaven and earth,

contents.verseText: then I would also reject the descendants of Jacob and of My servant David, so as not to take from his descendants rulers over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For I will restore them from captivity and will have compassion on them.”
contents: then I would also reject the descendants of Jacob and of My servant David, so as not to take from his descendants rulers over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For I will restore them from captivity

footnote.ft: Or restore their fortunes

contents: and will have compassion on them.”

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, all his army, all the earthly kingdoms under his control, and all the other nations were fighting against Jerusalem and all its surrounding cities.
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, all his army, all the earthly kingdoms under his control, and all the other nations were fighting against Jerusalem and all its surrounding cities.

contents.verseText: The LORD, the God of Israel, told Jeremiah to go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him that this is what the LORD says: “Behold, I am about to deliver this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it down.
contents: The LORD, the God of Israel, told Jeremiah to go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him that this is what the LORD says: “Behold, I am about to deliver this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it down.

contents.verseText: And you yourself will not escape his grasp, but will surely be captured and delivered into his hand. You will see the king of Babylon eye to eye and speak with him face to face; and you will go to Babylon.
contents: And you yourself will not escape his grasp, but will surely be captured and delivered into his hand. You will see the king of Babylon eye to eye and speak with him face to face; and you will go to Babylon.

contents.verseText: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O Zedekiah king of Judah. This is what the LORD says concerning you: You will not die by the sword;
contents: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O Zedekiah king of Judah. This is what the LORD says concerning you: You will not die by the sword;

contents.verseText: you will die in peace. As spices were burned for your fathers, the former kings who preceded you, so people will burn spices for you and lament, ‘Alas, O master!’ For I Myself have spoken this word, declares the LORD.”
contents: you will die in peace. As spices were burned for your fathers, the former kings who preceded you, so people will burn spices for you and lament, ‘Alas, O master!’ For I Myself have spoken this word, declares the LORD.”

contents.verseText: In Jerusalem, then, Jeremiah the prophet relayed all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah
contents: In Jerusalem, then, Jeremiah the prophet relayed all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah

contents.verseText: as the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and the remaining cities of Judah—against Lachish and Azekah. For these were the only fortified cities remaining in Judah.
contents: as the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and the remaining cities of Judah—against Lachish and Azekah. For these were the only fortified cities remaining in Judah.

contents.verseText: After King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to proclaim liberty, the word came to Jeremiah from the LORD
contents: After King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to proclaim liberty, the word came to Jeremiah from the LORD

contents.verseText: that each man should free his Hebrew slaves, both male and female, and no one should hold his fellow Jew in bondage.
contents: that each man should free his Hebrew slaves, both male and female, and no one should hold his fellow Jew in bondage.

contents.verseText: So all the officials and all the people who entered into this covenant agreed that they would free their menservants and maidservants and no longer hold them in bondage. They obeyed and released them,
contents: So all the officials and all the people who entered into this covenant agreed that they would free their menservants and maidservants and no longer hold them in bondage. They obeyed and released them,

contents.verseText: but later they changed their minds and took back the menservants and maidservants they had freed, and they forced them to become slaves again.
contents: but later they changed their minds and took back the menservants and maidservants they had freed, and they forced them to become slaves again.

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: I made a covenant with your forefathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery, saying:
contents: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: I made a covenant with your forefathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery, saying:

contents.verseText: Every seventh year, each of you must free his Hebrew brother who has sold himself to you. He may serve you six years, but then you must let him go free. But your fathers did not listen or incline their ear.
contents: Every seventh year, each of you must free his Hebrew brother who has sold himself to you. He may serve you six years, but then you must let him go free. But your fathers did not listen or incline their ear.

contents.verseText: Recently you repented and did what pleased Me; each of you proclaimed freedom for his neighbor. You made a covenant before Me in the house that bears My Name.
contents: Recently you repented and did what pleased Me; each of you proclaimed freedom for his neighbor. You made a covenant before Me in the house that bears My Name.

contents.verseText: But now you have changed your minds and profaned My name. Each of you has taken back the menservants and maidservants whom you had set at liberty to go wherever they wanted, and you have again forced them to be your slaves.
contents: But now you have changed your minds and profaned My name. Each of you has taken back the menservants and maidservants whom you had set at liberty to go wherever they wanted, and you have again forced them to be your slaves.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: You have not obeyed Me; you have not proclaimed freedom, each man for his brother and for his neighbor. So now I proclaim freedom for you, declares the LORD—freedom to fall by sword, by plague, and by famine! I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says: You have not obeyed Me; you have not proclaimed freedom, each man for his brother and for his neighbor. So now I proclaim freedom for you, declares the LORD—freedom to fall by sword, by plague, and by famine! I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.

contents.verseText: And those who have transgressed My covenant and have not fulfilled the terms of the covenant they made before Me, I will treat like the calf they cut in two in order to pass between its pieces.
contents: And those who have transgressed My covenant and have not fulfilled the terms of the covenant they made before Me, I will treat like the calf they cut in two in order to pass between its pieces.

contents.verseText: The officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the court officials, the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the pieces of the calf,
contents: The officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the court officials, the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the pieces of the calf,

contents.verseText: I will deliver into the hands of their enemies who seek their lives. Their corpses will become food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth.
contents: I will deliver into the hands of their enemies who seek their lives. Their corpses will become food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth.

contents.verseText: And I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials into the hands of their enemies who seek their lives, to the army of the king of Babylon that had withdrawn from you.
contents: And I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials into the hands of their enemies who seek their lives, to the army of the king of Babylon that had withdrawn from you.

contents.verseText: Behold, I am going to give the command, declares the LORD, and I will bring them back to this city. They will fight against it, capture it, and burn it down. And I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.”
contents: Behold, I am going to give the command, declares the LORD, and I will bring them back to this city. They will fight against it, capture it, and burn it down. And I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.”

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:

contents.verseText: “Go to the house of the Rechabites, speak to them, and bring them to one of the chambers of the house of the LORD to offer them a drink of wine.”
contents: “Go to the house of the Rechabites, speak to them, and bring them to one of the chambers of the house of the LORD to offer them a drink of wine.”

contents.verseText: So I took Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, and his brothers and all his sons—the entire house of the Rechabites—
contents: So I took Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, and his brothers and all his sons—the entire house of the Rechabites—

contents.verseText: and I brought them into the house of the LORD, to a chamber occupied by the sons of Hanan son of Igdaliah, a man of God. This room was near the chamber of the officials, which was above the chamber of Maaseiah son of Shallum the doorkeeper.
contents: and I brought them into the house of the LORD, to a chamber occupied by the sons of Hanan son of Igdaliah, a man of God. This room was near the chamber of the officials, which was above the chamber of Maaseiah son of Shallum the doorkeeper.

contents.verseText: Then I set pitchers full of wine and some cups before the men of the house of the Rechabites, and I said to them, “Drink some wine.”
contents: Then I set pitchers full of wine and some cups before the men of the house of the Rechabites, and I said to them, “Drink some wine.”

contents.verseText: “We do not drink wine,” they replied, “for our forefather Jonadab son of Rechab commanded us, ‘Neither you nor your descendants are ever to drink wine.
contents: “We do not drink wine,” they replied, “for our forefather Jonadab

footnote.ft: Jonadab is a variant of Jehonadab; here and throughout this chapter; see 2 Kings 10:15.

contents: son of Rechab commanded us, ‘Neither you nor your descendants are ever to drink wine.

contents.verseText: Nor are you ever to build a house or sow seed or plant a vineyard. Those things are not for you. Instead, you must live in tents all your lives, so that you may live a long time in the land where you wander.’
contents: Nor are you ever to build a house or sow seed or plant a vineyard. Those things are not for you. Instead, you must live in tents all your lives, so that you may live a long time in the land where you wander.’

contents.verseText: And we have obeyed the voice of our forefather Jonadab son of Rechab in all he commanded us. So we have not drunk wine all our lives—neither we nor our wives nor our sons and daughters.
contents: And we have obeyed the voice of our forefather Jonadab son of Rechab in all he commanded us. So we have not drunk wine all our lives—neither we nor our wives nor our sons and daughters.

contents.verseText: Nor have we built houses in which to live, and we have not owned any vineyards or fields or crops.
contents: Nor have we built houses in which to live, and we have not owned any vineyards or fields or crops.

contents.verseText: But we have lived in tents and have obeyed and done exactly as our forefather Jonadab commanded us.
contents: But we have lived in tents and have obeyed and done exactly as our forefather Jonadab commanded us.

contents.verseText: So when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched into the land, we said: ‘Come, let us go into Jerusalem to escape the armies of the Chaldeans and the Arameans.’ So we have remained in Jerusalem.”
contents: So when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched into the land, we said: ‘Come, let us go into Jerusalem to escape the armies of the Chaldeans

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians

contents: and the Arameans.’ So we have remained in Jerusalem.”

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Go and tell the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem: ‘Will you not accept discipline and obey My words?’ declares the LORD.
contents: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Go and tell the men of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem: ‘Will you not accept discipline and obey My words?’ declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: The words of Jonadab son of Rechab have been carried out. He commanded his sons not to drink wine, and they have not drunk it to this very day because they have obeyed the command of their forefather. But I have spoken to you again and again, and you have not obeyed Me!
contents: The words of Jonadab son of Rechab have been carried out. He commanded his sons not to drink wine, and they have not drunk it to this very day because they have obeyed the command of their forefather. But I have spoken to you again and again,

footnote.ft: Literally But I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking,

contents: and you have not obeyed Me!

contents.verseText: Again and again I have sent you all My servants the prophets, proclaiming: ‘Turn now, each of you, from your wicked ways, and correct your actions. Do not go after other gods to serve them. Live in the land that I have given to you and your fathers.’ But you have not inclined your ear or listened to Me.
contents: Again and again I have sent you

footnote.ft: Literally Rising up early and sending (you), I have sent you

contents: all My servants the prophets, proclaiming: ‘Turn now, each of you, from your wicked ways, and correct your actions. Do not go after other gods to serve them. Live in the land that I have given to you and your fathers.’ But you have not inclined your ear or listened to Me.

contents.verseText: Yes, the sons of Jonadab son of Rechab carried out the command their forefather gave them, but these people have not listened to Me.
contents: Yes, the sons of Jonadab son of Rechab carried out the command their forefather gave them, but these people have not listened to Me.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will bring to Judah and to all the residents of Jerusalem all the disaster I have pronounced against them, because I have spoken to them but they have not obeyed, and I have called to them but they have not answered.’”
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will bring to Judah and to all the residents of Jerusalem all the disaster I have pronounced against them, because I have spoken to them but they have not obeyed, and I have called to them but they have not answered.’”

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Because you have obeyed the command of your forefather Jonadab and have kept all his commandments and have done all that he charged you to do,
contents: Then Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Because you have obeyed the command of your forefather Jonadab and have kept all his commandments and have done all that he charged you to do,

contents.verseText: this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Jonadab son of Rechab will never fail to have a man to stand before Me.’”
contents: this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Jonadab son of Rechab will never fail to have a man to stand before Me.’”

s1: Jeremiah’s Scroll Read in the Temple

contents.verseText: In the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
contents: In the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

contents.verseText: “Take a scroll and write on it all the words I have spoken to you concerning Israel, Judah, and all the nations, from the day I first spoke to you during the reign of Josiah until today.
contents: “Take a scroll and write on it all the words I have spoken to you concerning Israel, Judah, and all the nations, from the day I first spoke to you during the reign of Josiah until today.

contents.verseText: Perhaps when the people of Judah hear about all the calamity I plan to bring upon them, each of them will turn from his wicked way. Then I will forgive their iniquity and their sin.”
contents: Perhaps when the people of Judah hear about all the calamity I plan to bring upon them, each of them will turn from his wicked way. Then I will forgive their iniquity and their sin.”

contents.verseText: So Jeremiah called Baruch son of Neriah, and at the dictation of Jeremiah, Baruch wrote on a scroll all the words that the LORD had spoken to Jeremiah.
contents: So Jeremiah called Baruch son of Neriah, and at the dictation of Jeremiah, Baruch wrote on a scroll all the words that the LORD had spoken to Jeremiah.

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah commanded Baruch, “I am restricted; I cannot enter the house of the LORD;
contents: Then Jeremiah commanded Baruch, “I am restricted; I cannot enter the house of the LORD;

contents.verseText: so you are to go to the house of the LORD on a day of fasting, and in the hearing of the people you are to read the words of the LORD from the scroll you have written at my dictation. Read them in the hearing of all the people of Judah who are coming from their cities.
contents: so you are to go to the house of the LORD on a day of fasting, and in the hearing of the people you are to read the words of the LORD from the scroll you have written at my dictation. Read them in the hearing of all the people of Judah who are coming from their cities.

contents.verseText: Perhaps they will bring their petition before the LORD, and each one will turn from his wicked way; for great are the anger and fury that the LORD has pronounced against this people.”
contents: Perhaps they will bring their petition before the LORD, and each one will turn from his wicked way; for great are the anger and fury that the LORD has pronounced against this people.”

contents.verseText: So Baruch son of Neriah did everything that Jeremiah the prophet had commanded him. In the house of the LORD he read the words of the LORD from the scroll.
contents: So Baruch son of Neriah did everything that Jeremiah the prophet had commanded him. In the house of the LORD he read the words of the LORD from the scroll.

contents.verseText: Now in the ninth month of the fifth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, a fast before the LORD was proclaimed to all the people of Jerusalem and all who had come there from the cities of Judah.
contents: Now in the ninth month of the fifth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, a fast before the LORD was proclaimed to all the people of Jerusalem and all who had come there from the cities of Judah.

contents.verseText: From the chamber of Gemariah son of Shaphan the scribe, which was in the upper courtyard at the opening of the New Gate of the house of the LORD, Baruch read from the scroll the words of Jeremiah in the hearing of all the people.
contents: From the chamber of Gemariah son of Shaphan the scribe, which was in the upper courtyard at the opening of the New Gate of the house of the LORD, Baruch read from the scroll the words of Jeremiah in the hearing of all the people.

s1: Jeremiah’s Scroll Read in the Palace

contents.verseText: When Micaiah son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the LORD from the scroll,
contents: When Micaiah son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the LORD from the scroll,

contents.verseText: he went down to the scribe’s chamber in the king’s palace, where all the officials were sitting: Elishama the scribe, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Achbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.
contents: he went down to the scribe’s chamber in the king’s palace, where all the officials were sitting: Elishama the scribe, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Achbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.

contents.verseText: And Micaiah reported to them all the words he had heard Baruch read from the scroll in the hearing of the people.
contents: And Micaiah reported to them all the words he had heard Baruch read from the scroll in the hearing of the people.

contents.verseText: Then all the officials sent word to Baruch through Jehudi son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, saying, “Bring the scroll that you read in the hearing of the people, and come here.” So Baruch son of Neriah took the scroll and went to them.
contents: Then all the officials sent word to Baruch through Jehudi son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, saying, “Bring the scroll that you read in the hearing of the people, and come here.”
So Baruch son of Neriah took the scroll and went to them.

contents.verseText: “Please sit down,” they said, “and read it in our hearing.” So Baruch read it in their hearing.
contents: “Please sit down,” they said, “and read it in our hearing.”
So Baruch read it in their hearing.

contents.verseText: When they had heard all these words, they turned to one another in fear and said to Baruch, “Surely we must report all these words to the king.”
contents: When they had heard all these words, they turned to one another in fear and said to Baruch, “Surely we must report all these words to the king.”

contents.verseText: “Tell us now,” they asked Baruch, “how did you write all these words? Was it at Jeremiah’s dictation?”
contents: “Tell us now,” they asked Baruch, “how did you write all these words? Was it at Jeremiah’s dictation?”

contents.verseText: “It was at his dictation,” Baruch replied. “He recited all these words to me and I wrote them in ink on the scroll.”
contents: “It was at his dictation,” Baruch replied. “He recited all these words to me and I wrote them in ink on the scroll.”

contents.verseText: Then the officials said to Baruch, “You and Jeremiah must hide yourselves and tell no one where you are.”
contents: Then the officials said to Baruch, “You and Jeremiah must hide yourselves and tell no one where you are.”

contents.verseText: So the officials went to the king in the courtyard. And having stored the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, they reported everything to the king.
contents: So the officials went to the king in the courtyard. And having stored the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, they reported everything to the king.

contents.verseText: Then the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and he took it from the chamber of Elishama the scribe. And Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king and all the officials who were standing beside him.
contents: Then the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and he took it from the chamber of Elishama the scribe. And Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king and all the officials who were standing beside him.

contents.verseText: Since it was the ninth month, the king was sitting in his winter quarters with a fire burning before him.
contents: Since it was the ninth month, the king was sitting in his winter quarters with a fire burning before him.

contents.verseText: And as soon as Jehudi had read three or four columns, Jehoiakim would cut them off with a scribe’s knife and throw them into the firepot, until the entire scroll had been consumed by the fire.
contents: And as soon as Jehudi had read three or four columns, Jehoiakim would cut them off with a scribe’s knife and throw them into the firepot, until the entire scroll had been consumed by the fire.

contents.verseText: Yet in hearing all these words, the king and his servants did not become frightened or tear their garments.
contents: Yet in hearing all these words, the king and his servants did not become frightened or tear their garments.

contents.verseText: Even though Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah urged the king not to burn the scroll, he would not listen to them.
contents: Even though Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah urged the king not to burn the scroll, he would not listen to them.

contents.verseText: Instead, the king commanded Jerahmeel, a son of the king, as well as Seraiah son of Azriel and Shelemiah son of Abdeel, to seize Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet. But the LORD had hidden them.
contents: Instead, the king commanded Jerahmeel, a son of the king, as well as Seraiah son of Azriel and Shelemiah son of Abdeel, to seize Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet. But the LORD had hidden them.

contents.verseText: After the king had burned the scroll containing the words that Baruch had written at Jeremiah’s dictation, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
contents: After the king had burned the scroll containing the words that Baruch had written at Jeremiah’s dictation, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

contents.verseText: “Take another scroll and rewrite on it the very words that were on the original scroll, which Jehoiakim king of Judah has burned.
contents: “Take another scroll and rewrite on it the very words that were on the original scroll, which Jehoiakim king of Judah has burned.

contents.verseText: You are to proclaim concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah that this is what the LORD says: You have burned the scroll and said, ‘Why have you written on it that the king of Babylon would surely come and destroy this land and deprive it of man and beast?’
contents: You are to proclaim concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah that this is what the LORD says: You have burned the scroll and said, ‘Why have you written on it that the king of Babylon would surely come and destroy this land and deprive it of man and beast?’

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says about Jehoiakim king of Judah: He will have no one to sit on David’s throne, and his body will be thrown out and exposed to heat by day and frost by night.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says about Jehoiakim king of Judah: He will have no one to sit on David’s throne, and his body will be thrown out and exposed to heat by day and frost by night.

contents.verseText: I will punish him and his descendants and servants for their iniquity. I will bring on them, on the residents of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah, all the calamity about which I warned them but they did not listen.”
contents: I will punish him and his descendants and servants for their iniquity. I will bring on them, on the residents of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah, all the calamity about which I warned them but they did not listen.”

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to the scribe Baruch son of Neriah, and at Jeremiah’s dictation he wrote on it all the words of the scroll that Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire. And many similar words were added to them.
contents: Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to the scribe Baruch son of Neriah, and at Jeremiah’s dictation he wrote on it all the words of the scroll that Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire. And many similar words were added to them.
