contents.verseText: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made Zedekiah son of Josiah the king of Judah, and he reigned in place of Coniah son of Jehoiakim.
contents: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made Zedekiah son of Josiah the king of Judah, and he reigned in place of Coniah

footnote.ft: Coniah is a variant of Jehoiachin.

contents: son of Jehoiakim.

contents.verseText: But he and his officers and the people of the land refused to obey the words that the LORD had spoken through Jeremiah the prophet.
contents: But he and his officers and the people of the land refused to obey the words that the LORD had spoken through Jeremiah the prophet.

contents.verseText: Yet King Zedekiah sent Jehucal son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the priest, the son of Maaseiah, to Jeremiah the prophet with the message, “Please pray to the LORD our God for us!”
contents: Yet King Zedekiah sent Jehucal

footnote.ft: Jehucal is a variant of Jucal; see Jeremiah 38:1.

contents: son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the priest, the son of Maaseiah, to Jeremiah the prophet with the message, “Please pray to the LORD our God for us!”

contents.verseText: Now Jeremiah was free to come and go among the people, for they had not yet put him in prison.
contents: Now Jeremiah was free to come and go among the people, for they had not yet put him in prison.

contents.verseText: Pharaoh’s army had left Egypt, and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard the report, they withdrew from Jerusalem.
contents: Pharaoh’s army had left Egypt, and when the Chaldeans

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verses 8, 9, 13, and 14

contents: who were besieging Jerusalem heard the report, they withdrew from Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah the prophet:
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah the prophet:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says that you are to tell the king of Judah, who sent you to Me: Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which has marched out to help you, will go back to its own land of Egypt.
contents: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says that you are to tell the king of Judah, who sent you to Me: Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which has marched out to help you, will go back to its own land of Egypt.

contents.verseText: Then the Chaldeans will return and fight against this city. They will capture it and burn it down.
contents: Then the Chaldeans will return and fight against this city. They will capture it and burn it down.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: Do not deceive yourselves by saying, ‘The Chaldeans will go away for good,’ for they will not!
contents: This is what the LORD says: Do not deceive yourselves by saying, ‘The Chaldeans will go away for good,’ for they will not!

contents.verseText: Indeed, if you were to strike down the entire army of the Chaldeans that is fighting against you, and only wounded men remained in their tents, they would still get up and burn this city down.”
contents: Indeed, if you were to strike down the entire army of the Chaldeans that is fighting against you, and only wounded men remained in their tents, they would still get up and burn this city down.”

contents.verseText: When the Chaldean army withdrew from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,
contents: When the Chaldean army withdrew from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,

contents.verseText: Jeremiah started to leave Jerusalem to go to the land of Benjamin to claim his portion there among the people.
contents: Jeremiah started to leave Jerusalem to go to the land of Benjamin to claim his portion there

footnote.ft: Literally to divide from there

contents: among the people.

contents.verseText: But when he reached the Gate of Benjamin, the captain of the guard, whose name was Irijah son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah, seized him and said, “You are deserting to the Chaldeans!”
contents: But when he reached the Gate of Benjamin, the captain of the guard, whose name was Irijah son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah, seized him and said, “You are deserting to the Chaldeans!”

contents.verseText: “That is a lie,” Jeremiah replied. “I am not deserting to the Chaldeans!” But Irijah would not listen to him; instead, he arrested Jeremiah and took him to the officials.
contents: “That is a lie,” Jeremiah replied. “I am not deserting to the Chaldeans!”
But Irijah would not listen to him; instead, he arrested Jeremiah and took him to the officials.

contents.verseText: The officials were angry with Jeremiah, and they beat him and placed him in jail in the house of Jonathan the scribe, for it had been made into a prison.
contents: The officials were angry with Jeremiah, and they beat him and placed him in jail in the house of Jonathan the scribe, for it had been made into a prison.

contents.verseText: So Jeremiah went into a cell in the dungeon and remained there a long time.
contents: So Jeremiah went into a cell in the dungeon and remained there a long time.

contents.verseText: Later, King Zedekiah sent for Jeremiah and received him in his palace, where he asked him privately, “Is there a word from the LORD?” “There is,” Jeremiah replied. “You will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.”
contents: Later, King Zedekiah sent for Jeremiah and received him in his palace, where he asked him privately, “Is there a word from the LORD?”
“There is,” Jeremiah replied. “You will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.”

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah asked King Zedekiah, “How have I sinned against you or your servants or these people, that you have put me in prison?
contents: Then Jeremiah asked King Zedekiah, “How have I sinned against you or your servants or these people, that you have put me in prison?

contents.verseText: Where are your prophets who prophesied to you, claiming, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you or this land’?
contents: Where are your prophets who prophesied to you, claiming, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you or this land’?

contents.verseText: But now please listen, O my lord the king. May my petition come before you. Do not send me back to the house of Jonathan the scribe, or I will die there.”
contents: But now please listen, O my lord the king. May my petition come before you. Do not send me back to the house of Jonathan the scribe, or I will die there.”

contents.verseText: So King Zedekiah gave orders for Jeremiah to be placed in the courtyard of the guard and given a loaf of bread daily from the street of the bakers, until all the bread in the city was gone. So Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard.
contents: So King Zedekiah gave orders for Jeremiah to be placed in the courtyard of the guard and given a loaf of bread daily from the street of the bakers, until all the bread in the city was gone. So Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard.

contents.verseText: Now Shephatiah son of Mattan, Gedaliah son of Pashhur, Jucal son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur son of Malchijah heard that Jeremiah had been telling all the people:
contents: Now Shephatiah son of Mattan, Gedaliah son of Pashhur, Jucal

footnote.ft: Jucal is a variant of Jehucal; see Jeremiah 37:3.

contents: son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur son of Malchijah heard that Jeremiah had been telling all the people:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD says: Whoever stays in this city will die by sword and famine and plague, but whoever surrenders to the Chaldeans will live; he will retain his life like a spoil of war, and he will live.
contents: “This is what the LORD says: Whoever stays in this city will die by sword and famine and plague, but whoever surrenders to the Chaldeans

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verses 18, 19, and 23

contents: will live; he will retain his life like a spoil of war, and he will live.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: This city will surely be delivered into the hands of the army of the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.”
contents: This is what the LORD says: This city will surely be delivered into the hands of the army of the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.”

contents.verseText: Then the officials said to the king, “This man ought to die, for he is discouraging the warriors who remain in this city, as well as all the people, by speaking such words to them; this man is not seeking the well-being of these people, but their ruin.”
contents: Then the officials said to the king, “This man ought to die, for he is discouraging the warriors who remain in this city, as well as all the people, by speaking such words to them; this man is not seeking the well-being of these people, but their ruin.”

contents.verseText: “Here he is,” replied King Zedekiah. “He is in your hands, since the king can do nothing to stop you.”
contents: “Here he is,” replied King Zedekiah. “He is in your hands, since the king can do nothing to stop you.”

contents.verseText: So they took Jeremiah and dropped him into the cistern of Malchiah, the king’s son, which was in the courtyard of the guard. They lowered Jeremiah with ropes into the cistern, which had no water but only mud, and Jeremiah sank down into the mud.
contents: So they took Jeremiah and dropped him into the cistern of Malchiah, the king’s son, which was in the courtyard of the guard. They lowered Jeremiah with ropes into the cistern, which had no water but only mud, and Jeremiah sank down into the mud.

contents.verseText: Now Ebed-melech the Cushite, a court official in the royal palace, heard that Jeremiah had been put into the cistern. While the king was sitting at the Gate of Benjamin,
contents: Now Ebed-melech the Cushite,

footnote.ft: Probably from the upper Nile region

contents: a court official

footnote.ft: Or eunuch

contents: in the royal palace, heard that Jeremiah had been put into the cistern. While the king was sitting at the Gate of Benjamin,

contents.verseText: Ebed-melech went out from the king’s palace and said to the king,
contents: Ebed-melech went out from the king’s palace and said to the king,

contents.verseText: “My lord the king, these men have acted wickedly in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet. They have dropped him into the cistern, where he will starve to death, for there is no more bread in the city.”
contents: “My lord the king, these men have acted wickedly in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet. They have dropped him into the cistern, where he will starve to death, for there is no more bread in the city.”

contents.verseText: So the king commanded Ebed-melech the Cushite, “Take thirty men from here with you and pull Jeremiah the prophet out of the cistern before he dies.”
contents: So the king commanded Ebed-melech the Cushite, “Take thirty men from here with you and pull Jeremiah the prophet out of the cistern before he dies.”

contents.verseText: Then Ebed-melech took the men with him and went to the king’s palace, to a place below the storehouse. From there he took old rags and worn-out clothes and lowered them with ropes to Jeremiah in the cistern.
contents: Then Ebed-melech took the men with him and went to the king’s palace, to a place below the storehouse. From there he took old rags and worn-out clothes and lowered them with ropes to Jeremiah in the cistern.

contents.verseText: Ebed-melech the Cushite cried out to Jeremiah, “Put these worn-out rags and clothes under your arms to pad the ropes.” Jeremiah did so,
contents: Ebed-melech the Cushite cried out to Jeremiah, “Put these worn-out rags and clothes under your arms to pad the ropes.” Jeremiah did so,

contents.verseText: and they pulled him up with the ropes and lifted him out of the cistern. And Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard.
contents: and they pulled him up with the ropes and lifted him out of the cistern. And Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard.

contents.verseText: Then King Zedekiah sent for Jeremiah the prophet and received him at the third entrance to the house of the LORD. “I am going to ask you something,” said the king to Jeremiah. “Do not hide anything from me.”
contents: Then King Zedekiah sent for Jeremiah the prophet and received him at the third entrance to the house of the LORD. “I am going to ask you something,” said the king to Jeremiah. “Do not hide anything from me.”

contents.verseText: “If I tell you,” Jeremiah replied, “you will surely put me to death. And even if I give you advice, you will not listen to me.”
contents: “If I tell you,” Jeremiah replied, “you will surely put me to death. And even if I give you advice, you will not listen to me.”

contents.verseText: But King Zedekiah swore secretly to Jeremiah, “As surely as the LORD lives, who has given us this life, I will not kill you, nor will I deliver you into the hands of these men who are seeking your life.”
contents: But King Zedekiah swore secretly to Jeremiah, “As surely as the LORD lives, who has given us this life, I will not kill you, nor will I deliver you into the hands of these men who are seeking your life.”

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “This is what the LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘If you indeed surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, then you will live, this city will not be burned down, and you and your household will survive.
contents: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “This is what the LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘If you indeed surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, then you will live, this city will not be burned down, and you and your household will survive.

contents.verseText: But if you do not surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, then this city will be delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans. They will burn it down, and you yourself will not escape their grasp.’”
contents: But if you do not surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, then this city will be delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans. They will burn it down, and you yourself will not escape their grasp.’”

contents.verseText: But King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “I am afraid of the Jews who have deserted to the Chaldeans, for the Chaldeans may deliver me into their hands to abuse me.”
contents: But King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “I am afraid of the Jews who have deserted to the Chaldeans, for the Chaldeans may deliver me into their hands to abuse me.”

contents.verseText: “They will not hand you over,” Jeremiah replied. “Obey the voice of the LORD in what I am telling you, that it may go well with you and you may live.
contents: “They will not hand you over,” Jeremiah replied. “Obey the voice of the LORD in what I am telling you, that it may go well with you and you may live.

contents.verseText: But if you refuse to surrender, this is the word that the LORD has shown me:
contents: But if you refuse to surrender, this is the word that the LORD has shown me:

contents.verseText: All the women who remain in the palace of the king of Judah will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon, and those women will say: ‘They misled you and overcame you—those trusted friends of yours. Your feet sank into the mire, and they deserted you.’
contents: All the women who remain in the palace of the king of Judah will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon, and those women will say:
‘They misled you and overcame you—
those trusted friends of yours.
Your feet sank into the mire,
and they deserted you.’

contents.verseText: All your wives and children will be brought out to the Chaldeans. And you yourself will not escape their grasp, for you will be seized by the king of Babylon, and this city will be burned down.”
contents: All your wives and children will be brought out to the Chaldeans. And you yourself will not escape their grasp, for you will be seized by the king of Babylon, and this city will be burned down.”

contents.verseText: Then Zedekiah warned Jeremiah, “Do not let anyone know about this conversation, or you will die.
contents: Then Zedekiah warned Jeremiah, “Do not let anyone know about this conversation, or you will die.

contents.verseText: If the officials hear that I have spoken with you, and they come and demand of you, ‘Tell us what you said to the king and what he said to you; do not hide it from us, or we will kill you,’
contents: If the officials hear that I have spoken with you, and they come and demand of you, ‘Tell us what you said to the king and what he said to you; do not hide it from us, or we will kill you,’

contents.verseText: then tell them, ‘I was presenting to the king my petition that he not return me to the house of Jonathan to die there.’”
contents: then tell them, ‘I was presenting to the king my petition that he not return me to the house of Jonathan to die there.’”

contents.verseText: When all the officials came to Jeremiah and questioned him, he relayed to them the exact words the king had commanded him to say. So they said no more to him, for no one had overheard the conversation.
contents: When all the officials came to Jeremiah and questioned him, he relayed to them the exact words the king had commanded him to say. So they said no more to him, for no one had overheard the conversation.

contents.verseText: And Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard until the day Jerusalem was captured.
contents: And Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard until the day Jerusalem was captured.

contents.verseText: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army and laid siege to the city.
contents: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army and laid siege to the city.

contents.verseText: And on the ninth day of the fourth month of Zedekiah’s eleventh year, the city was breached.
contents: And on the ninth day of the fourth month of Zedekiah’s eleventh year, the city was breached.

contents.verseText: Then all the officials of the king of Babylon entered and sat in the Middle Gate: Nergal-sharezer of Samgar, Nebo-sarsekim the Rabsaris, Nergal-sharezer the Rabmag, and all the rest of the officials of the king of Babylon.
contents: Then all the officials of the king of Babylon entered and sat in the Middle Gate: Nergal-sharezer of Samgar, Nebo-sarsekim

footnote.ft: Or Nergal-sharezer, Samgar-nebo, Sarsekim

contents: the Rabsaris,

footnote.ft: Hebrew Rabsaris is the title of the chief eunuch in the Assyrian military; also in verse 13.

contents: Nergal-sharezer the Rabmag,

footnote.ft: Hebrew Rabmag is the title of the chief soothsayer or chief of princes in the Assyrian military; also in verse 13.

contents: and all the rest of the officials of the king of Babylon.

contents.verseText: When Zedekiah king of Judah and all the soldiers saw them, they fled. They left the city at night by way of the king’s garden, through the gate between the two walls, and they went out along the route to the Arabah.
contents: When Zedekiah king of Judah and all the soldiers saw them, they fled. They left the city at night by way of the king’s garden, through the gate between the two walls, and they went out along the route to the Arabah.

footnote.ft: Or the Jordan Valley

contents.verseText: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued them and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. They seized him and brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced judgment on him.
contents: But the army of the Chaldeans

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verse 8

contents: pursued them and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. They seized him and brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced judgment on him.

contents.verseText: There at Riblah the king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and he also killed all the nobles of Judah.
contents: There at Riblah the king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and he also killed all the nobles of Judah.

contents.verseText: Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes and bound him with bronze chains to take him to Babylon.
contents: Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes and bound him with bronze chains to take him to Babylon.

contents.verseText: The Chaldeans set fire to the palace of the king and to the houses of the people, and they broke down the walls of Jerusalem.
contents: The Chaldeans set fire to the palace of the king and to the houses of the people, and they broke down the walls of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Then Nebuzaradan captain of the guard carried away to Babylon the remnant of the people who had remained in the city, along with the deserters who had defected to him.
contents: Then Nebuzaradan captain of the guard carried away to Babylon the remnant of the people who had remained in the city, along with the deserters who had defected to him.

contents.verseText: But Nebuzaradan left behind in the land of Judah some of the poor people who had no property, and at that time he gave them vineyards and fields.
contents: But Nebuzaradan left behind in the land of Judah some of the poor people who had no property, and at that time he gave them vineyards and fields.

contents.verseText: Now Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had given orders about Jeremiah through Nebuzaradan captain of the guard, saying,
contents: Now Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had given orders about Jeremiah through Nebuzaradan captain of the guard, saying,

contents.verseText: “Take him, look after him, and do not let any harm come to him; do for him whatever he says.”
contents: “Take him, look after him, and do not let any harm come to him; do for him whatever he says.”

contents.verseText: So Nebuzaradan captain of the guard, Nebushazban the Rabsaris, Nergal-sharezer the Rabmag, and all the captains of the king of Babylon
contents: So Nebuzaradan captain of the guard, Nebushazban

footnote.ft: Nebushazban is possibly a variant of Nebo-sarsekim; see verse 3.

contents: the Rabsaris, Nergal-sharezer the Rabmag, and all the captains of the king of Babylon

contents.verseText: had Jeremiah brought from the courtyard of the guard, and they turned him over to Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, to take him home. So Jeremiah remained among his own people.
contents: had Jeremiah brought from the courtyard of the guard, and they turned him over to Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, to take him home. So Jeremiah remained among his own people.

contents.verseText: And while Jeremiah had been confined in the courtyard of the guard, the word of the LORD had come to him:
contents: And while Jeremiah had been confined in the courtyard of the guard, the word of the LORD had come to him:

contents.verseText: “Go and tell Ebed-melech the Cushite that this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I am about to fulfill My words against this city for harm and not for good, and on that day they will be fulfilled before your eyes.
contents: “Go and tell Ebed-melech the Cushite that this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I am about to fulfill My words against this city for harm and not for good, and on that day they will be fulfilled before your eyes.

contents.verseText: But I will deliver you on that day, declares the LORD, and you will not be delivered into the hands of the men whom you fear.
contents: But I will deliver you on that day, declares the LORD, and you will not be delivered into the hands of the men whom you fear.

contents.verseText: For I will surely rescue you so that you do not fall by the sword. Because you have trusted in Me, you will escape with your life like a spoil of war, declares the LORD.’”
contents: For I will surely rescue you so that you do not fall by the sword. Because you have trusted in Me, you will escape with your life like a spoil of war, declares the LORD.’”

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD after Nebuzaradan captain of the guard had released him at Ramah, having found him bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah who were being exiled to Babylon.
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD after Nebuzaradan captain of the guard had released him at Ramah, having found him bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah who were being exiled to Babylon.

contents.verseText: The captain of the guard found Jeremiah and said to him, “The LORD your God decreed this disaster on this place,
contents: The captain of the guard found Jeremiah and said to him, “The LORD your God decreed this disaster on this place,

contents.verseText: and now the LORD has fulfilled it; He has done just as He said. Because you people have sinned against the LORD and have not obeyed His voice, this thing has happened to you.
contents: and now the LORD has fulfilled it; He has done just as He said. Because you people have sinned against the LORD and have not obeyed His voice, this thing has happened to you.

contents.verseText: But now, behold, I am freeing you today from the chains that were on your wrists. If it pleases you to come with me to Babylon, then come, and I will take care of you. But if it seems wrong to you to come with me to Babylon, go no farther. Look, the whole land is before you. Wherever it seems good and right to you, go there.”
contents: But now, behold, I am freeing you today from the chains that were on your wrists. If it pleases you to come with me to Babylon, then come, and I will take care of you. But if it seems wrong to you to come with me to Babylon, go no farther. Look, the whole land is before you. Wherever it seems good and right to you, go there.”

contents.verseText: But before Jeremiah turned to go, Nebuzaradan added, “Return to Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has appointed over the cities of Judah, and stay with him among the people, or go anywhere else that seems right.” Then the captain of the guard gave him a ration and a gift and released him.
contents: But before Jeremiah turned to go, Nebuzaradan added, “Return to Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has appointed over the cities of Judah, and stay with him among the people, or go anywhere else that seems right.” Then the captain of the guard gave him a ration and a gift and released him.

contents.verseText: So Jeremiah went to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah and stayed with him among the people who were left in the land.
contents: So Jeremiah went to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah and stayed with him among the people who were left in the land.

contents.verseText: When all the commanders and men of the armies in the field heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam over the land and that he had put him in charge of the men, women, and children who were the poorest of the land and had not been exiled to Babylon,
contents: When all the commanders and men of the armies in the field heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam over the land and that he had put him in charge of the men, women, and children who were the poorest of the land and had not been exiled to Babylon,

contents.verseText: they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah son of the Maacathite—they and their men.
contents: they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah

footnote.ft: Jezaniah is a variant of Jaazaniah; see 2 Kings 25:23.

contents: son of the Maacathite—they and their men.

contents.verseText: Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, swore an oath to them and their men, assuring them, “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Live in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well with you.
contents: Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, swore an oath to them and their men, assuring them, “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans.

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verse 10

contents: Live in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well with you.

contents.verseText: As for me, I will stay in Mizpah to represent you before the Chaldeans who come to us. As for you, gather wine grapes, summer fruit, and oil, place them in your storage jars, and live in the cities you have taken.”
contents: As for me, I will stay in Mizpah to represent you before the Chaldeans who come to us. As for you, gather wine grapes, summer fruit, and oil, place them in your storage jars, and live in the cities you have taken.”

contents.verseText: When all the Jews in Moab, Ammon, Edom, and all the other lands heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant in Judah and had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, over them,
contents: When all the Jews in Moab, Ammon, Edom, and all the other lands heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant in Judah and had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, over them,

contents.verseText: they all returned from all the places to which they had been banished and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah. And they gathered an abundance of wine grapes and summer fruit.
contents: they all returned from all the places to which they had been banished and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah. And they gathered an abundance of wine grapes and summer fruit.

contents.verseText: Meanwhile, Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies in the field came to Gedaliah at Mizpah
contents: Meanwhile, Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies in the field came to Gedaliah at Mizpah

contents.verseText: and said to him, “Are you aware that Baalis king of the Ammonites has sent Ishmael son of Nethaniah to take your life?” But Gedaliah son of Ahikam did not believe them.
contents: and said to him, “Are you aware that Baalis king of the Ammonites has sent Ishmael son of Nethaniah to take your life?”
But Gedaliah son of Ahikam did not believe them.

contents.verseText: Then Johanan son of Kareah spoke privately to Gedaliah at Mizpah. “Let me go and kill Ishmael son of Nethaniah,” he said. “No one will know it. Why should he take your life and scatter all the people of Judah who have gathered to you, so that the remnant of Judah would perish?”
contents: Then Johanan son of Kareah spoke privately to Gedaliah at Mizpah. “Let me go and kill Ishmael son of Nethaniah,” he said. “No one will know it. Why should he take your life and scatter all the people of Judah who have gathered to you, so that the remnant of Judah would perish?”

contents.verseText: But Gedaliah son of Ahikam said to Johanan son of Kareah, “Do not do such a thing! What you are saying about Ishmael is a lie.”
contents: But Gedaliah son of Ahikam said to Johanan son of Kareah, “Do not do such a thing! What you are saying about Ishmael is a lie.”

contents.verseText: In the seventh month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, who was a member of the royal family and one of the king’s chief officers, came with ten men to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah, and they ate a meal together there.
contents: In the seventh month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, who was a member of the royal family and one of the king’s chief officers, came with ten men to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah, and they ate a meal together there.

contents.verseText: Then Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the ten men who were with him got up and struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, with the sword, killing the one whom the king of Babylon had appointed to govern the land.
contents: Then Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the ten men who were with him got up and struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, with the sword, killing the one whom the king of Babylon had appointed to govern the land.

contents.verseText: Ishmael also killed all the Jews who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, as well as the Chaldean soldiers who were there.
contents: Ishmael also killed all the Jews who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, as well as the Chaldean

footnote.ft: Or Babylonian

contents: soldiers who were there.

contents.verseText: On the second day after the murder of Gedaliah, when no one yet knew about it,
contents: On the second day after the murder of Gedaliah, when no one yet knew about it,

contents.verseText: eighty men who had shaved off their beards, torn their garments, and cut themselves came from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria, carrying grain offerings and frankincense for the house of the LORD.
contents: eighty men who had shaved off their beards, torn their garments, and cut themselves came from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria, carrying grain offerings and frankincense for the house of the LORD.

contents.verseText: And Ishmael son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he went. When Ishmael encountered the men, he said, “Come to Gedaliah son of Ahikam.”
contents: And Ishmael son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he went.
When Ishmael encountered the men, he said, “Come to Gedaliah son of Ahikam.”

contents.verseText: And when they came into the city, Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the men with him slaughtered them and threw them into a cistern.
contents: And when they came into the city, Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the men with him slaughtered them and threw them into a cistern.

contents.verseText: But ten of the men among them said to Ishmael, “Do not kill us, for we have hidden treasure in the field—wheat, barley, oil, and honey!” So he refrained from killing them with the others.
contents: But ten of the men among them said to Ishmael, “Do not kill us, for we have hidden treasure in the field—wheat, barley, oil, and honey!” So he refrained from killing them with the others.

contents.verseText: Now the cistern into which Ishmael had thrown all the bodies of the men he had struck down along with Gedaliah was a large one that King Asa had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel. Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.
contents: Now the cistern into which Ishmael had thrown all the bodies of the men he had struck down along with Gedaliah was a large one that King Asa had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel. Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.

contents.verseText: Then Ishmael took captive all the remnant of the people of Mizpah—the daughters of the king along with all the others who remained in Mizpah—over whom Nebuzaradan captain of the guard had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam. Ishmael son of Nethaniah took them captive and set off to cross over to the Ammonites.
contents: Then Ishmael took captive all the remnant of the people of Mizpah—the daughters of the king along with all the others who remained in Mizpah—over whom Nebuzaradan captain of the guard had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam. Ishmael son of Nethaniah took them captive and set off to cross over to the Ammonites.

contents.verseText: When Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies with him heard of all the crimes that Ishmael son of Nethaniah had committed,
contents: When Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies with him heard of all the crimes that Ishmael son of Nethaniah had committed,

contents.verseText: they took all their men and went to fight Ishmael son of Nethaniah. And they found him near the great pool in Gibeon.
contents: they took all their men and went to fight Ishmael son of Nethaniah. And they found him near the great pool in Gibeon.

contents.verseText: When all the people with Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the army with him, they rejoiced,
contents: When all the people with Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the army with him, they rejoiced,

contents.verseText: and all the people whom Ishmael had taken captive at Mizpah turned and went over to Johanan son of Kareah.
contents: and all the people whom Ishmael had taken captive at Mizpah turned and went over to Johanan son of Kareah.

contents.verseText: But Ishmael son of Nethaniah and eight of his men escaped from Johanan and went to the Ammonites.
contents: But Ishmael son of Nethaniah and eight of his men escaped from Johanan and went to the Ammonites.

contents.verseText: Then Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies with him took the whole remnant of the people from Mizpah whom he had recovered from Ishmael son of Nethaniah after Ishmael had killed Gedaliah son of Ahikam: the soldiers, women, children, and court officials he had brought back from Gibeon.
contents: Then Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies with him took the whole remnant of the people from Mizpah whom he had recovered from Ishmael son of Nethaniah after Ishmael had killed Gedaliah son of Ahikam: the soldiers, women, children, and court officials

footnote.ft: Or eunuchs

contents: he had brought back from Gibeon.

contents.verseText: And they went and stayed in Geruth Chimham, near Bethlehem, in order to proceed into Egypt
contents: And they went and stayed in Geruth Chimham, near Bethlehem, in order to proceed into Egypt

contents.verseText: to escape the Chaldeans. For they were afraid of the Chaldeans because Ishmael son of Nethaniah had struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.
contents: to escape the Chaldeans.

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians

contents: For they were afraid of the Chaldeans because Ishmael son of Nethaniah had struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.

s1: A Warning against Going to Egypt

contents.verseText: Then all the commanders of the forces, along with Johanan son of Kareah, Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least to the greatest, approached
contents: Then all the commanders of the forces, along with Johanan son of Kareah, Jezaniah

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX Azariah; see Jeremiah 43:2.

contents: son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least to the greatest, approached

contents.verseText: Jeremiah the prophet and said, “May our petition come before you; pray to the LORD your God on behalf of this entire remnant. For few of us remain of the many, as you can see with your own eyes.
contents: Jeremiah the prophet and said, “May our petition come before you; pray to the LORD your God on behalf of this entire remnant. For few of us remain of the many, as you can see with your own eyes.

contents.verseText: Pray that the LORD your God will tell us the way we should walk and the thing we should do.”
contents: Pray that the LORD your God will tell us the way we should walk and the thing we should do.”

contents.verseText: “I have heard you,” replied Jeremiah the prophet. “I will surely pray to the LORD your God as you request, and I will tell you everything that the LORD answers; I will not withhold a word from you.”
contents: “I have heard you,” replied Jeremiah the prophet. “I will surely pray to the LORD your God as you request, and I will tell you everything that the LORD answers; I will not withhold a word from you.”

contents.verseText: Then they said to Jeremiah, “May the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us if we do not act upon every word that the LORD your God sends you to tell us.
contents: Then they said to Jeremiah, “May the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us if we do not act upon every word that the LORD your God sends you to tell us.

contents.verseText: Whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, we will obey the voice of the LORD our God to whom we are sending you, so that it may go well with us, for we will obey the voice of the LORD our God!”
contents: Whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, we will obey the voice of the LORD our God to whom we are sending you, so that it may go well with us, for we will obey the voice of the LORD our God!”

contents.verseText: After ten days the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah,
contents: After ten days the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah,

contents.verseText: and he summoned Johanan son of Kareah, all the commanders of the forces who were with him, and all the people from the least to the greatest.
contents: and he summoned Johanan son of Kareah, all the commanders of the forces who were with him, and all the people from the least to the greatest.

contents.verseText: Jeremiah told them, “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your petition:
contents: Jeremiah told them, “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your petition:

contents.verseText: ‘If you will indeed stay in this land, then I will build you up and not tear you down; I will plant you and not uproot you, for I will relent of the disaster I have brought upon you.
contents: ‘If you will indeed stay in this land, then I will build you up and not tear you down; I will plant you and not uproot you, for I will relent of the disaster I have brought upon you.

contents.verseText: Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you now fear; do not be afraid of him, declares the LORD, for I am with you to save you and deliver you from him.
contents: Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you now fear; do not be afraid of him, declares the LORD, for I am with you to save you and deliver you from him.

contents.verseText: And I will show you compassion, and he will have compassion on you and restore you to your own land.’
contents: And I will show you compassion, and he will have compassion on you and restore you to your own land.’

contents.verseText: But if you say, ‘We will not stay in this land,’ and you thus disobey the voice of the LORD your God,
contents: But if you say, ‘We will not stay in this land,’ and you thus disobey the voice of the LORD your God,

contents.verseText: and if you say, ‘No, but we will go to the land of Egypt and live there, where we will not see war or hear the sound of the ram’s horn or hunger for bread,’
contents: and if you say, ‘No, but we will go to the land of Egypt and live there, where we will not see war or hear the sound of the ram’s horn or hunger for bread,’

contents.verseText: then hear the word of the LORD, O remnant of Judah! This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘If you are determined to go to Egypt and reside there,
contents: then hear the word of the LORD, O remnant of Judah! This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘If you are determined to go to Egypt and reside there,

contents.verseText: then the sword you fear will overtake you there, and the famine you dread will follow on your heels into Egypt, and you will die there.
contents: then the sword you fear will overtake you there, and the famine you dread will follow on your heels into Egypt, and you will die there.

contents.verseText: So all who resolve to go to Egypt to reside there will die by sword and famine and plague. Not one of them will survive or escape the disaster I will bring upon them.’
contents: So all who resolve to go to Egypt to reside there will die by sword and famine and plague. Not one of them will survive or escape the disaster I will bring upon them.’

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Just as My anger and wrath were poured out on the residents of Jerusalem, so will My wrath be poured out on you if you go to Egypt. You will become an object of cursing and horror, of vilification and disgrace, and you will never see this place again.’
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘Just as My anger and wrath were poured out on the residents of Jerusalem, so will My wrath be poured out on you if you go to Egypt. You will become an object of cursing and horror, of vilification and disgrace, and you will never see this place again.’

contents.verseText: The LORD has told you, O remnant of Judah, ‘Do not go to Egypt.’ Know for sure that I have warned you today!
contents: The LORD has told you, O remnant of Judah, ‘Do not go to Egypt.’ Know for sure that I have warned you today!

contents.verseText: For you have deceived yourselves by sending me to the LORD your God, saying, ‘Pray to the LORD our God on our behalf, and as for all that the LORD our God says, tell it to us and we will do it.’
contents: For you have deceived yourselves by sending me to the LORD your God, saying, ‘Pray to the LORD our God on our behalf, and as for all that the LORD our God says, tell it to us and we will do it.’

contents.verseText: For I have told you today, but you have not obeyed the voice of the LORD your God in all He has sent me to tell you.
contents: For I have told you today, but you have not obeyed the voice of the LORD your God in all He has sent me to tell you.

contents.verseText: Now therefore, know for sure that by sword and famine and plague you will die in the place where you desire to go to reside.”
contents: Now therefore, know for sure that by sword and famine and plague you will die in the place where you desire to go to reside.”

contents.verseText: When Jeremiah had finished telling all the people all the words of the LORD their God—everything that the LORD had sent him to say—
contents: When Jeremiah had finished telling all the people all the words of the LORD their God—everything that the LORD had sent him to say—

contents.verseText: Azariah son of Hoshaiah, Johanan son of Kareah, and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah, “You are lying! The LORD our God has not sent you to say, ‘You must not go to Egypt to reside there.’
contents: Azariah son of Hoshaiah, Johanan son of Kareah, and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah, “You are lying! The LORD our God has not sent you to say, ‘You must not go to Egypt to reside there.’

contents.verseText: Rather, Baruch son of Neriah is inciting you against us to deliver us into the hands of the Chaldeans, so that they may put us to death or exile us to Babylon!”
contents: Rather, Baruch son of Neriah is inciting you against us to deliver us into the hands of the Chaldeans,

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians

contents: so that they may put us to death or exile us to Babylon!”

contents.verseText: So Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces disobeyed the command of the LORD to stay in the land of Judah.
contents: So Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces disobeyed the command of the LORD to stay in the land of Judah.

contents.verseText: Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces took the whole remnant of Judah, those who had returned to the land of Judah from all the nations to which they had been scattered,
contents: Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces took the whole remnant of Judah, those who had returned to the land of Judah from all the nations to which they had been scattered,

contents.verseText: the men, the women, the children, the king’s daughters, and everyone whom Nebuzaradan captain of the guard had allowed to remain with Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, as well as Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch son of Neriah.
contents: the men, the women, the children, the king’s daughters, and everyone whom Nebuzaradan captain of the guard had allowed to remain with Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, as well as Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch son of Neriah.

contents.verseText: So they entered the land of Egypt because they did not obey the voice of the LORD, and they went as far as Tahpanhes.
contents: So they entered the land of Egypt because they did not obey the voice of the LORD, and they went as far as Tahpanhes.

contents.verseText: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah at Tahpanhes:
contents: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah at Tahpanhes:

contents.verseText: “In the sight of the Jews, pick up some large stones and bury them in the clay of the brick pavement at the entrance to Pharaoh’s palace at Tahpanhes.
contents: “In the sight of the Jews, pick up some large stones and bury them in the clay of the brick pavement at the entrance to Pharaoh’s palace at Tahpanhes.

contents.verseText: Then tell them that this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I will send for My servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and I will set his throne over these stones that I have embedded, and he will spread his royal pavilion over them.
contents: Then tell them that this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: ‘I will send for My servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and I will set his throne over these stones that I have embedded, and he will spread his royal pavilion over them.

contents.verseText: He will come and strike down the land of Egypt, bringing death to those destined for death, captivity to those destined for captivity, and the sword to those destined for the sword.
contents: He will come and strike down the land of Egypt, bringing death to those destined for death, captivity to those destined for captivity, and the sword to those destined for the sword.

contents.verseText: I will kindle a fire in the temples of the gods of Egypt, and Nebuchadnezzar will burn those temples and take their gods as captives. So he will wrap himself with the land of Egypt as a shepherd wraps himself in his garment, and he will depart from there unscathed.
contents: I will kindle a fire in the temples of the gods of Egypt, and Nebuchadnezzar will burn those temples and take their gods as captives.

footnote.ft: Literally and he will burn them and take them captive

contents: So he will wrap himself with the land of Egypt as a shepherd wraps himself in his garment, and he will depart from there unscathed.

contents.verseText: He will demolish the sacred pillars of the temple of the sun in the land of Egypt, and he will burn down the temples of the gods of Egypt.’”
contents: He will demolish the sacred pillars of the temple of the sun in the land of Egypt,

footnote.ft: LXX He will demolish the pillars of Heliopolis in On or He will demolish the pillars of Heliopolis in Egypt; Hebrew He will demolish the pillars of Beth-shemesh in the land of Egypt

contents: and he will burn down the temples of the gods of Egypt.’”

s1: Judgment on the Jews in Egypt

contents.verseText: This is the word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews living in the land of Egypt—in Migdol, Tahpanhes, and Memphis—and in the land of Pathros:
contents: This is the word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews living in the land of Egypt

footnote.ft: Or Lower Egypt or northern Egypt; also in verse 15

contents: —in Migdol, Tahpanhes, and Memphis

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew Noph

contents: —and in the land of Pathros:

footnote.ft: Or Upper Egypt or southern Egypt; also in verse 15

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: You have seen all the disaster that I brought against Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah; and behold, they lie today in ruins and desolation
contents: “This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: You have seen all the disaster that I brought against Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah; and behold, they lie today in ruins and desolation

contents.verseText: because of the evil they have done. They provoked Me to anger by continuing to burn incense and to serve other gods that neither they nor you nor your fathers ever knew.
contents: because of the evil they have done.
They provoked Me to anger by continuing to burn incense and to serve other gods that neither they nor you nor your fathers ever knew.

contents.verseText: Yet I sent you all My servants the prophets again and again, saying: ‘Do not do this detestable thing that I hate.’
contents: Yet I sent you all My servants the prophets again and again,

footnote.ft: Literally the prophets, rising up early and sending (them),

contents: saying: ‘Do not do this detestable thing that I hate.’

contents.verseText: But they did not listen or incline their ears; they did not turn from their wickedness or stop burning incense to other gods.
contents: But they did not listen or incline their ears; they did not turn from their wickedness or stop burning incense to other gods.

contents.verseText: Therefore My wrath and anger poured out and burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, so that they have become the desolate ruin they are today.
contents: Therefore My wrath and anger poured out and burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, so that they have become the desolate ruin they are today.

contents.verseText: So now, this is what the LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Why are you doing such great harm to yourselves by cutting off from Judah man and woman, child and infant, leaving yourselves without a remnant?
contents: So now, this is what the LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Why are you doing such great harm to yourselves by cutting off from Judah man and woman, child and infant, leaving yourselves without a remnant?

contents.verseText: Why are you provoking Me to anger by the work of your hands by burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt, where you have gone to reside? As a result, you will be cut off and will become an object of cursing and reproach among all the nations of the earth.
contents: Why are you provoking Me to anger by the work of your hands by burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt, where you have gone to reside?
As a result, you will be cut off and will become an object of cursing and reproach among all the nations of the earth.

contents.verseText: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers and of the kings of Judah and their wives, as well as the wickedness that you and your wives committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
contents: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers and of the kings of Judah and their wives, as well as the wickedness that you and your wives committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

contents.verseText: To this day they have not humbled themselves or shown reverence, nor have they followed My instruction or the statutes that I set before you and your fathers.
contents: To this day they have not humbled themselves or shown reverence, nor have they followed My instruction or the statutes that I set before you and your fathers.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: I will set My face to bring disaster and to cut off all Judah.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: I will set My face to bring disaster and to cut off all Judah.

contents.verseText: And I will take away the remnant of Judah who have resolved to go to the land of Egypt to reside there; they will meet their end. They will all fall by the sword or be consumed by famine. From the least to the greatest, they will die by sword or famine; and they will become an object of cursing and horror, of vilification and reproach.
contents: And I will take away the remnant of Judah who have resolved to go to the land of Egypt to reside there; they will meet their end. They will all fall by the sword or be consumed by famine. From the least to the greatest, they will die by sword or famine; and they will become an object of cursing and horror, of vilification and reproach.

contents.verseText: I will punish those who live in the land of Egypt, just as I punished Jerusalem, by sword and famine and plague,
contents: I will punish those who live in the land of Egypt, just as I punished Jerusalem, by sword and famine and plague,

contents.verseText: so that none of the remnant of Judah who have gone to reside in Egypt will escape or survive to return to the land of Judah, where they long to return and live; for none will return except a few fugitives.”
contents: so that none of the remnant of Judah who have gone to reside in Egypt will escape or survive to return to the land of Judah, where they long to return and live; for none will return except a few fugitives.”

contents.verseText: Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, and all the women standing by—a great assembly—along with all the people living in the land of Egypt and in Pathros, said to Jeremiah,
contents: Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, and all the women standing by—a great assembly—along with all the people living in the land of Egypt and in Pathros,

footnote.ft: That is, in Lower and Upper Egypt; possibly in the land of Egypt at Pathros

contents: said to Jeremiah,

contents.verseText: “As for the word you have spoken to us in the name of the LORD, we will not listen to you!
contents: “As for the word you have spoken to us in the name of the LORD, we will not listen to you!

contents.verseText: Instead, we will do everything we vowed to do: We will burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and offer drink offerings to her, just as we, our fathers, our kings, and our officials did in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. At that time we had plenty of food and good things, and we saw no disaster.
contents: Instead, we will do everything we vowed to do: We will burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and offer drink offerings to her, just as we, our fathers, our kings, and our officials did in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem.
At that time we had plenty of food and good things, and we saw no disaster.

contents.verseText: But from the time we stopped burning incense to the Queen of Heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have been perishing by sword and famine.”
contents: But from the time we stopped burning incense to the Queen of Heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have been perishing by sword and famine.”

contents.verseText: “Moreover,” said the women, “when we burned incense to the Queen of Heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, was it without our husbands’ knowledge that we made sacrificial cakes in her image and poured out drink offerings to her?”
contents: “Moreover,” said the women, “when we burned incense to the Queen of Heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, was it without our husbands’ knowledge that we made sacrificial cakes in her image and poured out drink offerings to her?”

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, both men and women, who were answering him,
contents: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, both men and women, who were answering him,

contents.verseText: “As for the incense you burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem—you, your fathers, your kings, your officials, and the people of the land—did the LORD not remember and bring this to mind?
contents: “As for the incense you burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem—you, your fathers, your kings, your officials, and the people of the land—did the LORD not remember and bring this to mind?

contents.verseText: So the LORD could no longer endure the evil deeds and detestable acts you committed, and your land became a desolation, a horror, and an object of cursing, without inhabitant, as it is this day.
contents: So the LORD could no longer endure the evil deeds and detestable acts you committed, and your land became a desolation, a horror, and an object of cursing, without inhabitant, as it is this day.

contents.verseText: Because you burned incense and sinned against the LORD, and did not obey the voice of the LORD or walk in His instruction, His statutes, and His testimonies, this disaster has befallen you, as you see today.”
contents: Because you burned incense and sinned against the LORD, and did not obey the voice of the LORD or walk in His instruction, His statutes, and His testimonies, this disaster has befallen you, as you see today.”

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, including all the women, “Hear the word of the LORD, all those of Judah who are in the land of Egypt.
contents: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, including all the women, “Hear the word of the LORD, all those of Judah who are in the land of Egypt.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: As for you and your wives, you have spoken with your mouths and fulfilled with your hands your words: ‘We will surely perform our vows that we have made to burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and to pour out drink offerings to her.’ Go ahead, then, do what you have promised! Keep your vows!
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: As for you and your wives, you have spoken with your mouths and fulfilled with your hands your words: ‘We will surely perform our vows that we have made to burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and to pour out drink offerings to her.’ Go ahead, then, do what you have promised! Keep your vows!

contents.verseText: Nevertheless, hear the word of the LORD, all you people of Judah living in Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by My great name, says the LORD, that never again will any man of Judah living in the land of Egypt invoke My name or say, ‘As surely as the Lord GOD lives.’
contents: Nevertheless, hear the word of the LORD, all you people of Judah living in Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by My great name, says the LORD, that never again will any man of Judah living in the land of Egypt invoke My name or say, ‘As surely as the Lord GOD lives.’

contents.verseText: I am watching over them for harm and not for good, and every man of Judah who is in the land of Egypt will meet his end by sword or famine, until they are finished off.
contents: I am watching over them for harm and not for good, and every man of Judah who is in the land of Egypt will meet his end by sword or famine, until they are finished off.

contents.verseText: Those who escape the sword will return from Egypt to Judah, few in number, and the whole remnant of Judah who went to dwell in the land of Egypt will know whose word will stand, Mine or theirs!
contents: Those who escape the sword will return from Egypt to Judah, few in number, and the whole remnant of Judah who went to dwell in the land of Egypt will know whose word will stand, Mine or theirs!

contents.verseText: This will be a sign to you that I will punish you in this place, declares the LORD, so that you may know that My threats of harm against you will surely stand.
contents: This will be a sign to you that I will punish you in this place, declares the LORD, so that you may know that My threats of harm against you will surely stand.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: Behold, I will deliver Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hands of his enemies who seek his life, just as I delivered Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the enemy who was seeking his life.”
contents: This is what the LORD says: Behold, I will deliver Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hands of his enemies who seek his life, just as I delivered Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the enemy who was seeking his life.”

contents.verseText: This is the word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch son of Neriah when he wrote these words on a scroll at the dictation of Jeremiah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah:
contents: This is the word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch son of Neriah when he wrote these words on a scroll at the dictation of Jeremiah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah:

contents.verseText: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says to you, Baruch:
contents: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says to you, Baruch:

contents.verseText: You have said, ‘Woe is me because the LORD has added sorrow to my pain! I am worn out with groaning and have found no rest.’”
contents: You have said, ‘Woe is me because the LORD has added sorrow to my pain! I am worn out with groaning and have found no rest.’”

contents.verseText: Thus Jeremiah was to say to Baruch: “This is what the LORD says: Throughout the land I will demolish what I have built and uproot what I have planted.
contents: Thus Jeremiah was to say to Baruch:

footnote.ft: Literally Thus you shall say to him:

contents: “This is what the LORD says: Throughout the land I will demolish what I have built and uproot what I have planted.

contents.verseText: But as for you, do you seek great things for yourself? Stop seeking! For I will bring disaster on every living creature, declares the LORD, but wherever you go, I will grant your life as a spoil of war.”
contents: But as for you, do you seek great things for yourself? Stop seeking! For I will bring disaster on every living creature, declares the LORD, but wherever you go, I will grant your life as a spoil of war.”

contents.verseText: This is the word of the LORD about the nations—the word that came to Jeremiah the prophet
contents: This is the word of the LORD about the nations—the word that came to Jeremiah the prophet

contents.verseText: concerning Egypt and the army of Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt, which was defeated at Carchemish on the Euphrates River by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah:
contents: concerning Egypt and the army of Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt, which was defeated at Carchemish on the Euphrates River by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah:

contents.verseText: “Deploy your shields, small and large; advance for battle!
contents: “Deploy your shields, small and large;
advance for battle!

contents.verseText: Harness the horses; mount the steeds; take your positions with helmets on! Polish your spears; put on armor!
contents: Harness the horses; mount the steeds;
take your positions with helmets on!
Polish your spears;
put on armor!

contents.verseText: Why am I seeing this? They are terrified, they are retreating; their warriors are defeated, they flee in haste without looking back; terror is on every side!” declares the LORD.
contents: Why am I seeing this?
They are terrified,
they are retreating;
their warriors are defeated,
they flee in haste without looking back;
terror is on every side!”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “The swift cannot flee, and the warrior cannot escape! In the north by the River Euphrates they stumble and fall.
contents: “The swift cannot flee,
and the warrior cannot escape!
In the north by the River Euphrates
they stumble and fall.

contents.verseText: Who is this, rising like the Nile, like rivers whose waters churn?
contents: Who is this, rising like the Nile,
like rivers whose waters churn?

contents.verseText: Egypt rises like the Nile, and its waters churn like rivers, boasting, ‘I will rise and cover the earth; I will destroy the cities and their people.’
contents: Egypt rises like the Nile,
and its waters churn like rivers,
boasting, ‘I will rise and cover the earth;
I will destroy the cities and their people.’

contents.verseText: Advance, O horses! Race furiously, O chariots! Let the warriors come forth—Cush and Put carrying their shields, men of Lydia drawing the bow.
contents: Advance, O horses! Race furiously, O chariots!
Let the warriors come forth—
Cush

footnote.ft: That is, the upper Nile region

contents: and Put carrying their shields,
men of Lydia drawing the bow.

contents.verseText: For that day belongs to the Lord GOD of Hosts, a day of vengeance against His foes. The sword will devour until it is satisfied, until it is quenched with their blood. For the Lord GOD of Hosts will hold a sacrifice in the land of the north by the River Euphrates.
contents: For that day belongs to the Lord GOD of Hosts,
a day of vengeance against His foes.
The sword will devour until it is satisfied,
until it is quenched with their blood.
For the Lord GOD of Hosts will hold a sacrifice
in the land of the north by the River Euphrates.

contents.verseText: Go up to Gilead for balm, O Virgin Daughter of Egypt! In vain you try many remedies, but for you there is no healing.
contents: Go up to Gilead for balm,
O Virgin Daughter of Egypt!
In vain you try many remedies,
but for you there is no healing.

contents.verseText: The nations have heard of your shame, and your outcry fills the earth, because warrior stumbles over warrior and both of them have fallen together.”
contents: The nations have heard of your shame,
and your outcry fills the earth,
because warrior stumbles over warrior
and both of them have fallen together.”

contents.verseText: This is the word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to strike the land of Egypt:
contents: This is the word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to strike the land of Egypt:

contents.verseText: “Announce it in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol; proclaim it in Memphis and Tahpanhes: ‘Take your positions and prepare yourself, for the sword devours those around you.’
contents: “Announce it in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol;
proclaim it in Memphis

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew Noph; also in verse 19

contents: and Tahpanhes:
‘Take your positions and prepare yourself,
for the sword devours those around you.’

contents.verseText: Why have your warriors been laid low? They cannot stand, for the LORD has thrust them down.
contents: Why have your warriors been laid low?
They cannot stand, for the LORD has thrust them down.

contents.verseText: They continue to stumble; indeed, they have fallen over one another. They say, ‘Get up! Let us return to our people and to the land of our birth, away from the sword of the oppressor.’
contents: They continue to stumble;
indeed, they have fallen over one another.
They say, ‘Get up! Let us return to our people
and to the land of our birth,
away from the sword of the oppressor.’

contents.verseText: There they will cry out: ‘Pharaoh king of Egypt was all noise; he has let the appointed time pass him by.’
contents: There they will cry out:
‘Pharaoh king of Egypt was all noise;
he has let the appointed time pass him by.’

contents.verseText: As surely as I live, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of Hosts, there will come one who is like Tabor among the mountains and like Carmel by the sea.
contents: As surely as I live, declares the King,
whose name is the LORD of Hosts,
there will come one who is like Tabor among the mountains
and like Carmel by the sea.

contents.verseText: Pack your bags for exile, O daughter dwelling in Egypt! For Memphis will be laid waste, destroyed and uninhabited.
contents: Pack your bags for exile,
O daughter dwelling in Egypt!
For Memphis will be laid waste,
destroyed and uninhabited.

contents.verseText: Egypt is a beautiful heifer, but a gadfly from the north is coming against her.
contents: Egypt is a beautiful heifer,
but a gadfly from the north is coming against her.

contents.verseText: Even the mercenaries among her are like fattened calves. They too will turn back; together they will flee, they will not stand their ground, for the day of calamity is coming upon them—the time of their punishment.
contents: Even the mercenaries among her
are like fattened calves.
They too will turn back;
together they will flee, they will not stand their ground,
for the day of calamity is coming upon them—
the time of their punishment.

contents.verseText: Egypt will hiss like a fleeing serpent, for the enemy will advance in force; with axes they will come against her like woodsmen cutting down trees.
contents: Egypt will hiss like a fleeing serpent,

footnote.ft: Hebrew nachash; translated in most cases as snake

contents: for the enemy will advance in force;
with axes they will come against her
like woodsmen cutting down trees.

contents.verseText: They will chop down her forest, declares the LORD, dense though it may be, for they are more numerous than locusts; they cannot be counted.
contents: They will chop down her forest, declares the LORD,
dense though it may be,
for they are more numerous than locusts;
they cannot be counted.

contents.verseText: The Daughter of Egypt will be put to shame; she will be delivered into the hands of the people of the north.”
contents: The Daughter of Egypt will be put to shame;
she will be delivered into the hands of the people of the north.”

contents.verseText: The LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I am about to punish Amon god of Thebes, along with Pharaoh, Egypt with her gods and kings, and those who trust in Pharaoh.
contents: The LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I am about to punish Amon god of Thebes,

footnote.ft: Hebrew Amon of No

contents: along with Pharaoh, Egypt with her gods and kings, and those who trust in Pharaoh.

contents.verseText: I will deliver them into the hands of those who seek their lives—of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. But after this, Egypt will be inhabited as in days of old, declares the LORD.
contents: I will deliver them into the hands of those who seek their lives—of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. But after this, Egypt will be inhabited as in days of old, declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: But you, O Jacob My servant, do not be afraid, and do not be dismayed, O Israel. For I will surely save you out of a distant place, your descendants from the land of their captivity! Jacob will return to quiet and ease, with no one to make him afraid.
contents: But you, O Jacob My servant, do not be afraid,
and do not be dismayed, O Israel.
For I will surely save you out of a distant place,
your descendants from the land of their captivity!
Jacob will return to quiet and ease,
with no one to make him afraid.

contents.verseText: And you, My servant Jacob, do not be afraid, declares the LORD, for I am with you. Though I will completely destroy all the nations to which I have banished you, I will not completely destroy you. Yet I will discipline you justly, and will by no means leave you unpunished.”
contents: And you, My servant Jacob, do not be afraid,
declares the LORD, for I am with you.
Though I will completely destroy all the nations to which I have banished you,
I will not completely destroy you.
Yet I will discipline you justly,
and will by no means leave you unpunished.”

contents.verseText: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet about the Philistines before Pharaoh struck down Gaza.
contents: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet about the Philistines before Pharaoh struck down Gaza.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “See how the waters are rising from the north and becoming an overflowing torrent. They will overflow the land and its fullness, the cities and their inhabitants. The people will cry out, and all who dwell in the land will wail
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“See how the waters are rising from the north
and becoming an overflowing torrent.
They will overflow the land and its fullness,
the cities and their inhabitants.
The people will cry out,
and all who dwell in the land will wail

contents.verseText: at the sound of the galloping hooves of stallions, the rumbling of chariots, and the clatter of their wheels. The fathers will not turn back for their sons; their hands will hang limp.
contents: at the sound of the galloping hooves of stallions,
the rumbling of chariots,
and the clatter of their wheels.
The fathers will not turn back for their sons;
their hands will hang limp.

contents.verseText: For the day has come to destroy all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Sidon every remaining ally. Indeed, the LORD is about to destroy the Philistines, the remnant from the coasts of Caphtor.
contents: For the day has come
to destroy all the Philistines,
to cut off from Tyre and Sidon
every remaining ally.
Indeed, the LORD is about to destroy the Philistines,
the remnant from the coasts of Caphtor.

footnote.ft: That is, Crete

contents.verseText: The people of Gaza will shave their heads in mourning; Ashkelon will be silenced. O remnant of their valley, how long will you gash yourself?
contents: The people of Gaza will shave their heads in mourning;
Ashkelon will be silenced.
O remnant of their valley,

footnote.ft: That is, the Mediterranean coast or plain

contents: how long will you gash yourself?

contents.verseText: ‘Alas, O sword of the LORD, how long until you rest? Return to your sheath; cease and be still!’
contents: ‘Alas, O sword of the LORD,
how long until you rest?
Return to your sheath;
cease and be still!’

contents.verseText: How can it rest when the LORD has commanded it? He has appointed it against Ashkelon and the shore of its coastland.”
contents: How can it rest
when the LORD has commanded it?
He has appointed it against Ashkelon
and the shore of its coastland.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Moab, this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Woe to Nebo, for it will be devastated. Kiriathaim will be captured and disgraced; the fortress will be shattered and dismantled.
contents: Concerning Moab, this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says:
“Woe to Nebo,
for it will be devastated.
Kiriathaim will be captured and disgraced;
the fortress will be shattered and dismantled.

contents.verseText: There is no longer praise for Moab; in Heshbon they devise evil against her: ‘Come, let us cut her off from nationhood.’ You too, O people of Madmen, will be silenced; the sword will pursue you.
contents: There is no longer praise for Moab;
in Heshbon

footnote.ft: The Hebrew for Heshbon sounds like the Hebrew for plot.

contents: they devise evil against her:
‘Come, let us cut her off from nationhood.’
You too, O people of Madmen,

footnote.ft: The name of the Moabite town Madmen sounds like the Hebrew for silenced.

contents: will be silenced;
the sword will pursue you.

contents.verseText: A voice cries out from Horonaim: ‘Devastation and great destruction!’
contents: A voice cries out from Horonaim:
‘Devastation and great destruction!’

contents.verseText: Moab will be shattered; her little ones will cry out.
contents: Moab will be shattered;
her little ones will cry out.

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX her cries are heard as far away as Zoar

contents.verseText: For on the ascent to Luhith they weep bitterly as they go, and on the descent to Horonaim cries of distress resound over the destruction:
contents: For on the ascent to Luhith
they weep bitterly as they go,
and on the descent to Horonaim
cries of distress resound
over the destruction:

contents.verseText: ‘Flee! Run for your lives! Become like a juniper in the desert. ’
contents: ‘Flee! Run for your lives!
Become like a juniper in the desert.

footnote.ft: Or like a wild donkey or like Aroer

contents.verseText: Because you trust in your works and treasures, you too will be captured, and Chemosh will go into exile with his priests and officials.
contents: Because you trust in your works and treasures,
you too will be captured,
and Chemosh will go into exile
with his priests and officials.

contents.verseText: The destroyer will move against every city, and not one town will escape. The valley will also be ruined, and the high plain will be destroyed, as the LORD has said.
contents: The destroyer will move against every city,
