and not one town will escape.
The valley will also be ruined,
and the high plain will be destroyed,
as the LORD has said.

contents.verseText: Put salt on Moab, for she will be laid waste; her cities will become desolate, with no one to dwell in them.
contents: Put salt on Moab,
for she will be laid waste;

footnote.ft: Or Give wings to Moab, for she would fly away

contents: her cities will become desolate,
with no one to dwell in them.

contents.verseText: Cursed is the one who is remiss in doing the work of the LORD, and cursed is he who withholds his sword from bloodshed.
contents: Cursed is the one who is remiss
in doing the work of the LORD,
and cursed is he who withholds
his sword from bloodshed.

contents.verseText: Moab has been at ease from youth, settled like wine on its dregs; he has not been poured from vessel to vessel or gone into exile. So his flavor has remained the same, and his aroma is unchanged.
contents: Moab has been at ease from youth,
settled like wine on its dregs;
he has not been poured from vessel to vessel
or gone into exile.
So his flavor has remained the same,
and his aroma is unchanged.

contents.verseText: Therefore behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will send to him wanderers, who will pour him out. They will empty his vessels and shatter his jars.
contents: Therefore behold, the days are coming,
declares the LORD,
when I will send to him wanderers,
who will pour him out.
They will empty his vessels
and shatter his jars.

contents.verseText: Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, just as the house of Israel was ashamed when they trusted in Bethel.
contents: Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh,
just as the house of Israel was ashamed
when they trusted in Bethel.

contents.verseText: How can you say, ‘We are warriors, mighty men ready for battle’?
contents: How can you say, ‘We are warriors,
mighty men ready for battle’?

contents.verseText: Moab has been destroyed and its towns have been invaded; the best of its young men have gone down in the slaughter, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of Hosts.
contents: Moab has been destroyed
and its towns have been invaded;
the best of its young men
have gone down in the slaughter,
declares the King,
whose name is the LORD of Hosts.

contents.verseText: Moab’s calamity is at hand, and his affliction is rushing swiftly.
contents: Moab’s calamity is at hand,
and his affliction is rushing swiftly.

contents.verseText: Mourn for him, all you who surround him, everyone who knows his name; tell how the mighty scepter is shattered—the glorious staff!
contents: Mourn for him, all you who surround him,
everyone who knows his name;
tell how the mighty scepter is shattered—
the glorious staff!

contents.verseText: Come down from your glory; sit on parched ground, O daughter dwelling in Dibon, for the destroyer of Moab has come against you; he has destroyed your fortresses.
contents: Come down from your glory; sit on parched ground,
O daughter dwelling in Dibon,
for the destroyer of Moab has come against you;
he has destroyed your fortresses.

contents.verseText: Stand by the road and watch, O dweller of Aroer! Ask the man fleeing or the woman escaping, ‘What has happened?’
contents: Stand by the road and watch,
O dweller of Aroer!
Ask the man fleeing or the woman escaping,
‘What has happened?’

contents.verseText: Moab is put to shame, for it has been shattered. Wail and cry out! Declare by the Arnon that Moab is destroyed.
contents: Moab is put to shame, for it has been shattered.
Wail and cry out!
Declare by the Arnon
that Moab is destroyed.

contents.verseText: Judgment has come upon the high plain—upon Holon, Jahzah, and Mephaath,
contents: Judgment has come upon the high plain—
upon Holon, Jahzah,

footnote.ft: Jahzah is a variant of Jahaz; see verse 34.

contents: and Mephaath,

contents.verseText: upon Dibon, Nebo, and Beth-diblathaim,
contents: upon Dibon, Nebo, and Beth-diblathaim,

contents.verseText: upon Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul, and Beth-meon,
contents: upon Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul, and Beth-meon,

contents.verseText: upon Kerioth, Bozrah, and all the towns of Moab, those far and near.
contents: upon Kerioth, Bozrah, and all the towns of Moab,
those far and near.

contents.verseText: The horn of Moab has been cut off, and his arm is broken,” declares the LORD.
contents: The horn of Moab has been cut off,
and his arm is broken,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Make him drunk, because he has magnified himself against the LORD; so Moab will wallow in his own vomit, and he will also become a laughingstock.
contents: “Make him drunk,
because he has magnified himself against the LORD;
so Moab will wallow in his own vomit,
and he will also become a laughingstock.

contents.verseText: Was not Israel your object of ridicule? Was he ever found among thieves? For whenever you speak of him you shake your head.
contents: Was not Israel your object of ridicule?
Was he ever found among thieves?
For whenever you speak of him
you shake your head.

contents.verseText: Abandon the towns and settle among the rocks, O dwellers of Moab! Be like a dove that nests at the mouth of a cave.
contents: Abandon the towns and settle among the rocks,
O dwellers of Moab!
Be like a dove
that nests at the mouth of a cave.

contents.verseText: We have heard of Moab’s pomposity, his exceeding pride and conceit, his proud arrogance and haughtiness of heart.
contents: We have heard of Moab’s pomposity,
his exceeding pride and conceit,
his proud arrogance and haughtiness of heart.

contents.verseText: I know his insolence,” declares the LORD, “but it is futile. His boasting is as empty as his deeds.
contents: I know his insolence,”
declares the LORD,
“but it is futile.
His boasting is as empty as his deeds.

contents.verseText: Therefore I will wail for Moab; I will cry out for all of Moab; I will moan for the men of Kir-heres.
contents: Therefore I will wail for Moab;
I will cry out for all of Moab;
I will moan for the men of Kir-heres.

footnote.ft: Kir-heres is a variant of Kir-hareseth; also in verse 36; see Isaiah 16:7.

contents.verseText: I will weep for you, O vine of Sibmah, more than I weep for Jazer. Your tendrils have extended to the sea; they reach even to Jazer. The destroyer has descended on your summer fruit and grape harvest.
contents: I will weep for you, O vine of Sibmah,
more than I weep for Jazer.
Your tendrils have extended to the sea;

footnote.ft: Probably the Dead Sea

contents: they reach even to Jazer.

footnote.ft: Two Hebrew manuscripts and LXX; most Hebrew manuscripts to the Sea of Jazer

contents: The destroyer has descended
on your summer fruit and grape harvest.

contents.verseText: Joy and gladness are removed from the orchard and from the fields of Moab. I have stopped the flow of wine from the presses; no one treads them with shouts of joy; their shouts are not for joy.
contents: Joy and gladness are removed from the orchard
and from the fields of Moab.
I have stopped the flow of wine from the presses;
no one treads them with shouts of joy;
their shouts are not for joy.

contents.verseText: There is a cry from Heshbon to Elealeh; they raise their voices to Jahaz, from Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiyah; for even the waters of Nimrim have dried up.
contents: There is a cry from Heshbon to Elealeh;
they raise their voices to Jahaz,
from Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiyah;
for even the waters of Nimrim have dried up.

contents.verseText: In Moab, declares the LORD, I will bring an end to those who make offerings on the high places and burn incense to their gods.
contents: In Moab, declares the LORD,
I will bring an end
to those who make offerings on the high places
and burn incense to their gods.

contents.verseText: Therefore My heart laments like a flute for Moab; it laments like a flute for the men of Kir-heres, because the wealth they acquired has perished.
contents: Therefore My heart laments like a flute for Moab;
it laments like a flute for the men of Kir-heres,
because the wealth they acquired has perished.

contents.verseText: For every head is shaved and every beard is clipped; on every hand is a gash, and around every waist is sackcloth.
contents: For every head is shaved
and every beard is clipped;
on every hand is a gash,
and around every waist is sackcloth.

contents.verseText: On all the rooftops of Moab and in the public squares, everyone is mourning; for I have shattered Moab like an unwanted jar,” declares the LORD.
contents: On all the rooftops of Moab
and in the public squares,
everyone is mourning;
for I have shattered Moab like an unwanted jar,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “How shattered it is! How they wail! How Moab has turned his back in shame! Moab has become an object of ridicule and horror to all those around him.”
contents: “How shattered it is! How they wail!
How Moab has turned his back in shame!
Moab has become an object of ridicule and horror
to all those around him.”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: “Behold, an eagle swoops down and spreads his wings against Moab.
contents: For this is what the LORD says:
“Behold, an eagle swoops down
and spreads his wings against Moab.

contents.verseText: Kirioth has been taken, and the strongholds seized. In that day the heart of Moab’s warriors will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
contents: Kirioth has been taken,
and the strongholds seized.
In that day the heart of Moab’s warriors
will be like the heart of a woman in labor.

contents.verseText: Moab will be destroyed as a nation because he vaunted himself against the LORD.
contents: Moab will be destroyed as a nation
because he vaunted himself against the LORD.

contents.verseText: Terror and pit and snare await you, O dweller of Moab,” declares the LORD.
contents: Terror and pit and snare await you, O dweller of Moab,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Whoever flees the panic will fall into the pit, and whoever climbs from the pit will be caught in the snare. For I will bring upon Moab the year of their punishment,” declares the LORD.
contents: “Whoever flees the panic
will fall into the pit,
and whoever climbs from the pit
will be caught in the snare.
For I will bring upon Moab
the year of their punishment,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Those who flee will stand helpless in Heshbon’s shadow, because fire has gone forth from Heshbon and a flame from within Sihon. It devours the foreheads of Moab and the skulls of the sons of tumult.
contents: “Those who flee will stand helpless in Heshbon’s shadow,
because fire has gone forth from Heshbon
and a flame from within Sihon.
It devours the foreheads of Moab
and the skulls of the sons of tumult.

contents.verseText: Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh have perished; for your sons have been taken into exile and your daughters have gone into captivity.
contents: Woe to you, O Moab!
The people of Chemosh have perished;
for your sons have been taken into exile
and your daughters have gone into captivity.

contents.verseText: Yet in the latter days I will restore Moab from captivity,” declares the LORD. Here ends the judgment on Moab.
contents: Yet in the latter days I will restore Moab from captivity,

footnote.ft: Or restore the fortunes of Moab

contents: declares the LORD.
Here ends the judgment on Moab.

contents.verseText: Concerning the Ammonites, this is what the LORD says: “Has Israel no sons? Is he without heir? Why then has Milcom taken possession of Gad? Why have his people settled in their cities?
contents: Concerning the Ammonites, this is what the LORD says:
“Has Israel no sons?
Is he without heir?
Why then has Milcom

footnote.ft: Or their king; Milcom is a variant of Molech; also in verse 3; see Leviticus 18:21 and 1 Kings 11:7.

contents: taken possession of Gad?
Why have his people settled in their cities?

contents.verseText: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will sound the battle cry against Rabbah of the Ammonites. It will become a heap of ruins, and its villages will be burned. Then Israel will drive out their dispossessors, says the LORD.
contents: Therefore, behold, the days are coming,
declares the LORD,
when I will sound the battle cry
against Rabbah of the Ammonites.
It will become a heap of ruins,
and its villages will be burned.
Then Israel will drive out their dispossessors,
says the LORD.

contents.verseText: Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai has been destroyed; cry out, O daughters of Rabbah! Put on sackcloth and mourn; run back and forth within your walls, for Milcom will go into exile together with his priests and officials.
contents: Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai has been destroyed;
cry out, O daughters of Rabbah!
Put on sackcloth and mourn;
run back and forth within your walls,
for Milcom will go into exile
together with his priests and officials.

contents.verseText: Why do you boast of your valleys—your valleys so fruitful, O faithless daughter? You trust in your riches and say, ‘Who can come against me?’
contents: Why do you boast of your valleys—
your valleys so fruitful,

footnote.ft: Or your valleys flowing

contents: O faithless daughter?
You trust in your riches and say,
‘Who can come against me?’

contents.verseText: Behold, I am about to bring terror upon you, declares the Lord GOD of Hosts, from all those around you. You will each be driven headlong, with no one to regather the fugitives.
contents: Behold, I am about to bring terror upon you,
declares the Lord GOD of Hosts,
from all those around you.
You will each be driven headlong,
with no one to regather the fugitives.

contents.verseText: Yet afterward I will restore the Ammonites from captivity,” declares the LORD.
contents: Yet afterward I will restore the Ammonites from captivity,

footnote.ft: Or restore the fortunes of the Ammonites

contents: declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: Concerning Edom, this is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Is there no longer wisdom in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom decayed?
contents: Concerning Edom, this is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Is there no longer wisdom in Teman?
Has counsel perished from the prudent?
Has their wisdom decayed?

contents.verseText: Turn and run! Lie low, O dwellers of Dedan, for I will bring disaster on Esau at the time I punish him.
contents: Turn and run!
Lie low, O dwellers of Dedan,
for I will bring disaster on Esau
at the time I punish him.

contents.verseText: If grape gatherers came to you, would they not leave some gleanings? Were thieves to come in the night, would they not steal only what they wanted?
contents: If grape gatherers came to you,
would they not leave some gleanings?
Were thieves to come in the night,
would they not steal only what they wanted?

contents.verseText: But I will strip Esau bare; I will uncover his hiding places, and he will be unable to conceal himself. His descendants will be destroyed along with his relatives and neighbors, and he will be no more.
contents: But I will strip Esau bare;
I will uncover his hiding places,
and he will be unable to conceal himself.
His descendants will be destroyed
along with his relatives and neighbors,
and he will be no more.

contents.verseText: Abandon your orphans; I will preserve their lives. Let your widows trust in Me.”
contents: Abandon your orphans; I will preserve their lives.
Let your widows trust in Me.”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD says: “If those who do not deserve to drink the cup must drink it, can you possibly remain unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for you must drink it too.
contents: For this is what the LORD says: “If those who do not deserve to drink the cup must drink it, can you possibly remain unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for you must drink it too.

contents.verseText: For by Myself I have sworn, declares the LORD, that Bozrah will become a desolation, a disgrace, a ruin, and a curse, and all her cities will be in ruins forever.”
contents: For by Myself I have sworn, declares the LORD, that Bozrah will become a desolation, a disgrace, a ruin, and a curse, and all her cities will be in ruins forever.”

contents.verseText: I have heard a message from the LORD; an envoy has been sent to the nations: “Assemble yourselves to march against her! Rise up for battle!”
contents: I have heard a message from the LORD;
an envoy has been sent to the nations:
“Assemble yourselves to march against her!
Rise up for battle!”

contents.verseText: “For behold, I will make you small among nations, despised among men.
contents: “For behold, I will make you small among nations,
despised among men.

contents.verseText: The terror you cause and the pride of your heart have deceived you, O dwellers in the clefts of the rocks, O occupiers of the mountain summit. Though you elevate your nest like the eagle, even from there I will bring you down,” declares the LORD.
contents: The terror you cause
and the pride of your heart
have deceived you,
O dwellers in the clefts of the rocks,

footnote.ft: Or of Sela

contents: O occupiers of the mountain summit.
Though you elevate your nest like the eagle,
even from there I will bring you down,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Edom will become an object of horror. All who pass by will be appalled and will scoff at all her wounds.
contents: “Edom will become an object of horror.
All who pass by will be appalled
and will scoff at all her wounds.

contents.verseText: As Sodom and Gomorrah were overthrown along with their neighbors,” says the LORD, “no one will dwell there; no man will abide there.
contents: As Sodom and Gomorrah were overthrown
along with their neighbors,”
says the LORD,
“no one will dwell there;
no man will abide there.

contents.verseText: Behold, one will come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan to the watered pasture. For in an instant I will chase Edom from her land. Who is the chosen one I will appoint for this? For who is like Me, and who can challenge Me? What shepherd can stand against Me?”
contents: Behold, one will come up like a lion
from the thickets of the Jordan to the watered pasture.
For in an instant I will chase Edom from her land.
Who is the chosen one I will appoint for this?
For who is like Me, and who can challenge Me?
What shepherd can stand against Me?”

contents.verseText: Therefore hear the plans that the LORD has drawn up against Edom and the strategies He has devised against the people of Teman: Surely the little ones of the flock will be dragged away; certainly their pasture will be made desolate because of them.
contents: Therefore hear the plans
that the LORD has drawn up against Edom
and the strategies He has devised
against the people of Teman:
Surely the little ones of the flock will be dragged away;
certainly their pasture will be made desolate because of them.

footnote.ft: Or their pasture will be appalled at their fate

contents.verseText: At the sound of their fall the earth will quake; their cry will resound to the Red Sea.
contents: At the sound of their fall the earth will quake;
their cry will resound to the Red Sea.

footnote.ft: Or the Sea of Reeds

contents.verseText: Look! An eagle will soar and swoop down, spreading its wings over Bozrah. In that day the hearts of Edom’s mighty men will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
contents: Look! An eagle will soar and swoop down,
spreading its wings over Bozrah.
In that day the hearts of Edom’s mighty men
will be like the heart of a woman in labor.

contents.verseText: Concerning Damascus: “Hamath and Arpad are put to shame, for they have heard a bad report; they are agitated like the sea; their anxiety cannot be calmed.
contents: Concerning Damascus:
“Hamath and Arpad are put to shame,
for they have heard a bad report;
they are agitated like the sea;

footnote.ft: Hebrew on the sea or by the sea

contents: their anxiety cannot be calmed.

contents.verseText: Damascus has become feeble; she has turned to flee. Panic has gripped her; anguish and pain have seized her like a woman in labor.
contents: Damascus has become feeble;
she has turned to flee.
Panic has gripped her;
anguish and pain have seized her
like a woman in labor.

contents.verseText: How is the city of praise not forsaken, the town that brings Me joy?
contents: How is the city of praise not forsaken,
the town that brings Me joy?

contents.verseText: For her young men will fall in the streets, and all her warriors will be silenced in that day,” declares the LORD of Hosts.
contents: For her young men will fall in the streets,
and all her warriors will be silenced in that day,”
declares the LORD of Hosts.

contents.verseText: “I will set fire to the walls of Damascus; it will consume the fortresses of Ben-hadad.”
contents: “I will set fire to the walls of Damascus;
it will consume the fortresses of Ben-hadad.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated, this is what the LORD says: “Rise up, advance against Kedar, and destroy the people of the east!
contents: Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated, this is what the LORD says:
“Rise up, advance against Kedar,
and destroy the people of the east!

contents.verseText: They will take their tents and flocks, their tent curtains and all their goods. They will take their camels for themselves. They will shout to them: ‘Terror is on every side!’
contents: They will take their tents and flocks,
their tent curtains and all their goods.
They will take their camels for themselves.
They will shout to them: ‘Terror is on every side!’

contents.verseText: Run! Escape quickly! Lie low, O residents of Hazor,” declares the LORD, “for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has drawn up a plan against you; he has devised a strategy against you.
contents: Run! Escape quickly!
Lie low, O residents of Hazor,”
declares the LORD,
“for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon
has drawn up a plan against you;
he has devised a strategy against you.

contents.verseText: Rise up, advance against a nation at ease, one that dwells securely,” declares the LORD. “They have no gates or bars; they live alone.
contents: Rise up, advance against a nation at ease,
one that dwells securely,”
declares the LORD.
“They have no gates or bars;
they live alone.

contents.verseText: Their camels will become plunder, and their large herds will be spoil. I will scatter to the wind in every direction those who shave their temples; I will bring calamity on them from all sides,” declares the LORD.
contents: Their camels will become plunder,
and their large herds will be spoil.
I will scatter to the wind in every direction
those who shave their temples;
I will bring calamity on them
from all sides,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Hazor will become a haunt for jackals, a desolation forever. No one will dwell there; no man will abide there.”
contents: “Hazor will become a haunt for jackals,

footnote.ft: Or serpents or dragons

contents: a desolation forever.
No one will dwell there;
no man will abide there.”

contents.verseText: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah.
contents: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Behold, I will shatter Elam’s bow, the mainstay of their might.
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Behold, I will shatter Elam’s bow,
the mainstay of their might.

contents.verseText: I will bring the four winds against Elam from the four corners of the heavens, and I will scatter them to all these winds. There will not be a nation to which Elam’s exiles will not go.
contents: I will bring the four winds against Elam
from the four corners of the heavens,
and I will scatter them
to all these winds.
There will not be a nation
to which Elam’s exiles will not go.

contents.verseText: So I will shatter Elam before their foes, before those who seek their lives. I will bring disaster upon them, even My fierce anger,” declares the LORD. “I will send out the sword after them until I finish them off.
contents: So I will shatter Elam before their foes,
before those who seek their lives.
I will bring disaster upon them,
even My fierce anger,”
declares the LORD.
“I will send out the sword after them
until I finish them off.

contents.verseText: I will set My throne in Elam, and destroy its king and officials,” declares the LORD.
contents: I will set My throne in Elam,
and destroy its king and officials,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Yet in the last days, I will restore Elam from captivity,” declares the LORD.
contents: “Yet in the last days,
I will restore Elam from captivity,

footnote.ft: Or restore the fortunes of Elam

contents: declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: This is the word that the LORD spoke through Jeremiah the prophet concerning Babylon and the land of the Chaldeans:
contents: This is the word that the LORD spoke through Jeremiah the prophet concerning Babylon and the land of the Chaldeans:

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verses 8, 25, 35, and 45

contents.verseText: “Announce and declare to the nations; lift up a banner and proclaim it; hold nothing back when you say, ‘Babylon is captured; Bel is put to shame; Marduk is shattered, her images are disgraced, her idols are broken in pieces.’
contents: “Announce and declare to the nations;
lift up a banner and proclaim it;
hold nothing back when you say,
‘Babylon is captured;
Bel is put to shame;
Marduk is shattered,
her images are disgraced,
her idols are broken in pieces.’

contents.verseText: For a nation from the north will come against her; it will make her land a desolation. No one will live in it; both man and beast will flee.”
contents: For a nation from the north will come against her;
it will make her land a desolation.
No one will live in it;
both man and beast will flee.”

contents.verseText: “In those days and at that time, declares the LORD, the children of Israel and the children of Judah will come together, weeping as they come, and will seek the LORD their God.
contents: “In those days and at that time,
declares the LORD,
the children of Israel and the children of Judah
will come together, weeping as they come,
and will seek the LORD their God.

contents.verseText: They will ask the way to Zion and turn their faces toward it. They will come and join themselves to the LORD in an everlasting covenant that will never be forgotten.
contents: They will ask the way to Zion
and turn their faces toward it.
They will come and join themselves to the LORD
in an everlasting covenant
that will never be forgotten.

contents.verseText: My people are lost sheep; their shepherds have led them astray, causing them to roam the mountains. They have wandered from mountain to hill; they have forgotten their resting place.
contents: My people are lost sheep;
their shepherds have led them astray,
causing them to roam the mountains.
They have wandered from mountain to hill;
they have forgotten their resting place.

contents.verseText: All who found them devoured them, and their enemies said, ‘We are not guilty, for they have sinned against the LORD, their true pasture, the LORD, the hope of their fathers.’
contents: All who found them devoured them,
and their enemies said,
‘We are not guilty,
for they have sinned against the LORD, their true pasture,
the LORD, the hope of their fathers.’

contents.verseText: Flee from the midst of Babylon; depart from the land of the Chaldeans; be like the he-goats that lead the flock.
contents: Flee from the midst of Babylon;
depart from the land of the Chaldeans;
be like the he-goats that lead the flock.

contents.verseText: For behold, I stir up and bring against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the land of the north. They will line up against her; from the north she will be captured. Their arrows will be like skilled warriors who do not return empty-handed.
contents: For behold, I stir up and bring against Babylon
an assembly of great nations from the land of the north.
They will line up against her;
from the north she will be captured.
Their arrows will be like skilled warriors
who do not return empty-handed.

contents.verseText: Chaldea will be plundered; all who plunder her will have their fill,” declares the LORD.
contents: Chaldea

footnote.ft: Or Babylonia

contents: will be plundered;
all who plunder her will have their fill,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Because you rejoice, because you sing in triumph—you who plunder My inheritance—because you frolic like a heifer treading grain and neigh like stallions,
contents: “Because you rejoice,
because you sing in triumph—
you who plunder My inheritance—
because you frolic like a heifer treading grain
and neigh like stallions,

contents.verseText: your mother will be greatly ashamed; she who bore you will be disgraced. Behold, she will be the least of the nations, a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
contents: your mother will be greatly ashamed;
she who bore you will be disgraced.
Behold, she will be the least of the nations,
a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.

contents.verseText: Because of the wrath of the LORD, she will not be inhabited; she will become completely desolate. All who pass through Babylon will be horrified and will hiss at all her wounds.
contents: Because of the wrath of the LORD,
she will not be inhabited;
she will become completely desolate.
All who pass through Babylon will be horrified
and will hiss at all her wounds.

contents.verseText: Line up in formation around Babylon, all you who draw the bow! Shoot at her! Spare no arrows! For she has sinned against the LORD.
contents: Line up in formation around Babylon,
all you who draw the bow!
Shoot at her! Spare no arrows!
For she has sinned against the LORD.

contents.verseText: Raise a war cry against her on every side! She has thrown up her hands in surrender; her towers have fallen; her walls are torn down. Since this is the vengeance of the LORD, take out your vengeance upon her; as she has done, do the same to her.
contents: Raise a war cry against her on every side!
She has thrown up her hands in surrender;
her towers have fallen;
her walls are torn down.
Since this is the vengeance of the LORD,
take out your vengeance upon her;
as she has done,
do the same to her.

contents.verseText: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and the one who wields the sickle at harvest time. In the face of the oppressor’s sword, each will turn to his own people, each will flee to his own land.
contents: Cut off the sower from Babylon,
and the one who wields the sickle at harvest time.
In the face of the oppressor’s sword,
each will turn to his own people,
each will flee to his own land.

contents.verseText: Israel is a scattered flock, chased away by lions. The first to devour him was the king of Assyria; the last to crush his bones was Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.”
contents: Israel is a scattered flock,
chased away by lions.
The first to devour him
was the king of Assyria;
the last to crush his bones
was Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.”

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “I will punish the king of Babylon and his land as I punished the king of Assyria.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says:
“I will punish the king of Babylon and his land
as I punished the king of Assyria.

contents.verseText: I will return Israel to his pasture, and he will graze on Carmel and Bashan; his soul will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and Gilead.
contents: I will return Israel to his pasture,
and he will graze on Carmel and Bashan;
his soul will be satisfied
on the hills of Ephraim and Gilead.

contents.verseText: In those days and at that time, declares the LORD, a search will be made for Israel’s guilt, but there will be none, and for Judah’s sins, but they will not be found; for I will forgive the remnant I preserve.
contents: In those days and at that time,
declares the LORD,
a search will be made for Israel’s guilt,
but there will be none,
and for Judah’s sins,
but they will not be found;
for I will forgive
the remnant I preserve.

contents.verseText: Go up against the land of Merathaim, and against the residents of Pekod. Kill them and devote them to destruction. Do all that I have commanded you,” declares the LORD.
contents: Go up against the land of Merathaim,
and against the residents of Pekod.
Kill them

footnote.ft: LXX Avenge, O sword,

contents: and devote them to destruction.

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons to the LORD, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering; also in verse 26.

contents: Do all that I have commanded you,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “The noise of battle is in the land—the noise of great destruction.
contents: “The noise of battle is in the land—
the noise of great destruction.

contents.verseText: How the hammer of the whole earth lies broken and shattered! What a horror Babylon has become among the nations!
contents: How the hammer of the whole earth
lies broken and shattered!
What a horror Babylon has become
among the nations!

contents.verseText: I laid a snare for you, O Babylon, and you were caught before you knew it. You were found and captured because you challenged the LORD.
contents: I laid a snare for you, O Babylon,
and you were caught before you knew it.
You were found and captured
because you challenged the LORD.

contents.verseText: The LORD has opened His armory and brought out His weapons of wrath, for this is the work of the Lord GOD of Hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.
contents: The LORD has opened His armory
and brought out His weapons of wrath,
for this is the work of the Lord GOD of Hosts
in the land of the Chaldeans.

contents.verseText: Come against her from the farthest border. Break open her granaries; pile her up like mounds of grain. Devote her to destruction; leave her no survivors.
contents: Come against her
from the farthest border.
Break open her granaries;
pile her up like mounds of grain.
Devote her to destruction;
leave her no survivors.

contents.verseText: Kill all her young bulls; let them go down to the slaughter. Woe to them, for their day has come—the time of their punishment.
contents: Kill all her young bulls;
let them go down to the slaughter.
Woe to them, for their day has come—
the time of their punishment.

contents.verseText: Listen to the fugitives and refugees from the land of Babylon, declaring in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God, the vengeance for His temple.
contents: Listen to the fugitives and refugees
from the land of Babylon,
declaring in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God,
the vengeance for His temple.

contents.verseText: Summon the archers against Babylon, all who string the bow. Encamp all around her; let no one escape. Repay her according to her deeds; do to her as she has done. For she has defied the LORD, the Holy One of Israel.
contents: Summon the archers against Babylon,
all who string the bow.
Encamp all around her;
let no one escape.
Repay her according to her deeds;
do to her as she has done.
For she has defied the LORD,
the Holy One of Israel.

contents.verseText: Therefore, her young men will fall in the streets, and all her warriors will be silenced in that day,” declares the LORD.
contents: Therefore, her young men will fall in the streets,
and all her warriors will be silenced in that day,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Behold, I am against you, O arrogant one,” declares the Lord GOD of Hosts, “for your day has come, the time when I will punish you.
contents: “Behold, I am against you, O arrogant one,”
declares the Lord GOD of Hosts,
“for your day has come,
the time when I will punish you.

contents.verseText: The arrogant one will stumble and fall with no one to pick him up. And I will kindle a fire in his cities to consume all those around him.”
contents: The arrogant one will stumble and fall
with no one to pick him up.
And I will kindle a fire in his cities
to consume all those around him.”

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: “The sons of Israel are oppressed, and the sons of Judah as well. All their captors hold them fast, refusing to release them.
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“The sons of Israel are oppressed,
and the sons of Judah as well.
All their captors hold them fast,
refusing to release them.

contents.verseText: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of Hosts is His name. He will fervently plead their case so that He may bring rest to the earth, but turmoil to those who live in Babylon.
contents: Their Redeemer is strong;
the LORD of Hosts is His name.
He will fervently plead their case
so that He may bring rest to the earth,
but turmoil to those who live in Babylon.

contents.verseText: A sword is against the Chaldeans, declares the LORD, against those who live in Babylon, and against her officials and wise men.
contents: A sword is against the Chaldeans,
declares the LORD,
against those who live in Babylon,
and against her officials and wise men.

contents.verseText: A sword is against her false prophets, and they will become fools. A sword is against her warriors, and they will be filled with terror.
contents: A sword is against her false prophets,
and they will become fools.
A sword is against her warriors,
and they will be filled with terror.

contents.verseText: A sword is against her horses and chariots and against all the foreigners in her midst, and they will become like women. A sword is against her treasuries, and they will be plundered.
contents: A sword is against her horses and chariots
and against all the foreigners in her midst,
and they will become like women.
A sword is against her treasuries,
and they will be plundered.

contents.verseText: A drought is upon her waters, and they will be dried up. For it is a land of graven images, and the people go mad over idols.
contents: A drought is upon her waters,
and they will be dried up.
For it is a land of graven images,
and the people go mad over idols.

footnote.ft: Or go mad with fear

contents.verseText: So the desert creatures and hyenas will live there and ostriches will dwell there. It will never again be inhabited or lived in from generation to generation.
contents: So the desert creatures and hyenas will live there
and ostriches

footnote.ft: Literally daughters of an ostrich or daughters of an owl

contents: will dwell there.
It will never again be inhabited
or lived in from generation to generation.

contents.verseText: As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah along with their neighbors,” declares the LORD, “no one will dwell there; no man will abide there.
contents: As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah
along with their neighbors,”
declares the LORD,
“no one will dwell there;
no man will abide there.

contents.verseText: Behold, an army is coming from the north; a great nation and many kings are stirred up from the ends of the earth.
contents: Behold, an army is coming from the north;
a great nation and many kings are stirred up
from the ends of the earth.

contents.verseText: They grasp the bow and spear; they are cruel and merciless. Their voice roars like the sea, and they ride upon horses, lined up like men in formation against you, O Daughter of Babylon.
contents: They grasp the bow and spear;

footnote.ft: Or javelin

contents: they are cruel and merciless.
Their voice roars like the sea,
and they ride upon horses,
lined up like men in formation
against you, O Daughter of Babylon.

contents.verseText: The king of Babylon has heard the report, and his hands hang limp. Anguish has gripped him, pain like that of a woman in labor.
contents: The king of Babylon has heard the report,
and his hands hang limp.
Anguish has gripped him,
pain like that of a woman in labor.

contents.verseText: Behold, one will come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan to the watered pasture. For in an instant I will chase Babylon from her land. Who is the chosen one I will appoint for this? For who is like Me, and who can challenge Me? What shepherd can stand against Me?”
contents: Behold, one will come up like a lion
from the thickets of the Jordan to the watered pasture.
For in an instant I will chase Babylon from her land.
Who is the chosen one I will appoint for this?
For who is like Me, and who can challenge Me?
What shepherd can stand against Me?”

contents.verseText: Therefore hear the plans that the LORD has drawn up against Babylon and the strategies He has devised against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the little ones of the flock will be dragged away; certainly their pasture will be made desolate because of them.
contents: Therefore hear the plans
that the LORD has drawn up against Babylon
and the strategies He has devised
against the land of the Chaldeans:
Surely the little ones of the flock will be dragged away;
certainly their pasture will be made desolate because of them.

contents.verseText: At the sound of Babylon’s capture the earth will quake; a cry will be heard among the nations.
contents: At the sound of Babylon’s capture the earth will quake;
a cry will be heard among the nations.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD says: “Behold, I will stir up against Babylon and against the people of Leb-kamai the spirit of a destroyer.
contents: This is what the LORD says:
“Behold, I will stir up against Babylon
and against the people of Leb-kamai

footnote.ft: Leb-kamai is a code name for Chaldea, that is, Babylonia.

contents: the spirit of a destroyer.

contents.verseText: I will send strangers to Babylon to winnow her and empty her land; for they will come against her from every side in her day of disaster.
contents: I will send strangers to Babylon
to winnow her and empty her land;
for they will come against her from every side
in her day of disaster.

contents.verseText: Do not let the archer bend his bow or put on his armor. Do not spare her young men; devote all her army to destruction!
contents: Do not let the archer bend his bow
or put on his armor.
Do not spare her young men;
devote all her army to destruction!

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons to the LORD, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering.

contents.verseText: And they will fall slain in the land of the Chaldeans, and pierced through in her streets.
contents: And they will fall slain in the land of the Chaldeans,

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; also in verse 54

contents: and pierced through in her streets.

contents.verseText: For Israel and Judah have not been abandoned by their God, the LORD of Hosts, though their land is full of guilt before the Holy One of Israel.”
contents: For Israel and Judah have not been abandoned
by their God, the LORD of Hosts,
though their land is full of guilt
before the Holy One of Israel.”

contents.verseText: Flee from Babylon! Escape with your lives! Do not be destroyed in her punishment. For this is the time of the LORD’s vengeance; He will pay her what she deserves.
contents: Flee from Babylon! Escape with your lives!
Do not be destroyed in her punishment.
For this is the time of the LORD’s vengeance;
He will pay her what she deserves.

contents.verseText: Babylon was a gold cup in the hand of the LORD, making the whole earth drunk. The nations drank her wine; therefore the nations have gone mad.
contents: Babylon was a gold cup in the hand of the LORD,
making the whole earth drunk.
The nations drank her wine;
therefore the nations have gone mad.

contents.verseText: Suddenly Babylon has fallen and been shattered. Wail for her; get her balm for her pain; perhaps she can be healed.
contents: Suddenly Babylon has fallen and been shattered.
Wail for her; get her balm for her pain;
perhaps she can be healed.

contents.verseText: “We tried to heal Babylon, but she could not be healed. Abandon her! Let each of us go to his own land, for her judgment extends to the sky and reaches to the clouds.”
contents: “We tried to heal Babylon,
but she could not be healed.
Abandon her!
Let each of us go to his own land,
for her judgment extends to the sky
and reaches to the clouds.”

contents.verseText: “The LORD has brought forth our vindication; come, let us tell in Zion what the LORD our God has accomplished.”
contents: “The LORD has brought forth our vindication;
come, let us tell in Zion
what the LORD our God has accomplished.”

contents.verseText: Sharpen the arrows! Fill the quivers! The LORD has aroused the spirit of the kings of the Medes, because His plan is aimed at Babylon to destroy her, for it is the vengeance of the LORD—vengeance for His temple.
contents: Sharpen the arrows!
Fill the quivers!

footnote.ft: LXX and some translations of the Hebrew; literally Fill the hand with the shields! or Take up the shields!

contents: The LORD has aroused the spirit
of the kings of the Medes,
because His plan is aimed at Babylon
to destroy her,
for it is the vengeance of the LORD—
vengeance for His temple.

contents.verseText: Raise a banner against the walls of Babylon; post the guard; station the watchmen; prepare the ambush. For the LORD has both devised and accomplished what He spoke against the people of Babylon.
contents: Raise a banner against the walls of Babylon;
post the guard;
station the watchmen;
prepare the ambush.
For the LORD has both devised and accomplished
what He spoke against the people of Babylon.

contents.verseText: You who dwell by many waters, rich in treasures, your end has come; the thread of your life is cut.
contents: You who dwell by many waters,
rich in treasures,
your end has come;
the thread of your life is cut.

contents.verseText: The LORD of Hosts has sworn by Himself: “Surely I will fill you up with men as with locusts, and they will shout in triumph over you.”
contents: The LORD of Hosts has sworn by Himself:
“Surely I will fill you up with men as with locusts,
and they will shout in triumph over you.”

s1: Praise to the God of Jacob

contents.verseText: The LORD made the earth by His power; He established the world by His wisdom and stretched out the heavens by His understanding.
contents: The LORD made the earth by His power;
He established the world by His wisdom
and stretched out the heavens by His understanding.

contents.verseText: When He thunders, the waters in the heavens roar; He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth. He generates the lightning with the rain and brings forth the wind from His storehouses.
contents: When He thunders,
the waters in the heavens roar;
He causes the clouds to rise
from the ends of the earth.
He generates the lightning with the rain
and brings forth the wind from His storehouses.

contents.verseText: Every man is senseless and devoid of knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his idols. For his molten images are a fraud, and there is no breath in them.
contents: Every man is senseless and devoid of knowledge;
every goldsmith is put to shame by his idols.
For his molten images are a fraud,
and there is no breath in them.

contents.verseText: They are worthless, a work to be mocked. In the time of their punishment they will perish.
contents: They are worthless, a work to be mocked.
In the time of their punishment they will perish.

contents.verseText: The Portion of Jacob is not like these, for He is the Maker of all things, and of the tribe of His inheritance—the LORD of Hosts is His name.
contents: The Portion of Jacob is not like these,
for He is the Maker of all things,
and of the tribe of His inheritance—
the LORD of Hosts is His name.

contents.verseText: “You are My war club, My weapon for battle. With you I shatter nations; with you I bring kingdoms to ruin.
contents: “You are My war club,
My weapon for battle.
With you I shatter nations;
with you I bring kingdoms to ruin.

contents.verseText: With you I shatter the horse and rider; with you I shatter the chariot and driver.
contents: With you I shatter the horse and rider;
with you I shatter the chariot and driver.

contents.verseText: With you I shatter man and woman; with you I shatter the old man and the youth; with you I shatter the young man and the maiden.
contents: With you I shatter man and woman;
with you I shatter the old man and the youth;
with you I shatter the young man and the maiden.

contents.verseText: With you I shatter the shepherd and his flock; with you I shatter the farmer and his oxen; with you I shatter the governors and officials.
contents: With you I shatter the shepherd and his flock;
with you I shatter the farmer and his oxen;
with you I shatter the governors and officials.

contents.verseText: Before your very eyes I will repay Babylon and all the dwellers of Chaldea for all the evil they have done in Zion,” declares the LORD.
contents: Before your very eyes I will repay
Babylon and all the dwellers of Chaldea

footnote.ft: That is, Babylonia; also in verse 35

contents: for all the evil they have done in Zion,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Behold, I am against you, O destroying mountain, you who devastate the whole earth, declares the LORD. I will stretch out My hand against you; I will roll you over the cliffs and turn you into a charred mountain.
contents: “Behold, I am against you,
O destroying mountain,
you who devastate the whole earth,
declares the LORD.
I will stretch out My hand against you;
I will roll you over the cliffs
and turn you into a charred mountain.

contents.verseText: No one shall retrieve from you a cornerstone or a foundation stone, because you will become desolate forever,” declares the LORD.
contents: No one shall retrieve from you a cornerstone
or a foundation stone,
because you will become desolate forever,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Raise a banner in the land! Blow the ram’s horn among the nations! Prepare the nations against her. Summon the kingdoms against her—Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz. Appoint a captain against her; bring up horses like swarming locusts.
contents: “Raise a banner in the land!
Blow the ram’s horn among the nations!
Prepare the nations against her.
Summon the kingdoms against her—
Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz.
Appoint a captain against her;
bring up horses like swarming locusts.

contents.verseText: Prepare the nations for battle against her—the kings of the Medes, their governors and all their officials, and all the lands they rule.
contents: Prepare the nations for battle against her—
the kings of the Medes,
their governors and all their officials,
and all the lands they rule.

contents.verseText: The earth quakes and writhes because the LORD’s intentions against Babylon stand: to make the land of Babylon a desolation, without inhabitant.
contents: The earth quakes and writhes
because the LORD’s intentions against Babylon stand:
to make the land of Babylon a desolation,
without inhabitant.

contents.verseText: The warriors of Babylon have stopped fighting; they sit in their strongholds. Their strength is exhausted; they have become like women. Babylon’s homes have been set ablaze, the bars of her gates are broken.
contents: The warriors of Babylon have stopped fighting;
they sit in their strongholds.
Their strength is exhausted;
they have become like women.
Babylon’s homes have been set ablaze,
the bars of her gates are broken.

contents.verseText: One courier races to meet another, and messenger follows messenger, to announce to the king of Babylon that his city has been captured from end to end.
contents: One courier races to meet another,
and messenger follows messenger,
to announce to the king of Babylon
that his city has been captured from end to end.

contents.verseText: The fords have been seized, the marshes set on fire, and the soldiers are terrified.”
contents: The fords have been seized,
the marshes set on fire,
and the soldiers are terrified.”

contents.verseText: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: “The Daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor at the time it is trampled. In just a little while her harvest time will come.”
contents: For this is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says:
“The Daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor
at the time it is trampled.
In just a little while
her harvest time will come.”

contents.verseText: “Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devoured me; he has crushed me. He has set me aside like an empty vessel; he has swallowed me like a monster; he filled his belly with my delicacies and vomited me out.
contents: “Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devoured me;
he has crushed me.
He has set me aside like an empty vessel;
he has swallowed me like a monster;
he filled his belly with my delicacies
and vomited me out.

footnote.ft: Or expelled me

contents.verseText: May the violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon,” says the dweller of Zion. “May my blood be on the dwellers of Chaldea,” says Jerusalem.
contents: May the violence done to me
and to my flesh
be upon Babylon,”
says the dweller of Zion.
“May my blood be on the dwellers of Chaldea,”
says Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Therefore this is what the LORD says: “Behold, I will plead your case and take vengeance on your behalf; I will dry up her sea and make her springs run dry.
contents: Therefore this is what the LORD says:
“Behold, I will plead your case
and take vengeance on your behalf;
I will dry up her sea
and make her springs run dry.

contents.verseText: Babylon will become a heap of rubble, a haunt for jackals, an object of horror and scorn, without inhabitant.
contents: Babylon will become a heap of rubble,
a haunt for jackals,

footnote.ft: Or serpents or dragons

contents: an object of horror and scorn,
without inhabitant.

contents.verseText: They will roar together like young lions; they will growl like lion cubs.
contents: They will roar together like young lions;
they will growl like lion cubs.

contents.verseText: While they are flushed with heat, I will serve them a feast, and I will make them drunk so that they may revel; then they will fall asleep forever and never wake up, declares the LORD.
contents: While they are flushed with heat,
I will serve them a feast,
and I will make them drunk
so that they may revel;
then they will fall asleep forever and never wake up,
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with male goats.
contents: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter,
like rams with male goats.

contents.verseText: How Sheshach has been captured! The praise of all the earth has been seized. What a horror Babylon has become among the nations!
contents: How Sheshach

footnote.ft: Sheshach is a code name for Babylon.

contents: has been captured!
The praise of all the earth has been seized.
What a horror Babylon has become
among the nations!

contents.verseText: The sea has come up over Babylon; she is covered in turbulent waves.
contents: The sea has come up over Babylon;
she is covered in turbulent waves.

contents.verseText: Her cities have become a desolation, a dry and arid land, a land where no one lives, where no son of man passes through.
contents: Her cities have become a desolation,
a dry and arid land,
a land where no one lives,
where no son of man passes through.

contents.verseText: I will punish Bel in Babylon. I will make him spew out what he swallowed. The nations will no longer stream to him; even the wall of Babylon will fall.
contents: I will punish Bel in Babylon.
I will make him spew out what he swallowed.
The nations will no longer stream to him;
even the wall of Babylon will fall.

contents.verseText: Come out of her, My people! Save your lives, each of you, from the fierce anger of the LORD.
contents: Come out of her, My people!

footnote.ft: See Revelation 18:4.

contents: Save your lives, each of you,
from the fierce anger of the LORD.

contents.verseText: Do not let your heart grow faint, and do not be afraid when the rumor is heard in the land; for a rumor will come one year—and then another the next year—of violence in the land and of ruler against ruler.
contents: Do not let your heart grow faint,
and do not be afraid
when the rumor is heard in the land;
for a rumor will come one year—
and then another the next year—
of violence in the land
and of ruler against ruler.

contents.verseText: Therefore, behold, the days are coming when I will punish the idols of Babylon. Her entire land will suffer shame, and all her slain will lie fallen within her.
contents: Therefore, behold, the days are coming
when I will punish the idols of Babylon.
Her entire land will suffer shame,
and all her slain will lie fallen within her.

contents.verseText: Then heaven and earth and all that is in them will shout for joy over Babylon because the destroyers from the north will come against her,” declares the LORD.
contents: Then heaven and earth and all that is in them
will shout for joy over Babylon
because the destroyers from the north
will come against her,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “Babylon must fall on account of the slain of Israel, just as the slain of all the earth have fallen because of Babylon.
contents: “Babylon must fall
on account of the slain of Israel,
just as the slain of all the earth
have fallen because of Babylon.

contents.verseText: You who have escaped the sword, depart and do not linger! Remember the LORD from far away, and let Jerusalem come to mind.”
contents: You who have escaped the sword,
depart and do not linger!
Remember the LORD from far away,
and let Jerusalem come to mind.”

contents.verseText: “We are ashamed because we have heard reproach; disgrace has covered our faces, because foreigners have entered the holy places of the LORD’s house.”
contents: “We are ashamed because we have heard reproach;
disgrace has covered our faces,
because foreigners have entered
the holy places of the LORD’s house.”

contents.verseText: “Therefore, behold, the days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when I will punish her idols, and throughout her land the wounded will groan.
contents: “Therefore, behold, the days are coming,”
declares the LORD,
“when I will punish her idols,
and throughout her land the wounded will groan.

contents.verseText: Even if Babylon ascends to the heavens and fortifies her lofty stronghold, the destroyers I send will come against her,” declares the LORD.
contents: Even if Babylon ascends to the heavens
and fortifies her lofty stronghold,
the destroyers I send will come against her,”
declares the LORD.

contents.verseText: “The sound of a cry comes from Babylon, the sound of great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
contents: “The sound of a cry
comes from Babylon,
the sound of great destruction
from the land of the Chaldeans!

contents.verseText: For the LORD will destroy Babylon; He will silence her mighty voice. The waves will roar like great waters; the tumult of their voices will resound.
contents: For the LORD will destroy Babylon;
He will silence her mighty voice.
The waves will roar like great waters;
the tumult of their voices will resound.

contents.verseText: For a destroyer is coming against her—against Babylon. Her warriors will be captured, and their bows will be broken, for the LORD is a God of retribution; He will repay in full.
contents: For a destroyer is coming against her—
against Babylon.
Her warriors will be captured,
and their bows will be broken,
for the LORD is a God of retribution;
He will repay in full.

contents.verseText: I will make her princes and wise men drunk, along with her governors, officials, and warriors. Then they will fall asleep forever and not wake up,” declares the King, whose name is the LORD of Hosts.
contents: I will make her princes and wise men drunk,
along with her governors, officials, and warriors.
Then they will fall asleep forever
and not wake up,”
declares the King,
whose name is the LORD of Hosts.

contents.verseText: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: “Babylon’s thick walls will be leveled, and her high gates consumed by fire. So the labor of the people will be for nothing; the nations will exhaust themselves to fuel the flames.”
contents: This is what the LORD of Hosts says:
“Babylon’s thick walls will be leveled,
and her high gates consumed by fire.
So the labor of the people will be for nothing;
the nations will exhaust themselves to fuel the flames.”

contents.verseText: This is the message that Jeremiah the prophet gave to the quartermaster Seraiah son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went to Babylon with King Zedekiah of Judah in the fourth year of Zedekiah’s reign.
contents: This is the message that Jeremiah the prophet gave to the quartermaster Seraiah son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went to Babylon with King Zedekiah of Judah in the fourth year of Zedekiah’s reign.

contents.verseText: Jeremiah had written on a single scroll about all the disaster that would come upon Babylon—all these words that had been written concerning Babylon.
contents: Jeremiah had written on a single scroll about all the disaster that would come upon Babylon—all these words that had been written concerning Babylon.

contents.verseText: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you get to Babylon, see that you read all these words aloud,
contents: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you get to Babylon, see that you read all these words aloud,

contents.verseText: and say, ‘O LORD, You have promised to cut off this place so that no one will remain—neither man nor beast. Indeed, it will be desolate forever.’
contents: and say, ‘O LORD, You have promised to cut off this place so that no one will remain—neither man nor beast. Indeed, it will be desolate forever.’

contents.verseText: When you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and cast it into the Euphrates.
contents: When you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and cast it into the Euphrates.

contents.verseText: Then you are to say, ‘In the same way Babylon will sink and never rise again, because of the disaster I will bring upon her. And her people will grow weary.’” Here end the words of Jeremiah.
contents: Then you are to say, ‘In the same way Babylon will sink and never rise again, because of the disaster I will bring upon her. And her people will grow weary.’”
Here end the words of Jeremiah.

contents.verseText: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.
contents: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.

contents.verseText: And Zedekiah did evil in the sight of the LORD, just as Jehoiakim had done.
contents: And Zedekiah did evil in the sight of the LORD, just as Jehoiakim had done.

contents.verseText: For because of the anger of the LORD, all this happened in Jerusalem and Judah, until He finally banished them from His presence. And Zedekiah also rebelled against the king of Babylon.
contents: For because of the anger of the LORD, all this happened in Jerusalem and Judah, until He finally banished them from His presence.
And Zedekiah also rebelled against the king of Babylon.

contents.verseText: So in the ninth year of Zedekiah’s reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army. They encamped outside the city and built a siege wall all around it.
contents: So in the ninth year of Zedekiah’s reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army. They encamped outside the city and built a siege wall all around it.

contents.verseText: And the city was kept under siege until King Zedekiah’s eleventh year.
contents: And the city was kept under siege until King Zedekiah’s eleventh year.

contents.verseText: By the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine in the city was so severe that the people of the land had no food.
contents: By the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine in the city was so severe that the people of the land had no food.

contents.verseText: Then the city was breached; and though the Chaldeans had surrounded the city, all the men of war fled the city by night by way of the gate between the two walls near the king’s garden. They headed toward the Arabah,
contents: Then the city was breached; and though the Chaldeans

footnote.ft: That is, the Babylonians; similarly in verses 8, 9, 14, and 17

contents: had surrounded the city, all the men of war fled the city by night by way of the gate between the two walls near the king’s garden.
They headed toward the Arabah,

footnote.ft: Or the Jordan Valley

contents.verseText: but the army of the Chaldeans pursued the king and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho, and all his army was separated from him.
contents: but the army of the Chaldeans pursued the king and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho, and all his army was separated from him.

contents.verseText: The Chaldeans seized the king and brought him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced judgment on Zedekiah.
contents: The Chaldeans seized the king and brought him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced judgment on Zedekiah.

contents.verseText: There at Riblah the king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and he also killed all the officials of Judah.
contents: There at Riblah the king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and he also killed all the officials of Judah.

contents.verseText: Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him with bronze shackles, and took him to Babylon, where he kept him in custody until his dying day.
contents: Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him with bronze shackles, and took him to Babylon, where he kept him in custody until his dying day.

contents.verseText: On the tenth day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar’s reign over Babylon, Nebuzaradan captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, entered Jerusalem.
contents: On the tenth day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar’s reign over Babylon, Nebuzaradan captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, entered Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: He burned down the house of the LORD, the royal palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem—every significant building.
contents: He burned down the house of the LORD, the royal palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem—every significant building.

contents.verseText: And the whole army of the Chaldeans under the captain of the guard broke down all the walls around Jerusalem.
contents: And the whole army of the Chaldeans under the captain of the guard broke down all the walls around Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Then Nebuzaradan captain of the guard carried into exile some of the poorest people and those who remained in the city, along with the deserters who had defected to the king of Babylon and the rest of the craftsmen.
contents: Then Nebuzaradan captain of the guard carried into exile some of the poorest people and those who remained in the city, along with the deserters who had defected to the king of Babylon and the rest of the craftsmen.

contents.verseText: But Nebuzaradan captain of the guard left behind some of the poorest of the land to tend the vineyards and fields.
contents: But Nebuzaradan captain of the guard left behind some of the poorest of the land to tend the vineyards and fields.

contents.verseText: Moreover, the Chaldeans broke up the bronze pillars and stands and the bronze Sea in the house of the LORD, and they carried all the bronze to Babylon.
contents: Moreover, the Chaldeans broke up the bronze pillars and stands and the bronze Sea in the house of the LORD, and they carried all the bronze to Babylon.

contents.verseText: They also took away the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, dishes, and all the articles of bronze used in the temple service.
contents: They also took away the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, dishes, and all the articles of bronze used in the temple service.

contents.verseText: The captain of the guard also took away the basins, censers, sprinkling bowls, pots, lampstands, pans, and drink offering bowls—anything made of pure gold or fine silver.
contents: The captain of the guard also took away the basins, censers, sprinkling bowls, pots, lampstands, pans, and drink offering bowls—anything made of pure gold or fine silver.

contents.verseText: As for the two pillars, the Sea, the twelve bronze bulls under it, and the movable stands that King Solomon had made for the house of the LORD, the weight of the bronze from all these articles was beyond measure.
contents: As for the two pillars, the Sea, the twelve bronze bulls under it, and the movable stands that King Solomon had made for the house of the LORD, the weight of the bronze from all these articles was beyond measure.

contents.verseText: Each pillar was eighteen cubits tall and twelve cubits in circumference; each was hollow, four fingers thick.
contents: Each pillar was eighteen cubits tall and twelve cubits in circumference;

footnote.ft: Each pillar was approximately 27 feet high and 18 feet in circumference (8.2 meters high and 5.5 meters in circumference).

contents: each was hollow, four fingers thick.

contents.verseText: The captain of the guard also took away Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest of second rank, and the three doorkeepers.

contents.verseText: Of those still in the city, he took a court official who had been appointed over the men of war, as well as seven trusted royal advisers. He also took the scribe of the captain of the army, who had enlisted the people of the land, and sixty men who were found in the city.

contents.verseText: Nebuzaradan captain of the guard took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

contents.verseText: There at Riblah in the land of Hamath, the king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death. So Judah was taken into exile, away from its own land.
